loans.name: Njete Group

texts.en:
Justus is the facilitator of the Njete group. Justus and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Justus takes care of 16 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Justus had an excellent maize yield harvesting 13 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Justus was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Justus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Justus will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Njete group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Justus is pictured with his group members and the field officer appears on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man with three children, two of whom are enrolled in school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

Patrick has operated a cereal selling business for the past two years; in addition, he runs a goat meat and fish selling business. His clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of competition from other operators. He dreams of owning a fish shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 60,000, he wants to purchase cereal for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of their quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase cereal for resale.

loans.name: Sotoewa

texts.fr:
Sotoewa est une femme âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle n’a pas d’enfant.  
Sotoewa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1986. Elle fait le commerce de légumes et de produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients au grand marché. Elle achète les produits à lomé. Elle vend seule. 
Sotoewa a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des légumes et des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Sotoewa voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit changer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sotoewa is a 57-year-old woman. She is married to a driver and has no children.
Sotoewa has worked as a retailer since 1986. She sells vegetables and general food products to all types of customers at the grand market. She buys her products in Lomé. She works by herself.
Sotoewa has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy vegetables and general food products. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Sotoewa would like to increase the size of her business. She says that with her profits, she intends to change her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and general food products.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya. He is 32 years old and has 10 straight years in the farming business. His farm currently produces maize, milk, and beans for the local market. He is still single.

Charles has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for his poultry business venture. He says this will help him spread his farming risk associated with pests and dairy animal diseases. He is optimistic the business will grow and enable him to build a good financial foundation for his family.

He mentions crop failure and animal diseases as the major challenges in the business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
san Sebastian es el comité integrado por 11 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras D. la ciudad D. Villa Ygatimi, todas ellas son mujeres jefas D. familia, que día a día luchan por el sustento D. su familia. Ellas vieron en el programa D. la fundación paraguaya una excelente oportunidad D. progreso. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras, pero les gustaría poder ir más allá.
Un ejemplo D. lucha es la señora Ramona, quien cría y venD. animales, como ser gallinas, cerdos. Comenta que es muy sacrificado su trabajo, pues debe estar pendiente D. los animales que cría, para que los mismos no tengan ninguna enfermedad o problema. Comenta que este trabajo la ha ayudado mucho para crecer y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. gallinas y cerdos pequeños para la cría y posterior venta, pues ella quiere seguir progresando y creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
San Sebastián is the communal bank formed by 11 very hardworking women, fighters from the city of Villa Ygatimi.  All of the women are heads of household who struggle to support their families every day.  They saw in the Fundación Paraguaya program an excellent opportunity for progress.  They are currently in the first loan cycle of the program for women entrepreneurs, but they would like to be able to go beyond this.

One example of struggle is Ramona, who raises and sells animals, like chickens and pigs.  She says she is very selfless in her work, since she has to be devoted to the animals she raises, so they don't get any illness or have any problem.  She says this work has helped her a lot to grow and help her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy young chickens and pigs to raise and later sell, since she wants to continue progressing and growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens to raise and later sell.

loans.name: Midedji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIDEDJI est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même entourage. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Bernadine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Bernadine est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Benjamin. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Bernadine n’a jamais été à l’école, mais assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Bernadine vend des condiments et divers autres produits dans son quartier. Bernadine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Bernadine exerce cette activité depuis neuf ans. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Bernadine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIDEDJI, un troisième crédit. Les deux crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Midedji group is composed of three people who live in the same environment. Bernadine is the representative of the group and is raising her hand in the picture.

Bernadine is 46 years old and is married to a mechanic named Benjamin. They have two dependent children, both attending school. The children live together with their parents. Bernadine has never been to school, but handles jointly with her husband the various family expenditures.

To support herself and her children, Bernadine sells condiments and other products in her neighborhood. She resupplies her stock at a market in Benin. She has been carrying on this business activity for nine years.

Seeking for customer satisfaction and wanting to increase her turnover and income, Bernadine is now requesting, together with other Midedji group members, a third credit loan. The two previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy condiments and various items.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 50-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 10 and 19 years. All of them are in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan for two years.

Sadia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina operates a boutique from home. She sells beautiful clothes to her clients. Her clients include women of her community and shopkeepers at a nearby market.  She loves her profession and makes good sales and profits every month. 

Her husband runs a food selling business in the market. The taste of his food is very good and he has a good number of loyal clients who come to his shop everyday to eat. 

Zarina is the mother of six sons; her eldest works with his father and two are students.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to expand her boutique business.  With the loan, she will buy beads, threads and clothes needed to prepare beautiful and attractive looking clothes for selling.

She has operated her business for many years and is very confident about her success.

loans.use: to buy beads, threads and clothes needed to prepare beautiful and attractive looking clothes for selling.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 28 years old and single.  He has four years of experience sells various goods like: cosmetics, African clothes, shoes etc.  He currently employs two people and his business is open from 6 am to 8.30 pm daily, except Saturday.

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more goods to sell.  With the profits, Emmanuel would satisfy his basic needs, reinvest in his business and start saving for his future.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as: cosmetics, African clothes etc to sell.

loans.name: Généviéve

texts.fr:
Geneviève femme âgée de 52 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a deux enfants.
Geneviève travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1990. Elle vend du charbon de bois et des céréales pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Anié. Elle seule travaille. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficulté principale. 
Geneviève a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années Geneviève veut agrandir son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Geneviève is a 52-year-old woman. She is a widow and has two children.
Geneviève has worked as a retailer since 1990. She sells charcoal and cereals at home to all types of customers. She buys her products in Anié. She works by herself. At the moment, she is not faced with any major difficulties.
Geneviève has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal. She wants to reinvest in her business.
In the coming years, Geneviève wants to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she intends to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Savat's Group

texts.en:
Savat, 61, is widowed and has nine children, five of whom are married and two children are still in school. To earn a living, she has been farming on her rice field for 20 years. 

Savat leads a group of three female members in a rural area of Moung Russey district where the typical business is rice farming. She has been with VisionFund for four years and she completely repaid her loans with VisionFund. The loans from VisonFund help her to have enough capital for her rice plantation, family expenses, and children's study. She is now applying for a fifth loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and also hopes to earn more income to set aside some savings to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the rice fields

loans.name: Sedjlo Group

texts.fr: SEDJLO est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Eugénie Akouavi. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Eugénie Akouavi est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Epyphane. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Eugénie Akouavi vit avec son mari et son enfant. Eugénie Akouavi n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Eugénie Akouavi mène comme activité la vente de boissons et des produits divers (biscuits, etc.) dans son quartier depuis quatre ans. Eugénie Akouavi s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus , l'aidant ainsi à assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Eugénie Akouavi et aux autres membres du groupe SEDJLO de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
SEDJLO is a group comprised of three persons whose representative (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is named Eugénie Akouavi. The group members reside in the same district. With the goal of increasing its working capital, this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the second time. 

Eugénie Akouavi is 37 years old and married to a mason by the name of Epyphane. They have one child in school to support. Eugénie Akouavi lives with her husband and child and has never been to school. To support herself, she has had a business selling beverages and various goods (cookies, etc.) in her area for four years. Her supplies come from one of the markets in Benin. This business generates income for her, thus it helps her to cover the various family expenses. 

This second loan will surely allow Eugénie Akouavi and the other members of the group SEDJLO to boost their business and increase their customer base, as well as their revenues.

loans.use: to buy beverages

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 40,000 Kes loan to purchase three bales of maize flour, two bales of wheat flour, sugar and beans for resale. In the future, Saumu aspires to continue improving her business.

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Saumu has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase three bales of maize flour, two bales of wheat flour, sugar and beans for resale.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Virgen del Rosario es denominado el comité de la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi. Todas ellas son muy trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy emprendedoras. El principal sueño de ellas es progresar y salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto. El objetivo de todas es poder mejorar sus ingresos y de esa forma ayudar ayudar a sus hijos y familiares.
Una de ellas es la señora Carmen, quien se dedica a la cría de animales. Comenta que su trabajo es muy cansador y agotador, pero que pese a ello le gusta lo que hace. Este es el medio por el cual ella mantiene a su familia y cubre sus gastos diarios, es por eso que le gustaría seguir invirtiendo en el. Por eso solicita el crédito para la compra de animales pequeños, los cuales criará y venderá. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Virgen del Rosario is the name of the communal bank in the city of Villa Ygatimí.  All of the members are very hard-working and very enterprising fighters.  Their main dream is to progress and get ahead by means of working together.  The goal of all of them is to be able to improve their earnings and in that way help their children and family members.

One of them is Carmen, who works raising animals.  She says her job is tiring and exhausting, but in spite of this she likes what she does.  This is how she supports her family and covers her daily expenses.  This is why she would like to continue investing in it.

For this reason she is requesting the loan to buy small animals that she will raise and sell.

She is grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for the opportunity the loan is giving her.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and later sell.

loans.name: Jua Kali Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Jua Kali Group in Western Kenya! Benard is the facilitator of the Jua Kali group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Benard takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Benard had a good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benard was only able to harvest 5 1/2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benard and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Benard will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Jua Kali group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maly's Group

texts.en:
Maly, a 22-year-old mother of one, has been farming on her rice field for five years. She also raises pigs to generate additional income for her family.

Maly now leads a group of five female members in a village located in the Moung Russey district where rice farming is common. Having received two previous loans from VisionFund, she is now requesting her third to buy fertilizer for the rice field and feeds for her pigs. This loan will help to increase her crop yield and ensure the health of her pigs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field and feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru: Ислом трудолюбивый человек, ему 41 год. Он женат и у них четверо детей. Ислом с детства интересовался скотоводством, а когда он вырос начал заниматься этим. Более 11 лет он продолжает скотоводство и успешен в своем бизнесе. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Он запрашивает займ в размере 5000 сомони для пополнения оборотного капитала и покупки скота.  Ислом надеется на вашу помощь, который позволяет ему улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Islom is a hardworking man, he is 41 years old. He is married and has four children. Islom was interested in animal husbandry since childhood and when he grew up he began to do it. He does animal husbandry for more than eleven years and is successful in this business. He wants to expand it and get good profit. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to refill his working capital and buy cattle. Islom hopes for your help which will let him improve the livelihood of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, nommée Germaine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Augustin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Germaine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Germaine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis cinq ans, Germaine vend des charbons de bois dans son quartier, activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Germaine achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Germaine et les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MAHUGNON is a 3-people group; its members all live in the same district. The group’s representative, named Germaine, is raising her hand in the picture. She is 37 years old and married to a man named Augustin. The couple has three children in their care, who all go to school. Germaine lives together with her husband and children. Together, the couple provides for their household.
Germaine did not go to school. For five years, she has been selling charcoal locally. She earns good revenues through this business.  Germaine purchases her products from a market in Benin.
This is the second time that Germaine and group MAHUGNON’s other members are requesting ALIDé’s financial support in order to increase their working capital, grow their business, and better satisfy their customers. The first loan was repaid punctually.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Shikamana Group

texts.en:
Zibora is the facilitator of the Shikamana group. Zibora and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Zibora and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Zibora takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to access fertilizer and hybrid seed. With income from her maize sales, Zibora will save for future use and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Shikamana group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Zibora with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman with three children. Two of her children are enrolled in school while one is too young for school. Her husband is a mason who contributes to the family's basic needs. Khadija owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Khadija has operated a poultry selling business for the past three years. Her potential clients are café and butcher owners. She faces a major challenge which is competition from other operators. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase chicken feed for her chicks. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed for her chicks.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who drives a wagon used to transport people for profit. With the loan, he will repair his wagon because its engine is creating problems and needs to be repaired.  By repairing his wagon, he will be able to run his wagon more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers.

Zarina is very supportive by nature and makes handkerchiefs.  She sells these handkerchiefs to different stores in the city for reasonably good profits. Zarina is very caring and started her business because her husband was not able to afford the living expenses of their family.

She is the mother of five children.  Her elder son is married and also a driver by profession.  Both of her daughters help her make handkerchiefs and her two other sons are students.

Zarina is a new loan applicant and very hopeful that her husband will be able to improve his income and that she will save some profits every month for her daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: to repair wagon for transport business.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Katupyry es un grupo integrado por 18 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú. Ellas tienen como objetivo principal mejorar su estilo de vida, ya que ellas son mujeres de escasos recursos y quieres salir adelante. Al escuchar hablar del programa de la fundación quedaron encantadas por lo que decidieron darse la oportunidad.
Elodia es una mujeres muy trabajadora, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, mediante la cual ayuda con los ingresos de la casa. Comenta que trabaja desde muy temprano, pues desde tempranas horas ya tiene clientes. Entre sus metas está seguir creciendo y expandirse para agrandar su negocio.
Solicita el crédito para abastecer su despensa con azúcar, harina, huevo,aceite, fideo, golosinas, carne; frutas, verduras, leche y demás, con lo cual piensa que podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Kuña Katupyry” is a group of 18 women from the city of Caaguazú. Their main goal is to improve their lifestyle. They are women of limited resources who want to get ahead. Upon hearing about the program with Fundación Paraguaya, they were delighted with the opportunity being given to them and decided to take action.

Elodia is one of these hardworking women. She has a well-stocked food pantry, which helps her to generate household income. Elodia says that she begins her work very early because she already has customers in the mornings. Her goals include continuing to grow and expanding the size of her business.

She is requesting a loan so that she can stock her food pantry with sugar, flour, eggs, oil, noodles, candy, meat, fruit, vegetables, milk, and other products. By restocking her inventory, she will be able to keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, eggs, oil, noodles, candy, meat, fruit, vegetables, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Luzy

texts.en:
Luzy is aged 52 and married with three children. The last two are still in school. She has been in farming for over 15 years and produces maize, beans, coffee and milk which she sells at her local market in Nkubu area of Central Kenya.

Luzy has requested  a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. She will purchase poultry birds for 20,000 KES and dairy goats for 20,000 KES in order to boost her farming. She says says the income generated will help her feed and educate her children. She also wants to start a cereal shop where she will sell cereals sourced both from her farm and from other farmers in the area.

She appreciates the help Juhudi has given to farmers by providing farming loans.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats and poultry birds.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарине 26 лет, замужем и растит двухлетнего сына. Зарина получила высшее образование по специальности экономист  и занималась торговлей в  соседнем Казахстане. В 2008 году она вышла замуж, и переехала к мужу в г. Жалал-Абад. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Зарина начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания и мыломоющими средствами.  Взяв в аренду торговое место на рынке, Зарина приложила все усилия для развития бизнеса и добилась успеха – она смогла приобрести маленькую квартиру и провести там  ремонт. На сегодняшний день, ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, поэтому Зарина обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Закуп товаров позволит ей расширить ассортимент, увеличить количество клиентов и повысить продажи.  В будущем, в бизнесе - Зарина хочет открыть свой собственный  магазин, а в семье – завести еще детей.
texts.en: Zarina is 26 years old, married and is raising a two-year-old son.  She obtained higher education as an economist and was involved in sales in the neighboring Kazakhstan.  Zarina got married in 2008 and moved in with her husband in the town of Jalal-Abad.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business of selling food products and cleaning supplies.  She leased a retail outlet and put all of her efforts toward developing her business, and achieved success.  Zarina was able to purchase a small apartment and make repairs to it.  Today, she does not have an abundance of product selection, and, therefore, Zarina requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  Purchase of merchandise will allow her to expand her selection, increase the number of customers and have higher sales.  In the future, Zarina wants to open her own store and for the family, to have more children.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Mungano Youth Group

texts.en:
Alex is the facilitator of the Mungano group. Alex and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alex takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Alex had a good maize yield harvesting 7 ½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alex was only able to harvest 3 ½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alex and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Alex will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mungano Youth group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Alex is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Phin's Group

texts.en:
Phin, aged 31, is married and has three children who all are still in school. To make a living, she has been farming on her three-hectare farmland for 9 years. In addition, to better feed the family, her husband works as a construction worker and sometimes catches fish for sale. 

Phin leads a group of three female members in a rural area where the typical business is rice farming. This is her second loan with VisionFund. The loan from VisionFund helped her to generate a regular income. Now she is requesting another loan. She wants to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. 

With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and earn more income so as to better feed her family. She also wants to build up savings for her children and for future needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo "EL PROGRESO" es un comité D. 11 mujeres D. buena estructura, unidas, diligentes y fraternal entre ellas. Estas señoras son D. la ciudad D. Villarrica. Se reúnen una vez por semana para brindar apoyo y ayuda unas a otras en sus afanes D. mejorar su situación económica.
La mayoría D. estas microempresarias se dedican a la venta D. crochet y ropas.
Las integrantes del comité "EL PROGRESO" son perseverantes y tienen la intencion D. seguir participando en este programa D. microcrédito, para  dar continuidad al crecimiento y mejoramiento D. sus ingresos económicos.
Además D. las actividades solidarias que tienen, las integrantes D. este grupo manifestaron que anhelan abrir una microempresa en donD. todas juntas podrian trabajar e ir creciendo. Seguirán esforzandose en esto, ya que todas  tienen predisposición y muchas ganas D. seguir sobresaliendo con sus metas para el futuro.
La señora Isabel confecciona y venD. las ropas que hace, ella es una mujer sacrificada, a pesar D. los dolores que pueda sentir con el correr D. los años no deja D. trabajar en pos del progreso y D. la mejora D. la calidad D. vida, su deseo es poder salir adelante junto con sus amigas y familia, pues sabe que en el país es muy duro sobresalir pero a pesar D. eso nunca se rinD., lucha cada día con entereza y perseverancia, por eso hoy día solicita un micro crédito para adquirir más telas y materiales necesarios para la confección y posterior venta D. sus prendas.
texts.en:
This group, called 'Progress', is a committee of 11 structured and diligent women who are united and sisterly to each other. The ladies live in the city of Villarrica and in their eagerness to improve their economic situation they meet once a week to proviD. support and help to each other.

The majority of these entrepreneurs sell crochet work and clothing. The committee members are very determined, and intend to continue participating in the microcredit program to continue to grow their businesses and improve their income. 

In addition to solidarity activities, the members say that they wish to open a small business where they all could work and grow together. They will continue their efforts towards this, as all have a similar predisposition and eagerness to reach their goals for the future.

Mrs. Isabel makes and sells clothes. She has sacrificed her life and although she has felt pain over the years, she continues to work toward progress and to improve her quality of life. Her desire is to succeed together with her ​​friends and family. She knows that it is hard to excel in her country, but she never gives up and struggles every day with courage and perseverance. Isabel is now requesting a micro loan to buy more fabrics and materials for the manufacture and subsequent sale of her garments.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and sewing materials for producing clothes

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with six children. Five of her children are enrolled in school while one is married. Her husband who is employed also contributes to the family's basic needs. Christine owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Christine has operated a real estate business for the past ten years; her potential clients are the residents of the local area. She faces a major challenge of late rent payment from tenants. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KSH 40,000 loan she wants to purchase building blocks, ceiling materials and pay for the services for her rental house. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase building blocks, ceiling materials and pay for the services for her rental house.

loans.name: Kichangani Group

texts.en:
Asia, who is in her early 30s, is single with three children who go to school.  Since 2007 she has had a variety of businesses including a clothing shop, selling cosmetics, hair braids and drinks. She works from 7 a.m to 10 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling cosmetics and increase all her businesses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. This loan is to increase her stock of cosmetics.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kichangani" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Unidas De Saguazu Group

texts.es:
El comite lleva por nombre Unidas de Saguazu, debido a que el grupo es bastante unido. Ellas han asumido el compromiso de  mantener unido el grupo y trabajar con responsabilidad y respeto mutuo. Actualmente se encuentran en el  noveno ciclo, integrado por  17 mujeres quienes invierten sus prestamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Dominga es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, ella todos los días trabaja mucho. Se dedica a la costura, el cual ha sido el medio para mantener a su familia desde hace varios años. Ella comenta que siempre tiene muchos pedidos y trabajos por hacer por lo que a veces pareciera que el tiempo no le alcanza. Para poder cumplir con esos pedidos es que ella solicita el crédito, para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas y demás insumos , los cuales les está de mucha utilidad. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The committee named “Unidas de Saguazu” is a very close group. They have made the commitment to maintain a unified group and to work with responsibility and mutual respect. The group is currently in its ninth loan cycle with 17 women who have invested their loans in their respective business activities.

Dominga is a hardworking and determined woman. She works a great deal every day. Dominga is a seamstress and has been supporting her family in this manner for several years. She says that she always has orders and work to complete. Sometimes she does not have enough hours in a day to do everything. In order to complete her orders, she is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, thread, needles, and other supplies that are useful. Dominga is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, needles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Umidjon

texts.ru: Умидджон занимается купле- продажей скота. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. В собственном доме он имеет огромный хлев и там содержит 3 голов крупного рогатого скота и 2 голов мелкого рогатого скота, а также в запасе имеет корм для скота и для этого он хочет расширить свой бизнес. С этой целью он запрашивает займ. В свободное время он занимается другим видом бизнеса, он предоставляет услуги такси в своем городе.
texts.en: Umidjon does buying and selling of cattle. He is married and has two children. He has a large cattle stable in his home where he keeps three heads of large horned and two heads of small horned cattle, as well as fodder and wants to expand his business. He is asking for a loan with this purpose. In his spare time he does another business, he provides taxi services in his town.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Baya

texts.en:
Baya is a married man with three children. One of his children is enrolled in school, the other two are still young for school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the family's basic needs. Baya owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and water. 

Baya has operated an electronics workshop for the past ten years; his potential clients are local residents. He faces a major challenge which is competition from other operators. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the KES 100,000 loan he wants to purchase electronic spare parts for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access financial services to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase electronic spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married with six children ranging from three to 25 years old. He has been a farmer for 15 years and currently employs one farmhand. He sells corn, milk and chickens to the local market. He is also a government employee.

Simon has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his poultry business by buying more birds. He says he wants to focus on farming in a bigger and better way and to buy a motor vehicle to help in making his deliveries on time. He says that part of his additional income will help pay to educate his children.

He sees the high feeding costs for dairy animals as a challenge.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is a farmer from the village of Kurdghelauri, East Georgia. He is 49 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife Maya and their 19-year-old son. Maya works as a baker. Vazha earns his living through the family's agricultural activities. They have one pig and sell, on average, 12 piglets per year. Also Vazha grows corn on their 0.8 hectare of land. Part of the harvested maize is used to feed domestic animals and half is sold on the local market. The total average monthly income for the family is 500 Laris per month. 

Vazha has requested credit to purchase calves. He will feed them during the winter months and sell the grown calves for a higher price in the spring. The family's additional profit will be used to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Mahuna Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUNA est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Clarisse est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Clarisse est âgée de 32 ans, et est mariée à un certain Jean Marie. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge et dont certains sont scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, Clarisse et son mari ont un autre enfant vivant à leur charge. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Clarisse n'a pas été à l'école, mais a appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce depuis quatre ans et qui lui permet d'assurer ses différentes charges. Parallèlement à cette activité, Clarisse vend des mèches et des produits de beauté dans son atelier situé dans son quartier.Clarisse achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Clarisse et les autres membres du groupe MAHUNA sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MAHUNA Group is made up of three women who live in the same area. The group's representative, named Clarisse, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

She's 32 years old and married to one Jean Marie. The couple has four children whom they have to support. Some of them attend school.

In addition to their own children, Clarisse and her husband have another child to support. The couple provides for the household together.

Clarisse never attended school, but got trained in hairdressing, a business she's been running for four years and which enables her to provide for herself.

In parallel, Clarisse sells hair extensions and beauty products in her workshop located in her neighborhood. She purchases her supplies in a market in Benin.

This is the third time that Clarisse and the other members of the MAHUNA Group are seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. This loan will enable them to bolster their businesses in order to better meet customer demand.

Previous loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more pairs of lesos for resale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La Sra. Norma tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera, tiene una pareja, tiene 4 hijos quienes aun son pequeños. Todos viven en su casa de la ciudad de Curuguaty.
Ella es dueña de un Taller de refrigeración, moto y gomería, el cual montaron con muchos sacrificio y esfuerzo. Hoy en día es la única fuente de ingreso de la familia, ya que su pareja es mecánico y trabaja en el taller, donde también sus hijos son sus son ayudantes.
Hace como 6 años que se dedican a esto, por lo que ya tienen muy buena experiencia. Comenta que brinda servicios a las zonas de Araujo Cúe, Acepar, Manduara y Yasy Cañy, realizando visitas en el domicilio del cliente de acuerdo a la necesidad.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para motos, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio, para poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma is 32 years old and single. She and her partner have four young children. They all live in their home in the city of Curuguaty.

Norma is the owner of a refrigeration, motorcycle, and tire repair shop that she established through great sacrifice and effort. Today it is the only source of income for her family. Her partner is a mechanic and works in the shop. Their children work as his assistants. Norma has managed her business for six years and she has acquired very good experience. She says that they provide services to the Districts of Araujo Cúe, Acepar, Manduara, and Yasy Cañy since they will visit the customer’s home when necessary.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy motorcycle parts, which will be of great help to her business since she will be able to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Dotou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DOTOU est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même zone. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Clémentine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Clémentine est âgée de 28 ans, et est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Éric. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Clémentine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Clémentine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis trois ans, Clémentine vend des chaussures et des savons dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet d’assurer ses diverses charges et ceux de ses enfants. Clémentine achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la sixième fois que Clémentine et les autres membres du groupe DOTOU sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
DOTOU Group is made up of three persons who live in the same area. The group's representative, named Clémentine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 28 years old and married to a welder named Eric.

The couple has two school-attending children, whom they have to support. Clémentine lives together with her husband and their children. She never attended school.

For three years, Clémentine has been selling shoes and soaps in her neighborhood, which enables her to provide for herself and her children. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin.

This is the sixth time that Clémentine and the other members of DOTOU Group are seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses and better meet customer demand.

Previous loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soaps and shoes

loans.name: Esteban Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Esteban tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos. Tiene un ciber y realiza trabajos a computadora en su domicilio de la ciudad de Itá, decidió iniciar ese negocio ya que sabe mucho de informática gracias a su trabajo anterior como secretario de un instituto de informática.
Tiene varias computadoras propias, y nos comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, desea comprar una computadora mas que lo ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
El señor Esteban es muy emprendedor y desea llevar a cabo dicho emprendimiento causa por la cual acude a Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva para obtener el crédito. Agradece por esta oportunidad que se le da, pues es muy importante para el.
texts.en:
Sr. Esteban is 38 years old, single, and has no children. He manages a cybercafé and performs computer work from his home in the city of Itá. Esteban decided to start this business because he gained a great deal of knowledge about computer systems from his previous job as an assistant at a computer institute.

He owns several computers and says that he has done very well in his business. Esteban wants to buy another computer to help improve his income. He is very enterprising and wants to keep his venture in operation. Therefore, he approached Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva in order to obtain a loan. He is grateful for the opportunity that has been given because his business is very important to him.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his cybercafé.

loans.name: Medude

texts.en:
Medude is a 51-year-old married woman with four children. Two of them are in school while two have completed school. Her husband, Joseph, is a businessman who contributes to the family income. She owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Medude has operated a vegetable grocery for the past ten years. Her clients are the local area residents. Her major challenge is poor transportation. She dreams of starting a grain business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase more vegetables and grain for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and grains for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread for embroidering.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
16 mujeres con ganas de progresar y salir adelante unieron esfuerzos y de allí surgió la formación del comité llamado 8 de diciembre, el cual se encuentra en su tercer ciclo. Todas las integrantes tienen sus actividades independientes, pero también hacen actividades juntas para que de esa forma puedan fomentar el compañerismo entre ellas.
Una de ellas es la señora Lucia, quien se dedica al reciclado de botellas, latas, plásticos y demás tipos de materiales, nos dice que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pues recorre las calles buscando los materiales que recicla. Comenta que su trabajo le enorgullece mucho pues es muy honrado. Ella quiere seguir con su negocio y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de botellas, cartones y demás, los cuales venderá por cantidad y tendrá una mejor ganancia.
texts.en:
Sixteen women who want to progress and move forward have joined their efforts to form a committee called December 8th, which is in its third loan cycle. All of the members have independent business activities, but they also participate in joint projects that help build camaraderie among them.

One of the members is Sra. Lucia. She recycles bottles, cans, plastics, and other types of materials. Lucia says that her work requires great sacrifice because it requires that she walk along the streets in search of recyclable materials. She says that she is proud of what she does because it is very honorable work. Lucia wants to continue with her business, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy bottles, cardboard, and other materials that she can sell in large quantities as a way of earning more income.

loans.use: to buy bottles, cardboard, and other materials.

loans.name: Saidia Shg Group

texts.en:
Mildred is the facilitator of the Saidia SHG group. Mildred and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mildred takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to grow quality farm produce and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mildred had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mildred was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mildred and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from her maize sales, Mildred will educate her children and invest in business and livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Saidia SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Mildred is pictured with her group members. Standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Oñondivepa 2 Group

texts.es:
Oñondicepa 2 es un comité de la ciudad de Asunción, esta integrado por 17 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, quienes desean un mejor porvenir para sus hijos y familiares. Se encuentra en su 5 ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las que integrantes, desean poder seguir dentro del programa de la fundación.
Una de ellas es la señora Eva, quien desde hace ya un tiempo se dedica a la venta de ropas, en lo cual ella se define que es muy buena, pues gracias a su simpatía y buena atención a los clientes y sumado a su buena calidad de ropas, ha logrado salir adelante. Quiere seguir con su microempresa, por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, lo cual le servirá para abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Oñondivepa 2” is a committee from the city of Asunción that consists of 17 hardworking and enterprising women. They want a better future for their children and families. The group is in its fifth loan cycle, which highlights the sense of responsibility and the desire to progress from each of its members. They all want to continue in the program with Fundación Paraguaya.

One of the members is Sra. Eva. She has been selling clothes for some time. Eva has done very well because of her friendliness, the good service she provides to her customers, and offering good quality clothes. As a result, she has been able to get ahead. Eva wants to continue her micro-enterprise, so she is requesting a loan to buy summer clothing in order to restock her inventory and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jitegemee A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Jitegemee A Group in Western Kenya! Pauline is the facilitator of the Jitegemee A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. As with the majority of people in this part of Kenya, Pauline and her group members are farmers who rely heavily on small-scale maize production for food security and income.

Pauline takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Pauline had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 11 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Pauline was only able to harvest 1 bag of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pauline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Pauline will pay for major annual expenses such as school fees and livestock investments.

In 2012, the members of Jitegemee A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Pauline is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a 30-year-old single lady who owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transport. 

Luvuno has operated a broom-selling business for the past twelve years. Her clients are the local area residents. Her major challenge is the lack of raw materials to make her products. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more raw materials to make brooms. She decided to join Yehu because they offer quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials to make brooms.

loans.name: Mwinyi

texts.en:
Mwinyi is a married man with six children who attend school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the family income. He owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Mwinyi has operated a retail shop for the past six months. His clients are casual workers from the local area. His major challenge is transporting his goods. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase more corn flour, wheat flour, sugar, and also chicks for his new poultry business. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase corn flour, wheat flour, sugar, and also chicks for his new poultry business.

loans.name: Mahmadkul

texts.ru: Махмадкул более 20 лет занимается изготовлением и выпечкой лепёшек. Его пекарня находится в центре местного рынка. У него два работника, которым он выплачивает зарплату. Его жена помогает ему в продаже  на рынке готовой продукции. Каждый день они изготавливают и продают по 200-250 шт. лепёшек. Лепешки востребованы всегда. От этого бизнеса он получает хорошую прибыль. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес  и на полученную прибыль отремонтировать свой дом.  Махмадкул запрашивает займ для расширения бизнеса, закупа сырья для выпечки.
texts.en: Mahmadkul has been preparing and baking flatbread for over 20 years. His bakery is in the middle of the local market. He has two paid employees. His wife helps him in selling the baked goods at the market. Every day they bake and sell about 200-250 pieces of flatbread. Flatbread is always in demand. Mahmadkul receives a good income from this business. He would like to expand his business and  use the resulting revenues to pay for house repairs. Mahmadul is requesting a loan for expanding his business by stocking up on raw products for his bakery.

loans.use: to expand his business [by stocking up on raw products for his bakery].

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El comité Fortaleza nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en la zona. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Ellas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
La Sra. Maria es la presidenta del grupo tiene 38 años, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y capaz de liderar un grupo numeroso como lo es este, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación y mucha confianza. Ella comenta que tiene una librería bien equipada donde tiene todo tipo de productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cuadernos, bolígrafos, pinceles, libros y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecer su local.
texts.en:
The Fortaleza (“Strength”) Committee was born thanks to the management and support of another Committee that was working in the area of the town of San Lorenzo, where Fortaleza comes from. The members of this committee have set the economic and personal growth of each one of them as their primary goal. They are known in their area as hardworking and tenacious women.
Maria is the president of the group and she is 38 years old. She is a very resourceful woman, and she is very good at leading such a big group as this one. During all of their cycles she has been noted for her desire to grow and for being deeply trustworthy. She says she runs a well-furnished bookshop where she keeps all kinds of products.
She is requesting a loan to buy notepads, pens, paintbrushes, books and other items to stock up her shop.

loans.use: To buy notepads, pens, paintbrushes and books to stock up her shop.

loans.name: Tariel

texts.en:
Tariel is from the village of Chikaani, East Georgia. He is 47 years old and lives with his family: wife, a daughter, a son and mother in law. The children go to school. Tareiel is a war veteran. He has health problems and receives a monthly pension from the state. He runs the family farm. They have four milk cows and sell an average of 50 kg. of cheese every month on the on local market. The family also has two pigs and sells 22-24 piglets per year. Tariel also grows corn on the family-owned plot of land. Most of the corn is used for feeding the domestic animals. The rest is sold locally. 

Tariel has requested credit to purchase two milk cows. He will produce and sell 50% more cheese. It will increase the profit of the family farm. He plans to use the profit for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows.

loans.name: Kidodo

texts.en:
Kidodo is a married woman with five children. Three of them attend school while two have completed school. Her husband, Guni, is a farmer who contributes to the family income. She owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Kidodo has operated a retail shop for the past three years. She also runs a motorbike transportation business and a charcoal-selling business. Her clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her shop into a wholesale shop.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase more corn flour, wheat flour, sugar and soap for her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more corn flour, wheat flour, sugar and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a divorced woman with four children who are enrolled in school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mwaka has operated a café for the past three years. Her clients are the local area residents. Her major challenge is sufficient capital to expand her business. She dreams of establishing a grocery in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase corn flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil for her cafe. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase corn flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil for her cafe.

loans.name: Sango Shg Group

texts.en:
Rose is the facilitator of the Sango SHG group. Rose and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had a very good maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Rose was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Rose will educate her children and pay back her loans.

In 2012, the members of Sango SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Rose is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy six gallons of palm oil to expand her business

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr:
Mme Aida est une femme de 44 ans qui loge dans un village pas loin du centre-ville qui tend a se développer  grâce  à l’accroissement de la population .Elle est mariée  et mère de famille.
Aida est marchande depuis 19 ans. Elle vend de l’arachide, du niébé  de l’huile…
Avec le crédit elle veut augmenter ses marchandises.
Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne du foyer en se chargeant de l’achat du savon utilisé par les membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aida is a 44-year-old woman who lives in a village not far from the downtown area, which tends to expand along with population growth.

She is married and a mother. Aida has been a retail merchant for the past 19 years. She sells peanuts, niébé (black-eyed peas), vegetable oil,...

She intends to use her loan to increase her stock supply.

She participates in daily household expenditures by purchasing the soap used by her family.

loans.use: buy peanuts, vegetable oil, niébé (black-eyed peas)

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is a married man with four children who are enrolled in school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the family income. He owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Kassim has operated a café for the past two years. His clients are his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge is the lack of storage for his stock of food. He dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase corn flour, wheat flour, sugar and rice for his café. He decided to join Yehu to acquire the funds to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase corn flour, wheat flour, sugar and rice for his café.

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
El comité Espíritu Santo surgió de la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Las integrantes pudieron formar un grupo bien unido y trabajador, quienes ya son muy conocidas en el barrio por su trabajo.
La Sra Gloria es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella se define como una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora, quien diariamente lucha por el sustento de su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, como ser camisas, pantalones y demás, mediante el cual pueda cubrir sus necesidades.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, como ser shorts, camisillas y demás, ya que se acerca la época de calor y quiere estar preparada.
texts.en:
The Espíritu Santo (“Holy Ghost”) Committee was born thanks to the management and support of another Committee that was working in their area. The members were able to create a tightly united and hardworking group, and they are very well-known in their neighborhood for their work.
Gloria is one of the members of the group. She considers herself to be a very resourceful and hardworking woman, who daily strives to provide for her family. She engages in selling all kinds of clothes, such as shirts, trousers and other items, a mean to help her pay for her necessities.
As the heath season is approaching, she is requesting a loan to buy summer clothes such as shorts, T-shirts and other items in order to have a full stock to sell.

loans.use: To buy items of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Rajab is applying for another loan for his business. He will use this 80,000 Kes loan to purchase a new motorbike. In the future, Rajab hopes to continue expanding his business. 

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Rajab has greatly improved his family’s standard of living. He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.fr:
Marie Rose  est née au Rwanda et a 37 ans. Elle est mariée avec 5 enfants de 5 à 15 ans, tous sont scolarisés. Marie Rose a une autre personne en charge. Son niveau d’éducation est 2 ans de secondaire.

C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter une moto qu’elle va utiliser en transport rémunéré des personnes. L’accident de sa moto peut être la seule chose qui peut entrainer le mauvais remboursement de ce prêt.

Marie Rose voudrait offrir le service de qualité en service de transport. Elle va faire son mieux pour faire le suivi quotidien du chauffeur de sa moto. Marie Rose a une vision d’offrir plus tard le service de transport rémunéré des personnes avec une voiture au lieu de moto.  Avec le profit  Marie Rose va continuer la scolarisation de ses enfants, et elle va améliorer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Rose was born in Rwanda and is 37 years old. She is married with five children from 5 to 15 years old, all of whom are in school.  Marie Rose supports one other person.  She has two years of secondary education.

This is her first loan cycle with ACB.  She will use her loan to purchase a motorbike that she will use to provide paid transportation services.  Possibly the only thing that would inhibit her proper repayment of the loan would be an accident involving the motorbike.

Marie Rose would like to offer quality service in transportation.  She will do her best to follow the daily activity of the driver of her motorbike.  Marie Rose has a vision to later offer paid transportation services with a car instead of a motorbike.  With the profits, Marie Rose will continue the schooling of her children and improve the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike, which she will use for paid transportation services.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with seven children: five are enrolled in school while two are still young for school. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the family income. He owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Ali has operated a retail shop for the past two years. His clients are his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge is fluctuating commodities prices. He dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase more corn flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil for his shop. He decided to join Yehu because of its quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more corn flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil for his shop.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El señor Angel, está casado,  tiene 55 años, tiene hijos, pero ya son todos mayores, viven en la ciudad de Caacupé.
El tiene una  despensa, la cual es su medio de subsistencia, y la forma en que ayuda en la casa. El comenta que cada 8 de diciembre, la ciudad de Caacupé reúne a miles de paraguayos, pues es el día de la Virgen Paraguaya, es decir la Virgen de Caacupé. Es en esos días que tiene muchas ventas, y lo cual le trae buenos ingresos.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de productos de alfarería, como ser figuras de la virgen y demás tipo, con lo cual podrá abastecerse, pues en esa época es lo que más se vende y lo que más ganancias traen. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Angel is 55 years old, he is married with grown-up children, and they live in the town of Caacupé.
He runs a small store that is his source of income and his way to help his family. He says that every year on December 8 thousands of Paraguayans gather together in the town of Caacupé to celebrate the day of the Paraguayan Virgin, that is the Virgin of Caacupé. It is during these days that he sells the most, therefore earning a good income.
He is requesting a loan to buy pottery products, such as statues of the Virgin and of other kinds in order to stock up his shop, as in those days this is what he sells the most and what makes him earn more money. He is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity he has been given.

loans.use: To buy pottery souveniers to sell.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man with two children. One attends school while the other is still too young for school. He owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Said has operated a retail shop for the past seven years. He also owns a grocery. His potential clients are his neighbors. His major challenge is customers not paying their debts on time. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase more sugar, rice, maize flour and vegetables for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of their fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, rice, maize flour and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Kibisi Central B Group

texts.en:
Hellen is the facilitator of the Kibisi Central B group. Hellen and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hellen and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Hellen takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to get skills about farming and to access fertilizers and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Hellen had a very good maize yield, harvesting 26 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Hellen was only able to harvest 12 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Hellen will educate her children and  ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Kibisi Central B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows 7 people; 6 women and 1 man.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mulongo

texts.en:
Mulongo is a married woman with three children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family income. She owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mulongo has been weaving items (mats and baskets) and selling them for the past six years. Her clients are people at the marketplace. Her major challenge is customers not paying their debts on time. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase more mats and baskets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access their quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more mats and baskets for resale.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la cuidad de Caacupé, son en total 10 mujeres. Ellas se encuentran en el primer ciclo, todas ellas tienen muchas ganas de progresar y de salir adelante. Ellas están agradecidas por formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
Una de  las señoras es Rosa, quien con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir  adelante por medio de su trabajo. Ella se dedica a la venta de Carbón, en lo que dice que le va muy bien, pues últimamente el carbón se ha convertido en un medio alternativo en vez del gas.
Ella solicita el crédito para el abastecimiento de su stock, pues con eso podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The women of this Committee come from the town of Caacupé, and they are 10 in total. They are working their first cycles, and all of them have a strong desire to progress and to get on in life. They are grateful to be part of the entrepreneur women program of the Fundación.
Rosa is one of the members. With great effort she has succeeded in getting on in life thanks to her job. She engages in selling charcoal, and she says things are going very well since charcoal recently becoming an alternative to gas.
She is requesting a loan to stock up with charcoal in order to satisfy her customers’ requests. She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity she has been granted.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Franco

texts.en:
Franco is a married man with three school aged children. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. Franco owns a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children.

Franco has operated a poultry business for the past six years.  His potential clients are the local area café and hotel owners. He faces a major challenge of lack of enough market to sell his products. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase more chicks and chicken feed for his business. He decided to join Yehu because of their favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feed for his business.

loans.name: Margalita

texts.en:
Margalita is from the village Khandaki, East Georgia. She is 56 years old and lives with her 21 year-old son in the village. Margarita’s son works in a local bread factory. Margalita earns a living through agricultural activities. In particular, she has 2 milk cows and 5 calves. Margalita produces cheese and sells  30 kg of cheese monthly in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). She will sell calves in spring, when they are already grown. Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Margalita requested a loan for purchasing feed for cows and calves for the winter months. She will purchase quality natural food and will count on a high yield of milk during the winter season, which will have a positive impact on family income and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cows and calves

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Абдулло вдовец и в воспитании имеет одного сына. Он хочет содержит своего сына в хороших условиях и хочет чтобы он стал образованным и воспитанным человекам. Более одного года он занимается скотоводством. Он имеет 3 голов крупного рогатого скота и 2 голов мелко рогатого скота. Он имеет хорошую условию на содержание скота. Также имеет на запас 200 шт. пресса и 300 кг пшеницу, чтобы откармливать их в зиме. Абдулло запрашивает займ для покупки 2 голов крупного рогатого скота и 2 голов мелко рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен всем вам.
texts.en: Abdullo is a widower and is bringing up one son. He wants to support his son with a good education and wants him to become an educated and well-mannered man. For more than a year, he has been breeding cattle. He has 3 cattle and 2 sheep. He has good conditions to raise his cattle. As such, he has in stock a 200-piece combine and 300 kilograms of wheat to fatten them for the winter. Abdullo is requesting a loan to purchase 2 cattle and 2 sheep to grow his business. He looks forward to your help and thanks you all in advance.

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with eight children, three of whom still attend school while the others have completed their education. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. Chizi owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Chizi has operated a meat goat selling business for the past five years; her potential clients are the people at the slaughter. She faces a major challenge of livestock disease which sometimes leads to death. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 35,000, she wants to purchase more goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Kibisi Central A Group

texts.en:
Benson is the facilitator of the Kibisi Central A group. Benson and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Benson takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and to have additional maize profits to send his children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Benson had a very good maize yield, harvesting 17 bags on 1 acre of land.
