Before joining One Acre Fund, Benson was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Benson will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kibisi Central A group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Wanjoya Shg C Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wanjoya SHG C Group in Western Kenya! Naomi is the facilitator of the Wanjoya SHG C group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Naomi is a mother of three children. She joined One Acre Fund due to the best yield from the firm, thus wanted to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Naomi had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Naomi was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Naomi and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Naomi will repay her loan and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wanjoya SHG C group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Naomi is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single mother of one child who is enrolled in school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her child. 

Beatrice has operated a tailoring business for the past ten years.  Her potential clients are her friends, relatives and passers by. She faces a major challenge of competition from other tailors. She dreams of establishing a design school.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase more stock of fabrics and linings for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of fabrics and linings for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité “Mujeres Trabajadoras” cuenta con 12 integrantes todas de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, se conformaron recientemente como un comité,  pero la mayoría ya había participado en otros grupos. Todas se muestran muy alegres y con ganas de salir adelante y como son todas vecinas se comprometen a realizar actividades para juntar más dinero para cualquier emergencia que se presente.
Una de ellas es la señora Laura, quien gracias a la venta de perfumes que hace puede ayudar en la casa y cubrir los gastos diarios. Ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora y muy emprendedora, gracias a sus esfuerzos está pudiendo salir adelante y seguir sus sueños.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de fragancias, tanto para hombres como para mujeres, para que de esa manera pueda abastecerse para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Trabajadoras (“Hardworking Women”) Committee is composed of 12 people, all coming from the town of Villa Elisa. Even though they have been recently come together to form a committee, the majority of them had already formed part of other groups. All of them are very cheerful and wish to get on in life. As they are neighbors they commit to engaging in activities to earn more money to face any emergency that may present itself.
Laura is one of them. Thanks to her perfumes sale she is able to help her family and to pay for family expenses. She considers herself to be a very hardworking, tenacious and resourceful woman, and thanks to her efforts she is succeeding in getting on in life and in following her dreams.
She is requesting a loan to buy both male and female fragrances in order to have enough products to satisfy her customers’ requests.

loans.use: To buy male and female perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a widowed woman with five children, four of whom are enrolled in school while the other one is still young for school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Mupa has operated a retail shop for the past thirteen years. Her potential clients are her neighbors and the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of fluctuating prices of commodities. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and soap for her shop. She decided to join Yehu because of their quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Kahawa A Group

texts.en:
Alfred is the facilitator of the Kahawa A group. Alfred and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alfred takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Alfred had a good maize yield, harvesting 6 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Alfred was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alfred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Alfred will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kahawa A group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Alfred is pictured with his group members and Field Officer far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a widow. Her five children are all grown up. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her grandchildren because some of them are orphans.  

Dama has run a vegetable grocery for the past three years; her clients are her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge which is that she doesn't have a legal permit to do business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with six children. Five are enrolled in school, while the other one is still too young. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Mlongo has operated a butcher shop for the past four years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of leftover stock . She dreams of expanding her business.

With the loan of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more goats and cattle for the sale of meat in her butcher shop. She decided to join Yehu because of their low loan interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and cattle for the sale of meat in her butcher shop.

loans.name: Khwiroro Group

texts.en:
James is the facilitator of the Khwiroro group. James and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

James takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to affordable loan repayment and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, James had a very good maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  James was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on ½ an  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to James and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, James will educate his children and invest in business.

In 2012, the members of Khwiroro group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, James is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cattle and feed.

loans.name: Maluki

texts.en:
Maluki is a married man with five school-going children. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

Maluki has operated a poultry business for the past fifteen years; his potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of starting a business selling goat meat.

With the loan of KES 20,000 he wants to purchase goats for his new business selling goat meat. He decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for his new business selling goat meat.

loans.name: Yengelesia A Shg Group

texts.en:
Simon is the facilitator of the Yengelesia A SHG group. Simon and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Simon takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Simon had a good maize yield, harvesting 5 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Simon was only able to harvest 1 bag of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Simon and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Simon will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Yengelesia A SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Simon is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has three children; two of them are currently in school. For the past two years Christine has been working hard to manage her small business selling fish at the local market. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her fish purchases and will help Christine to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Christine's future prospects by helping her to improve her capital.

loans.use: to increase fish purchases

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a widowed woman with four children who are all enrolled in school. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Bahati has operated a cereals (maize) resale business for the past ten years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of transportation costs. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase ten sacks of maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of their quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Tembelesia Shg Group

texts.en:
George is the facilitator of the Tembelesia SHG group. His group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
George takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, George had a good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, George was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to George and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, George will educate his children. In 2012, the members of Tembelesia SHG group will each plant maize plots between half and 1 acre of land.
In the photograph above, George is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for animals.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a divorced woman with two school-going children. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Gladys has operated a grocery for the past year; she also practices small scale farming. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase stocks of vegetables, like tomatoes and onions, for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of vegetables, like tomatoes and onions, for resale.

loans.name: Abadahemuka Ba E.e.n.r Group

texts.fr:
Foibe fait partie du groupe ABADAHEMUKA BA E.E.N.R. Elle a 48 ans et elle est mariée avec 5 enfants de 12 à 24 ans, tous scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5  ans de secondaire.

Foibe est commerçante des cartes de téléphone portable ainsi que les accessoires des téléphones portables. C’est son 1èr  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour renforcer son commerce en achetant en gros les cartes de téléphone et les accessoires et les vendre en détaille.  

Dans les prochaines années, Foibe voudrait être le distributeur reconnu de MTN Rwanda. Avec les profits, Foibe va continuer la scolarisation de ses enfants, et elle va améliorer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Foibe is a member of the ABADAHEMUKA BA E.E.N.R. group. She is 48 years old and is married with five children aged from 12 to 24; all of whom attend or have attended school. She herself completed five years of secondary education. Foibe is a seller of mobile phone cards, and accessories for mobile phones. This is her first loan cycle with ACB. 

She will use her loan to strengthen her business by buying the phonecards and accessories in bulk, and reselling them retail. In the years to come, Foibe would like to be the official distributor for MTN Rwanda. With the profits, Foibe will continue to put her children through school, and she will improve the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to purchase phone cards and accessories in bulk, for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with five school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Esther has operated a secondhand clothing business for the past twelve years; her potential clients are the local area women. The major challenge she faces is transportation. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase four bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial facilities to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase four bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with six children, two of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house without electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Hadija has operated a retail shop for the past year. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passers by. She faces a major challenge of transportation. Hadija dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Hadija wants to purchase more sugar, beans, and maize flour to stock her retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to acquire funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, beans, and maize flour for her retail shop.

loans.name: Shovlat

texts.en: Shovlat, aged 49, is married and the mother of two sons and one daughter.  She lives with her family in their own house in Lankaran.  She mostly fattens cattle for resale.  Shovlat has been doing this work for over 7 years.  She is taking out a loan of 2000 AZN to purchase 3 more cattle.  She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer who lives in Kitale, Western Kenya.  He is 49 years old, married, and has five children. He has worked in farming for 20 years. His farm produces maize and beans, which he sells locally.

Peter has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry at 50,000 KES for a new poultry farming venture and to construct a dairy unit. He hopes to expand his farming business with the loan and to generate income to educate his children.

He says that some of the challenges in farming are the high cost of feed and animal diseases.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with seven school going children. Her husband Dzombo is a farmer who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. They own a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Salome has operated a livestock (goat) selling business for the past seven years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan Salome wants to purchase more goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial facilities to do business.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Babirye's Group

texts.en:
Babirye's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Babirye is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Babirye has been working hard to manage her salon which does hairdressing for local women. 

To help expand her business, Babirye has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase the equipment needed to do special braids, and will help Babirye to generate greater profits and buy uniforms and other small expenses for her family. Babirye hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Babirye is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Babirye's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase the equipment needed to do special braids,

loans.name: Mgandi

texts.en:
Mgandi is applying for another loan to expand his existing business. He will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase more goats for resale. In the future, Mgandi aspires to continue expanding his business. 

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Mgandi has greatly improved his family’s standard of living. He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Big Brother Group

texts.en:
Ann is the facilitator of the Big Brother group. Ann and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ann takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Ann had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 ½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Ann was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ann and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Ann will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Big Brother group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Ann is pictured with her group members and the Field Officer standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with three children two of whom are enrolled in school while the other one is too young for school. Her husband is a seaman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Salome has operated a clothes selling business for the past five years.Iin addition she also sells soft drinks like juices. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 60,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of clothes and passions fruits for making juice for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of their fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes and passionfruit for making juice for sale.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 28 years old, married with one child who is four years old.  Jean Bosco sells clothes. This is his tenth successful year in business and the hours of this business are from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. 

Jean Bosco has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to by buying more clothes to sell.  Jean Bosco will earn more profits.  With the profits, he will build a secure future for his business as well as for his child.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Niinue F.g Group

texts.en:
Irene is the facilitator of the Niinue F.G group. Irene and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Irene takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Irene had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 7 ½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Irene was only able to harvest  ½ bag of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Irene and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Irene will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Niinue F.G group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Irene is pictured with her group members with the Field Officer on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase more chicks and chicken feed for her business. In the future, Raya aspires to continue expanding her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Raya has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feed for her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es una persona de carácter muy jovial, ella está casada hace ya 18 años, vive en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, tiene dos hijos, el mayor tiene 17 años, y una nena de 11 años. Su esposo es propietario de un taller metalúrgico, quien ayuda a pagar los gastos de la casa.
Carmen comenta que siempre se dedicó a pequeñas ventas  que lo hacia a través de catálogos entre sus amigas, vecinas, y parientes, después poco a poco llegaba a las distintas oficinas de algunas empresas, y vendía por sobre todo lencerías para damas, más adelante y haciendo un esfuerzo decidió habilitar un local de ventas para lo cual alquiló un salón dentro de un gimnasio, y allí realiza sus ventas como: conjuntos de ciclistas, remeras, top, calzas, lencerías finas para damas y demás. Dice tener una muy buena clientela formada y que no se queja de la venta pues gracias a sus precios y por sobre todo la calidad de sus productos vende muy bien.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas deportivas para la posterior venta, ya que siempre tiene muchos pedidos con los cuales le gustaría poder cumplir.
texts.en:
Carmen is a very jovial person and lives in the city of Villa Elis. She has been married for 18 years and has two children - the oldest is 17, and the youngest is a girl of 11 years. Her husband owns a metal workshop, and he helps to pay the household expenses.

Carmen explains that she always used to work with small sales, using catalogs to sell products initially among her friends, neighbors, and relatives. Gradually, she started selling to various offices of several companies where she sold mainly women's lingerie. Much later and with great effort, she decided to find a sales premises and rented a room inside a gym. Here, she has been able to sell garments such as cycling shorts, t-shirts, tops, stockings, fine lingerie, and more. 

Carmen says that she has good clientele who never complain about her products, as the good prices and overall quality of her products have meant that they sell very well. She has requested this loan to purchase more apparel for subsequent sale in her store, as she always has a lot of orders that she would like to be able to fulfil.

loans.use: to buy sports garments for subsequent sale in her store

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza is a 58-year-old woman, married with four children.  She sells fruits and vegetables.  Roza has many years of experience in this business.  She works everyday with the help of her husband. 

Roza is a member of AqroInvest.  She requested a loan of 1200 AZN.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to improve business.

loans.name: Herrine

texts.en:
Herrine is a married woman with five school-going children. Her husband who is employed also contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Herrine has operated a retail shop for the past seven years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of theft. She dreams of expanding her shop to a wholesale shop.

With this loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase cooking fat, wheat flour, and sugar for her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access financial facilities.

loans.use: To purchase cooking fat, wheat flour, and sugar for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two more cattle.

loans.name: Jenniffer

texts.en:
Jenniffer is a mother of three children and lives with her family in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya, where she also carries out mixed farming. She has been in farming for 20 years, selling her produce to the local market. She has five farmhands.

Jenniffer has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a zero grazing unit for her dairy cows. She says this will improve her milk production since the her farm feeds will be protected for her dairy cows only. She says the income will go into educating her children.

Jenniffer laments drought and animal diseases.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван разведен. Он живет в Ивано-Франковске, занимается пассажирскими перевозками по Украине. У Ивана есть собственный автомобиль ВАЗ 21114 2006 года выпуска. Услуги транспортных перевозок он стал предоставлять 7 лет назад. До этого торговал овощами оптом и в розницу на продовольственном рынке, а потом решил поменять специализацию. С тех пор его доходы выросли и на данный момент составляют 6 000 гривен. 

Иван планирует использовать кредит КИВА в 7 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести зимние колеса, осуществить текущий ремонт двигателя своего автомобиля. Этот бизнес является главным источником дохода для Ивана. Одной из главных целей, которые ставит для себя Иван, является приобретение более нового автомобиля. В будущем Иван планирует и дальше работать в этой сфере, так как пока не видит для себя других, более интересных перспектив.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Ivan is divorced.  He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk and is involved in passenger transportation within Ukraine.  Ivan has his own car, VAZ 21114, made in 2006.  He started proving transportation services seven years ago.  Previously, he sold vegetables wholesale and retail at a food market and then decided to change his speciality.  Since then, his income rose and currently amounts to 6 000 hryvnia.  Ivan plans to use the 7 000 hryvnia Kiva loan to buy winter tires and make regular repairs to his car engine.  This business is Ivan's primary source of income.  One of the goals that Ivan sets for himself is to purchase a newer car.  In the future, Ivan plans to continue working in this field because for now he does not see other, more interesting enterprises.

loans.use: to buy winter tires and make regular repairs to his car engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Farmers Initiative B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Farmers Initiative B Group in Western Kenya! Mildred is the facilitator of the Farmers Initiative B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mildred  takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Mildred had a very good maize yield, harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mildred was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mildred  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Mildred will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Farmers Initiative B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is 55 years old. He is married and lives in Yerevan with his family. Gevorg has two sons who are both married, and now Gevorg already has three grandchildren.  

For more than 16 years, Gevorg has been engaged in clothes trading. He imports merchandise from a neighboring country and sells them in a rented place at one of Yerevan's trade fairs. Gevorg sells only men’s clothes: shirts, trousers, sweaters, and outerwear. He likes his occupation very much and thanks to income from it, he provides for his family.

Gevorg is one of Nor Horizon's first clients and over a period of mutual cooperation Gevorg has never delayed his repayments. Now he is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 Armenia drams (AMD) to buy winter sweaters, jackets, and coats to resell.

loans.use: To buy winter sweaters, jackets, and coats to resell.

loans.name: Mbanasho Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbanasho Group in Western Kenya! Pasilisa is the facilitator of the Mbanasho group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Pasilisa joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which will enable her to harvest enough food for the family while having a surplus for savings and sales.  Pasilisa's family includes three children. In the recent 2011 season, Pasilisa had an excellent maize yield harvesting 13 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Pasilisa was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pasilisa and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Pasilisa will pay for major yearly expenses such as school fees and livestock investments.

In 2012, the members of Mbanasho group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.ru:
Ярослав женат, у нее трое детей. Он живет в селе Кошелево. Владеет собственным магазином «АВС», который находится около центральной дороги. В свое время жена Ярослава купила дом и перестроила его под бизнес проект. Магазин в этом помещении Ярослав открыл не так давно, всего год назад. Однако он уже успел завоевать отличную репутацию среди жителей городка, которые стали его постоянными покупателями. 

Ярославу необходим кредит в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить больше товара перед праздниками и пополнить свои оборотные средства. В преддверии Рождества и Нового года украинцы всегда не скупятся на продуктовые закупки, поэтому Ярослав хочет быть готов удовлетворить повышенный спрос на сладости, мясные изделия и т.п. Ярослав полон идей и планов на развитие своего бизнеса. Так как помещение магазина достаточно просторное и, более того, у него есть еще один отдельный вход, со временем Ярослав подумывает начать сдавать часть помещения в аренду, или, возможно, откроет что-то сам, когда раскрутит бизнес. Одной из таких идей по расширению является открытие ветеринарной аптеки, что актуально для этой части страны, где многие занимаются скотоводством и держат животных. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Yaroslav is married and has three children. He lives in the village of Koshelovo and owns a store called "ABC" located near the main road. 
Some time ago,Yaroslav's wife bought a house and restructured in for a business. Abut one year ago, Yaroslav opened his shop. Despite having a fledgling business, he has already achieved a great reputation among the townspeople and boasts regular customers. 
Yaroslav needs a loan of 15,000 grivnas in order to stock up on goods before the holidays. In advance of Christmas and New Year's Eve, Ukrainians begin to spend lavishly on grocieries, therefore Yaroslav wants to be ready to meet increased demand for sweets, meat products, etc. 
Yaroslav is full of ideas on how to expand his business. Because his store is spacious and has a separate entrance, he could rent out part of his building or, possibly, open something himself when his business allows it. One idea consists of opening a veterinary clinic, whose services would be in great demand since animal breeding is a common way to make a living for many people in that part of the country.

loans.use: to purchase more goods before the holidays and increase his operating budget.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is 45 years old, and a married woman with four children between the ages of 3 and 16 years. All of them are in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan for three years.

Fouzia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Mary is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. For the past year, Mary has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells products like sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase supplies for resale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and buy books for her young brothers. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to become a musician. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mary's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for resale.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband is a mason who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Riziki has operated a food stall for the past nine years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With this loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy drinks and food for her restaurant

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Последний кредит КИВА Людмила использовала для того, чтобы закупить женские колготки. Она неплохо поторговала, получила прибыль, смогла помочь родным в ремонте дома.  
В этот раз она решила воспользоваться кредитными услугами КИВА, потому что ей необходимы средства, чтобы пополнить сезонный товар.
Людмила очень трудолюбива, она трудится для того,чтобы содержать себя и помочь родне.
texts.en:
Ludmila has used her previous credit in order to stock up on women’s pantyhose. Her sales were decent; she earned some revenues and was able to help out her relatives with paying for house repairs.

This time she decided to ask for a Kiva loan because she needs financial means for expanding the assortment of seasonal goods.
Ludmila is very hard-working. She toils to support herself and help out her relatives.

loans.use: to expand the assortment of seasonal goods

loans.name: S Farmers Initiative A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from S Farmers initiative A Group in Western Kenya! Alice is the facilitator of the S Farmers initiative A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alice takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and due to one acre Fund's best prices. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of S Farmers initiative A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Alice is pictured in the photo above with her group members and the Field Officer is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a married woman with one school-going child. Her husband is a mason who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is house rent.

Rabia has operated a food stall for the past ten years; her potential clients are the local area women. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, where there is low demand in some months of the year. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, beans, and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of wheat flour, beans, and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Oposilan

texts.en:
Oposilan is 40 years old, and a married woman with one child who is in school. She has had a business of a food stall in Kator, South Sudan for one year.

Oposilan requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase tomatoes and green vegetables. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ushindi Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ushindi SHG Group in Western Kenya! Adijah is the facilitator of the Ushindi SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Adijah  takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Adijah had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 5 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Adijah was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Adijah  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Adijah will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ushindi SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Adijah and her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Phidelis

texts.en: Phidelis is a hardworking business woman, who is 51 years old and married. For over ten years, she has been practicing dairy farming to make a living. She loves farming and she has dedicated most of her time to it.  She has been able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a farmer in Nkubu and has been in farming for 10 years. She lives with her one child, age 12, in their home area, where she carries out farming and sells her produce of coffee, fruits, and vegetables to the local market.

Margaret has made a loan request of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank and poultry birds at 20,000 KES each and boost her farming business. She adds that she will venture into heavy poultry farming. She says intensive farming will provide income and uplift her family's living standards.

She laments low prices for the farm produce in the local markets.

loans.use: To buy poultry and a water tank.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña Guapa se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, el cual actualmente tiene 17 integrantes, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Desean que por medio del trabajo en equipo y mediante la ayuda de la fundación, puedan salir adelante.
La Sra. Elida, quién se dedica a la venta de helados, comenta que tiene muy buena venta, pues aunque haga mucho frio igual vende sus helados. Dice que ha logrado formarse una buena clientela y eso le ayuda a tener mejores ingresos. Quiere seguir en su negocio por lo que solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva, para la compra de helados de variados sabores, pues se acerca el calor y es preciso que aumente su stock.
texts.en: Kuña Guapa is the name of the group of women which was formed in the city of Villa Elisa and currently has 17 members, all of them friends and neighbours of same city. With the help of the Fundacion, they want to get ahead by working together as a team. Sra. Elida, who sells icecreams, says that she has very good sales even when its cold. She says that she has managed to establish a good clent base that helps her have a better income. She wants to stay in the business and is asking for Kiva's and the Fundacion's help to buy icecreams of various flavours, as the weather is getting hot and it is necessary to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy icecreams for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is requesting another Kiva loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to boost her business. With this loan, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale during the December holiday season, as the demand for new clothing is higher due to Christmas season. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy a bundle of second-hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and fabrics, as well as food flavors for her juice business.

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Stephen is the facilitator of the Bidii group. Stephen and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Stephen takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's low prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Stephen had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Stephen was only able to harvest two bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Stephen and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Stephen will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Bidii group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El sr. Alberto tiene 43 años, está casado con la Sra. Herminia de 38 años, quien es ama de casa,  ellos tienen cinco hijos, Ana de 18 años de edad, actualmente en la escuela cursando el  tercer año de la media,  Lucia de 16 años de edad, cursando  el segundo año de la media,  María 7 años,  está en segundo grado y los mellizos Juan Valentín y Juan Alberto de 12 años de edad, cursando el 7mo grado.
El sr. Alberto tiene una carpintería, empezó este negocio hace 8 años,  aproximadamente.  Comenzó trabajando para otras personas del mismo rubro como empleado hasta que decidió independizarse y lanzarse  por cuenta propia. Con esfuerzo y con algunos ahorros logro instalar su propia carpintería y con el correr de los años fueron afianzándose y lograr posicionarse en el mercado. Dice que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por darle a su esposa e hijos todo lo que ellos necesiten para una vida digna.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas de todo tipo, lo cual es imprescindible en su taller para poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene
texts.en:
Alberto is 43 years old and married to 38-year-old Herminia who takes care of their house.  The couple have five children: 18-year-old Ana who is currently in the third year of high school, 16-year-old Lucia who is in the second year of high school, 7-year-old María who is in second grade and twins Juan Valentín and Juan Alberto who are 12 years old and in seventh grade.

Alberto has a carpentry business which he started approximately eight years ago.  He started out working for other people in the same field as an employee but then decided to start his own business and work for himself.  With effort and some savings, he managed to set up his own carpentry workshop and, over the years, his business became established and he managed to position himself in the market.  He says that all the hard work he does is so that he can provide his wife and children with everything they need to lead a decent life.

Alberto is requesting a loan to buy all kinds of wood, which is essential in his workshop, so that he can fill the orders that he has.

loans.use: to buy wood for his carpentry workshop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 39, is single with one child who is five years old. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetic business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With this loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase facial gels, soaps, and food oil for her cosmetic shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase facial gels, soaps, and food oil for her cosmetic shop.

loans.name: Kuvuna

texts.en:
Kuvuna is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a dry fish selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With this loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Martha Eliana

texts.es: La señora Marta a sus 42 años de edad tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración y confección de accesorios decorativos para el hogar como tendidos de cama, individuales de mesa. La señora Martha trabaja sola en su casa, dedicándose  a esta actividad desde hace 6 años luego de haberse capacitado en diferentes instituciones en temas como arte country y manualidades.  La señora Martha desea comprar materia prima para elaborar sus productos como lo son hilos, telas y accesorios en general que le permitan salir adelante y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. En un futuro la señora Martha desea tener su propio local comercial.
texts.en: Martha is 42 years old and has a 7-year-old son. Her business is making decorative products for the home such as bedclothes and table mats. Martha works alone at home and has been in this business for six years after she trained in different institutions in subjects such as arte country (brightly colored decorative items made from wood) and handicrafts. Martha would like to buy raw materials to make her products such as threads, fabrics and general accessories. This will allow her to make progress and provide her son with a better quality of life. In the future, Martha would like to have her own sales premises.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make her products such as threads, fabrics and accessories

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling as retail to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates a vegetable stall business, which contributes to her other source income. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 33 and a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past eight years, she has operated a beauty salon business; her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a tailoring business which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge because of insecurity in her place of operation.

With this loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase a blow dryer machine, cosmetics, and threads for her salon. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer machine, cosmetics, and threads for her salon.

loans.name: Lurare Group

texts.en:
Adelide is the facilitator of the Lurare group. Adelide and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Adelide takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to get One Acre Fund's low prices, to ensure food security for her family, and, later, to educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Adelide had an excellent maize yield harvesting five and a half bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Adelide was only able to harvest one and a half bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Adelide and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Adelide will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Lurare group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) for transport business; her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity. She dreams of growing her business in the future.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
18 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú, todas ellas muy luchadoras y trabajadoras oyeron hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya y decidieron agruparse y formar su grupo. Ellas quieren que por medio del trabajo en conjunto puedan mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 
Una de esas mujeres luchadoras es la señora 	Maura, quien se dedica a la venta de gallinas, ella comenta que este ha sido su trabajo por mucho tiempo, que le enorgullece lo que hace porque es muy honrado y porque además de eso me va muy bien. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de gallinas y después revenderlas, pues siempre tiene mucha clientela y quiere cumplir con ellas. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le está dando.
texts.en: 18 women from the city of Caaguazú, all of them enterprising and hardworking, heard about the program for Women Entrepreneurs of the Fundacion Paraguay and decided to get together and form their own group. They want to improve their living conditions by working together. One of those enterprising women is Señora Maura who sells chickens. She says that this has been her work for a long time. What makes her proud of what she does is that it is honest work and she is also doing very well. She is asking for a loan to buy chickens and subsequently resell them, as she always has a lot of customers and she wants to meet their demands. She is grateful to the Fundacion for the opportunity given her.

loans.use: to buy chickens for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 38, is a married woman with one child who graduated from school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 12 years, she has had a café business, operating from the nearby town where town dwellers and neighbors are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Grace dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With this loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, oil, sugar, and salt for her cafe. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, oil, sugar, and salt for her cafe.

loans.name: Star D Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Star D group from Western Kenya! Sylvia is the facilitator of the Star D group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Sylvia takes care of one child at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have good production and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Sylvia had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Sylvia was only able to harvest six bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Sylvia and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Sylvia will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Star D group will each plant between one half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Zulay

texts.es:
Zulay tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Zulay se dedica a la venta de calzado de dama desde hace tres años. Ella vio la oportunidad de iniciar este negocio puesto que ella vio que en su comunidad no habia ninguna tienda de zapatos, y las mujeres debian viajar a otro pueblo para hacer sus compras. Ella vende el calzado en su casa, y tambien aprovecha las actividades de la iglesia a las que atiende todos los dias para ofrecer sus productos.

Zulay ha solicitao un prestamo a Fundacion Mujer para la compra de zapatos de dama y tambien para acondicionar su casa para la exhibicion de los zapatos y el mantenimiento de los mismos. Con la ayuda del prestamo ella podra tener una gama de diseños mas amplia, y asi incrementar sus ventas.

Zulay quiere establecer una tienda de zapatos formal en un local, donde sus clientas puedan venir a comprar y ella siempre pueda tener inventario. Ella quiere realizarce como empresaria, una faseta mas de su vida.  Ella espera que su negocio sea mas rentable y asi poder proporcionar una mejor educacion para sus nietos.
texts.en:
Zulay is 55 years old, married, and has three children.  She has been selling ladies' footwear for three years.  She saw the opportunity to start this business as she realized that there were no shoe stores in her community and women had to travel to another village to make their purchases.  Zulay sells her footwear from home.  She also makes the most of the church activities she attends every day and offers her products there. 

Zulay has requested a loan from Fundación Mujer to buy ladies' shoes.  She will also fit out her home so that she has somewhere to display and keep her shoes.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to have a wider range of designs and thereby increase her sales.

Zulay would like to set up a formal shoe store in some premises where here customers can come and buy and she can always have stock available.  She would like to fulfill herself as a businesswoman and take one more step forward in her life.  She hopes that her business will be more profitable so that she can provide her grandchildren with a better education.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: La señora Monica a sus 20 años de edad es una madre soltera, cabeza de familia y tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos esta recién nacido y el otro tiene 2 años de edad.  Con la experiencia de haber vivido muchos años en el campo con su familia, hoy día ella desea comprar una vaca lechera con el fin de tener mayores ingresos para brindarles a sus dos hijos todo lo necesario y una mejor calidad de vida puesto que ellos dos dependen totalmente de ella. La señora Monica alternará su trabaja de campo con su trabajo como auxiliar de enfermería en el municipio del Carmen de Viboral al oriente de Antioquia.
texts.en: Monica is 20 years old and a single mother who is in charge of her household.  She has two children.  One of her children is a newborn and the other is 2 years old.  She has the experience of having lived in the countryside with her family for many years and would like to buy a dairy cow so that she can make more income in order to provide her two children with everything they need and a better quality of life as they are both totally dependent on her.  Monica alternates her farm work with her job as a nurse's aide in the town of El Carmen de Viboral, in the east of Antioquia department.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lukongo B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Lukongo B Group in Western Kenya! Gladys is the facilitator of Lukongo B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Gladys takes care of five children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Gladys had a very good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Gladys was only able to harvest half a bag of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Gladys and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Gladys will pay for major expenses such as school fees for her children. 

In 2012, the members of Lukongo B group will each plant between one half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Lauren Vanessa

texts.es:
Lauren Vanessa tiene 27 años de edad, y vive con sus dos pequeños hijos de siete y cinco años. Lauren es madre y jefa de hogar. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de marca desde hace un año, vendiendo de forma ambulante de comunidad en comunidad. Lauren vende 100% de sus productos al contado, por lo que cada 15 dias introduce nuevos productos para la venta. Ella se levanta a las 5 am para alistar a sus hijos para la esculea, y posteriormente ella sale a vender en la mañana hasta las 11:30 am. A esa hora ella recoge sus hijose de las escuela, les da de almorzar, y luego sale a vender de nuevo hasta las 6 pm.

Lauren ha solicitado un prestamo a Fundacion Mujer para la compra de ropa de marca para la venta. Ella tiene como objetivo crecer sus ventas y su negocio, ya que sus hijos dependen enteramente de ella. De esta forma ella espera darles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Lauren Vanessa is 27 years old and lives with her two young children who are 7 and 5 years old.  Lauren is a mother and head of household.  Her business is selling brand-name clothing and she has been in business for one year.  She makes her sales as a traveling saleswoman, moving from community to community.  Lauren sells 100% of her products for cash and, every two weeks, she introduces new products for sale.  She gets up at 5.00am to get her children ready for school and then she goes out to make her sales in the morning until 11.30am.  At this time she picks her children up from school, gives them lunch, and then goes back out to sell her products until 6.00pm.

Lauren has requested a loan from Fundación Mujer to buy brand-name clothing to sell.  Her goal is to grow her sales and her business as her children depend completely on her.  In this way, she hopes to provide them with a better future.

loans.use: to buy unisex brand products to sell

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: La señora Reyna Isabel, tiene 53 años, es una mujer casada y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. Ella tiene 6 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de molino, que está ubicado en su vivienda. Ella quiere realizar mejoras en su vivienda como es el techo que se encuentra muy mal estado, pues cuando tiene que  atender a sus clientes ellos se mojan, es por eso que solicita este crédito con el fin de zinc, clavos, pega, pvc entre otros productos que son necesarios para estos cambios. Sueña con mantener su negocio y seguir ayudando a sus hijos.
texts.en: Señora Reyna Isabel,is 53 years old. She is married and has 2 adult children. She has been milling in her house for the last 6 years. She wants to make some home improvements such as to the roof which is in a bad condition and lets in the rain when she attends to her clients so that they get wet This is why she is asking for a loan to buy zinc sheets, nails, glue, pvc and other products which are necessary to make the repairs. She dreams of maintaining her business and continuing to help her children.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, nails, glue, pvc and other things.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es: La socia se dedica actualmente a la crianza de cuyes en casa y a la costura, ella tiene un pequeño taller de confecciones y costura, la socia realiza bellos trabajaos en tela ella hace vestidos, trajes de noche, ternos para damas y caballeros, camisas, blusas entre otros conjuntos; la socia en esta ocasion desea invertir el prestamo en los estudios de sus hija, ella va a prepararse ahora que termino la secundaria, hara unos cursos de reforzamiento y preparacion universitaria, para postular a la universidad nacional en Cusco, la hija de la socia desea estudiar la carrera profesional de turismo, para ser guia. La socia invertira el prestamo en los estudios de su hija para la preparacion a la universidad.
texts.en: The borrower raises guinea pigs at home and sews. She has a small sewing workshop where she transforms fabric into beautiful pieces. She makes dresses, evening dresses, suits for men and women, shirts, blouses among other garments. On this occasion the borrower wants to invest the loan in her daughter's studies. She has just finished high school and will take some preparatory courses for universitry to apply to the national university in Cusco. The borrower's daughter wants to study tourism so as to become a tourist guide. The borrower will invest the loan in her daughter's studies as university preparation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's pre-university studies.

loans.name: Luzanaka Group

texts.en:
Moses is the facilitator of the Luzanaka group. Moses and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Moses takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to have quality farm produce and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Moses had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Moses was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Moses will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Luzanaka group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La Sra Elena es viuda, tiene 58 años, ella se considera una mujer muy  trabajadora y muy dedicada, tiene tres hijos, todos ellos ya profesionales gracias a su esfuerzo.
Ella es artesana hace más D. 15 años, fabrica y venD. todo tipo D. ropas artesanales en un local alquilado que queda en la ciudad D.  Coronel Oviedo. Comenta  que le encanta el trabajo que realiza porque heredo D. su mama y además  su mayor sueño es tener su propio salón D. ventas, en busca D. ese sueño es que ella diariamente lucha.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas piqué, lo cual es elemental para las artesanías que realiza, sabe que la ayuda D. Kiva y D. fundación es muy importante por lo que les agradece
texts.en:
Elena is a widow and is 58 years old. She considers herself a very hard working and dedicated woman. She has 3 children, all of them already professionals thanks to her efforts.
She has been an artisan for more than 15 years, she makes and sells all types of handmaD. clothes en a rented location that is in the city of Coronel Oviedo. She says that she loves the work that she does because she inherited it from her mother and also her biggest dream is to have her own show room. It is in search of this dream that she struggles daily.
She is requesting the loan in order to buy quilted fabric, which is fundamental for the crafts that she makes. She knows that the support from Kiva and the foundation is very important, and for that she is very thankful.

loans.use: To buy quilted fabric to make handmade clothes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She has been in farming for four years and produces eggs, milk, and vegetables for the local market where she also retail cereals.

Grace has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Kilimo to purchase poultry birds and boost her poultry farming business. She adds that she will use the income to care for her siblings and plan for her future. She is optimistic that she will be able to supply far markets with her eggs.

She points at fluctuation in market prices.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Justina Zoraida

texts.es:
Justina de 39 años, decidió dedicar a la activada de vender producto para uso personal como perfume, maquillaje, etc., por recomendación de una amiga.

Justina sale todos los días a ofrecer sus productos a amigos y familiares de 8 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde.
La única dificultad de su trabajo es la delincuencia debido a que recorre sectores muy peligrosos constantemente.

No esta casada y tiene 4 hijos de 15, 11, 6 y 5 años estudian en escuela fiscal.
Su meta es poder prepararse para ser consultora así poder inscribir a personas para poder poner una oficina de ventas de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Justina, 39 years old, decided to sell products for personal use like perfume, makeup etc. for a living, by recommendation of a friend.

Justina goes out every day to offer her products to friends and family from 8 in the morning to 4 in the afternoon.
The only difficulty of her job is the crime because she constantly travels very dangerous neighborhoods.

She is not married and has 4 children ages 15, 11, 6 and 5. They attend public school. Her goal is to be able to prepare herself to be a consultant so she can enroll people in order to start a cosmetic sales office.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Xinia Maria

texts.es:
Xinia Maria tiene 35 años, y vive con sus tres hijos. Xinia es dueña de un restaurante, donde ella vende comidas rapidas, casados (un plato tipico costaricense, donde se sirve arroz y fijoles con algun tipo de carne), y menu a la carta.

Xinia inicio su negocio hace 6 meses. Ella establecio su restaurante ya que le gusta la cocina y quiere crecer como negociante. Ella trabaja 7 dias a la semana, se levanta a las 4 am a preparar los alimentos para la venta. Xinia labora alrededor de 18 horas continuas diariamente en su negocio. Ella ha crecido mucho en lo personal, ya que paso de ser empleada, a ser dueña y administradora. Gracias a eso ella ha podido brindarle una mejor educacion a sus hijos.

Xinia ha solicitado un prestamo a Fundacion Mujer para la compra de nuevo equipo para su negocio, tal como un pequeño congelador, baño maria, y utencilios de cocina. En un futuro Xinia desea oder tener su propia infrastructura para dejar de pagar alguiler. Xinia sabe que esta en una industria competitiva, pero tambien sabe que puede superar la competencia brindando mejor atencion al cliente, y precios competitivos.
texts.en:
Xinia Maria is 35 years old and lives with her 3 children. Xinia is the owner of a restaurant where she sells fast food, casados (a typical Costa Rican dish of rice and beans with some type of meat), and an à la carte menu.
Xinia started her business 6 months ago. She established her restaurant because she likes the kitchen and wants to grow as a business woman. She works 7 days a week. She gets up at 4 AM to prepare the food for sale. Xinia works about18 continuous hours daily in her business. She has grown a lot personally, since going from being employed to being owner and manager. Thanks to that, she has been able to provide a better education for her children.
Xinia has requested a loan from Fundación Mujer (Woman Foundation) in order to buy new equipment for her business such as a small freezer, a double boiler, and kitchen utensils. In the future Xinia wants to be able to have her own infrastructure so she can stop paying rent. Xinia knows that she is in a competitive industry, but also knows that she can surpass the competition providing better customer service and competitive prices.

loans.use: To buy equipment such as a freezer, a double boiler, and kitchen utensils for her restaurant.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, 26, is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a firewood selling business, selling from door to door and from home. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Eunice dreams of establishing a charcoal selling business in the future.

With this loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Vilma Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo tiene 43 años, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos de las cuales dos son independientes y uno depende de ella todavía. Amparo nació en la provincia de Quispicanchis y ahora radica en la ciudad del Cusco. En la ciudad del Cusco Amparo desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas.   

Amparo se dedica a la venta de ropa y juguetes, ella comprar sus productos en diferentes ciudades del Perú y después los distribuye a las vendedoras de los diferentes mercados de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Amparo pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo juguetes y ropa. 

Amparo se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
