Amparo is 43 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are independent and one of whom is still dependent on her.  Amparo was born in Quispicanchis province and now lives in the city of Cusco.  This is where Amparo carries out her daily and business activities.

Amparo sells clothes and toys.  She buys her products in different cities in Peru and then distributes them to sellers in the different markets in the city of Cusco.

Ampraro is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Ñahupacman Purisun” community bank, in the city of Cusco.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as toys and clothes.

Amparo is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as toys and clothes

loans.name: Weyeta Shg Group

texts.en:
Grace is the facilitator of the Weyeta SHG group. Grace and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Grace takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Grace had a poor maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Grace was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Grace and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Grace will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Weyeta SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Grace is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos de 26 años, empezó alquilando una tricimoto pero con lo que todos los días trabajaba decidió reunir  dinero y poco a poco pudo comprar su propia tricimoto.

En la actualidad realiza su trabajo solo todos los días si horas fijas de trabajo. Hasta ahora no ha tenido ningún problema en su trabajo. Si está casado su esposa trabaja en un restaurante así ayuda a los gastos de la casa no tiene hijos.

Tiene muchas aspiracion con su trabajo y el resturante de su esposa por eso quiere el prestamo para comprar sillas, mesas para el restaurante de su esposa y algunas herramientas para la tricimoto. 

Su meta es poder construir su casa propia o poder poner un bazar para que su esposa trabaje sin dificultades.
texts.en:
Carlos is 26 years old.  He started out hiring a motorcycle taxi but, as he was working every day, he decided to put together some money and was gradually able to buy his own motorcycle taxi.

Carlos currently works alone every day.  He does not work regular hours.  Up to now he hasn't experienced any problems in his work.  He is married and his wife works in a restaurant to help with their household expenses.  They do not have any children.

Carlos has many aspirations for his work and his wife's restaurant.  For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs for his wife's restaurant and some tools for his motorcycle taxi.

Carlos' goal is to build his own home and to set up a store so that his wife can work without problems.

loans.use: to buy tools, tables and chairs

loans.name: Yitza Margarita

texts.es: Yitza Margarita ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Siempre le ha gustado luchar para sacar a su familia adelante, ella tiene un hijo bajo su cargo. Vende sus productos de manera ambulante sus clientes le solicitan variedad en sus productos. Cuenta con una clientela establecida, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus necesidades de su casa. Ella se ha dado cuenta que su negocio va creciendo favorablemente en el transcurso de los días. Desea seguir ampliando su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de polvos, cremas, tratamientos, ropa interior, lápiz labial y pintura de uñas.
texts.en: Yitza Margarita's business is selling cosmetics.  She has always enjoyed working hard to get her family ahead in life.  She has one son in her care.  Yitza sells her products as an itinerant vendor.  Her customers request variety in her products.  She has an established customer base and will use the income she makes to cover her household needs.  She has realized that her business is growing favorably.  She would like to continue expanding her business by purchasing more merchandise.  She is requesting this loan to buy powders, creams, treatments, underwear, lipsticks and nail polish.

loans.use: to buy powders, creams, treatments, underwear, lipsticks and nail polish

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth sigue trabajando como docente del nivel primario en el distrito de Anta,la socia tambien se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de panetones por la epoca navideña y tambien la socia vende productos de belleza como perfumes y cremas,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar los negocios de venta de panetones y negocio de venta de productos de belleza . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar panetones y productos de belleza como cremas y perfumes al por mayor.
texts.en:
Ruth continues working as a teacher at the elementary level in the Anta district.  She also is working in her business selling "panetones" [Christmas cakes] for the Christmas season, and she also sells beauty products like perfume and creams.

With these small businesses she gets her children ahead.  She wants to expand her businesses selling panetones and beauty products.

She is requesting the loan to buy panetones and beauty products such as creams and perfume wholesale.

loans.use: to buy "panetones" [holiday cakes] and beauty products such as creams and perfume wholesale.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: La socia Hilaria continua con su taller de mecanica, la socia se dedica  a la atencion y cobranza de su taller, la socia requiere el prestamo en esta ocasion para invertir en la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de trompos de construcción; para la fabricacion de estos trompos la socia comprara planchas gruesas de 3.16, selladora, mezcladora, eje de 3 octavos, angular. La socia con la fabricacion de estos trompos tiene mayores ingresos y desea seguir creciendo y apoyar en los estudios de sus hijos y darles mejor calidad de vida, la socia desea seguir prosperando y volverse en empresaria mayorista. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de los materiales mencionados para la fabricacion de trompos de construcción.
texts.en: Hilaria is continuing her auto repair shop. She handles customer service and collections in the repair shop. Hilaria needs the loan on this occasion to invest in the purchase of materials for the manufacture of cement mixers. To manufacture these mixers, she will purchase thick steel plates, a sealer, a mixer, and a 3/8 angular axle. Hilaria will have greater income with the manufacture of these cement mixers and she wants to continue growing to support her children in their studies and give them a better quality of life. She would like to continue prospering and become a wholesaler. She requests the loan to invest in the purchase of the aforementioned materials to manufacture cement mixers.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of materials to manufacture cement mixers.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years she has operated a retail business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Marjorie Ebelina

texts.es:
Marjorie de 42 años, empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien tiene su negocio en el centro de papeleria. Quien decidió ponerse uno en casa para que trabaje su esposa comprando al inicio papeleria, cuadernos, suministros etc. 

En la actualidad trabaja sola todos los días sin horarios fijos. Gracias a Dios no ha presentado ningún problema en su negocio. Tiene un hijo con su esposo, por eso quieren seguir trabjando y mejorar cada dia su estilo de vida con un prestamo y asi comprar papeleria, cuadernos para su negocio. 
 
Su meta a alcanzar es poder terminar de construir su vivienda para vivir más cómodos.
texts.en:
Marjorie is 42 years old.  She started her business with the help of her husband who has a stationery business in the city center.  He decided to set up a store in their home that his wife could work in and started off buying stationery, composition books, supplies, etc.

Marjorie currently works alone every day.  She does not work regular hours.  Thanks to God, she has not experienced any problems in her business.  She and her husband have a son and so they would like to continue working and improving their lifestyle.  With this loan, Marjorie will buy stationery and composition books for her business.

Marjorie's goal is to finish building her house so that her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy stationery, composition books and pens

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters). 

Eva has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for one year and she works 7 days a week. Eva sells her products from home by means of retail.

Eva has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income through rental houses. The main business challenges for Eva include transportation and seasonality.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build more rental rooms, to own a delivery van and also to sell on a wholesale basis. Eva lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Wesakiulila Group

texts.en:
Dorine is the facilitator of the Wesakiulila group. Dorine and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Dorine takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Dorine had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Dorine was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dorine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Dorine will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wesakiulila group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Dorine is pictured with her group members. The field officer appears on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of vegetables for resale

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita se sigue dedicando al negocio D. venta D. animales como pollos,la socia tambien venD. artesania y lo envia a lugares como Brasil,la socia los animales lo venD. en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito D. Anta,por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. animales y negocio D. artesania.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesania como chompas,polos,camisas y pantalones y tambien para comprar animales como gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Margarita continues working at her business selling animals, such as chickens.  She also sells crafts and sends them to places like Brazil.  She sells the animals in various markets in the Anta district.  With this business she gets her children ahead.  She wants to expand and improve her animal and crafts businesses.

Margarita is requesting the loan to buy crafts such as sweaters, polos, shirts, and pants, and also to buy animals like chickens.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy crafts (sweaters, polos, shirts, and pants) and animals (chickens).

loans.name: Nidia Elena

texts.es: Doña Nidia Elena trabaja en la alcaldía, desempeña el cargo de obrera de servicios generales. Ella está interesada en realizar este crédito con el fin de  realizarle mejoras a su vivienda y poder comprar zinc, clavos, cemento, arena y bloques. Ella tiene que encontrar las formas de pagar las cuentas de su hogar y pagar la cuota del crédito. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación sabe que puede lograrlo, pues sus aspiraciones son de seguir proporcionándole mejoras a su hogar.
texts.en: Nidia Elena works in city hall, office of general services, and she holds the office of general services worker. She is interested in using this loan to make improvements to her house and to be able to buy zinc, nails, cement, sand and blocks. She has to find a way to pay for her home expenses to afford the terms of the loan. With much effort and dedication she knows that she can succeed, since it’s her dream to continue making improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy zinc, nails, cement, sand, and blocks.

loans.name: Yury Alexandra

texts.es:
Yury de 25 años, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo que estudia en escuela fiscal.Se dedica a la venta de mercadería al por mayor y por menor de articulos para el hogar como almohadones, adornos, cuadros etc.

Realiza su trabajo todos los días sin horarios fijos, tambien vende productos y cosmeticos para mujeres los realiza por pedidos. Su único problema es el atraso de los pagos de sus clientes, ya que ella da a credito la mercaderia.

Su prestamo lo requiere para comprar mercaderia de hogar como almohadones, cuadros, bisuteria. Su meta es establecer su propio local comercial para su mayor comodidad en sus ventas.
texts.en: Yury is 25 years old and a single mother with a son who is in public school. She sells wholesale merchandise as well as household items like pillows, ornaments, pictures, etc. She works every day without a set schedule, and she also sells women’s products and cosmetics by special order. Her only problem is late customer payments since she extends credit for the merchandise. She needs this loan to buy household products like pillows, paintings, and jewelry. Her goal is to have her own shop to to conduct her business more conveniently.

loans.use: to buy pillows, paintings, and jewelry

loans.name: Costasie

texts.en:
Costasie is 52 years old and married with 4 children ages 12 to 30. Her husband works as a farmer. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for 6 years.

Costasie would like a loan to buy more sorghum, beans and maize to sell in her store. Any profits will be used to renovate her family house. She dreams to one day own a motor bike which will help grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum, beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La socia trabaj junto a su conyugue y se dedcia  al arte de artillar, ellos trabjan fabricando zapatos y aplicando artesania  en tela, la socia apoya a su conyugue porque juntos son una sola empresa y el dinero que la socia requiere en esta ocasion como en otras veces lo ha hecho es para la compra de materiales para la fabricación de zapatos como cuero, telas, moldes por tallas, cierres, plantillas entre otros materiales; La socia y su conyugue desean seguir prosperando para apoyar en la educación de sus hijos y darles mejor calidad de vida. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de calzados.
texts.en: The member and her husband work together as craftspeople; they work making shoes and applying crafts on fabric.  She supports her spouse because together they are a single enterprise and the money she needs on this occasion, like in previous ones, is to buy shoe making supplies like leather, fabric, shoe trees in various sizes, closures and soles among other materials.  She and her spouse want to continue making progress to support their children’s education and to give them a better quality of life.  She is asking for the loan to buy shoe making supplies.

loans.use: to buy shoe making supplies.

loans.name: Guillermo Reinaldo

texts.es:
Guillermo de 33años, empezó con su negocio de confeccion desde hace 8 años atrás ya que antes trabaja como guardián y no ayudaba con los gastos de la casa.

En la actualidad trabaja junto a su esposa quien le ayuda mucho en su trabajo, trabajan desde las 7 de la mañana a 7 de la noche.Gracias a Dios no tiene ningún problema hasta ahora en su negocio.

Está casado y tiene 2 niños de 8 y 9 años que estudian en escuela fiscal.Su prestamo lo quiere para comprar hilos y telas. 

Su meta es poder incrementar mas su negocio, comprando maquinas industriales para poder producir más rápido y mejor su mercadería.
texts.en: Guillermo is 33 years old. He began his manufacturing business 8 years ago, and he previously worked as a guard and did not contribute to the household expenses. Right now he works along with his wife who helps him a lot with his work. They work from 7 in the morning to 7 at night. Thanks to God, until now he hasn’t ever had any problems with his business. He is married and has two children aged 8 and 9 who are in public school. He would like this loan to buy thread and fabric. His goal is to be able to further expand his business, buying industrial machines in order to work more quickly and make better products.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric.

loans.name: Theresie

texts.en:
Theresie is 24 years old with 2 children aged one and two. She is married to a carpenter. She sells wood in a store she has run for 2 years.

Therese would like a loan to buy wood, varnish and nails. She hopes to use any profits to renovate her house. One day, she would like to own a table saw for her business.

loans.use: to buy more wood, varnish and nails

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is 21 years old and married with no children. She owns a general store which she has run for 2 years. The loan will be used to buy cooking oil, andazi (fried dough) and biscuits to sell in her store.

Dative will use any profits towards buying a cow. She would like to one day be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 30 years old and has 3 children aged 8 to 10. All of them are currently in school.  She sells foodstuffs such as beans and maize in a store she has run for 4 years.

Jeannette would like a loan to buy more beans and maize to sell. Any profits will be used to renovate her house. She dreams to one day be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 22 years old and is single. He sells foodstuffs such as peanuts, sorghum and maize in a store he has run for 4 years. The loan will be used to buy beans, maize, sorghum and peanuts to sell in his store.

He would like to use any profits to buy materials to renovate his house. He dreams to one day own a motorcycle to create more income for himself.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Corazon De Maria Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó gracias a una D. las miembros, quien se informo sobre el programa D. mujeres emprendedoras y luego D. eso formó y organizó a sus vecinas y amigas, D. allí surge el comité llamado Corazón D. María, que está formado por 15 mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras.
Un ejemplo D. trabajo es la señora Zunilda, quien gracias a su taller D. costura pueD. salir adelante y ayuda a su familia. Comenta que le va muy bien en su trabajo pues siempre tiene muchos pedidos y trabajos, ella se considera una persona muy trabajadora, luchadora y emprendedora. Ella diariamente lucha por darle a su familia un futuro mejor y un diferente estilo D. vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas, hilos, botones y cierres, lo cual le será D. mucha ayuda en su taller, está agradecida con la fundación y con kiva por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed thanks to one of its members who learned about the program for women entrepreneurs. After that she organized her neighbors and friends, and from that came the communal bank called Corazón D. María (Mary’s Heart) which is maD. up for 15 hardworking and tenacious women. 

An example of that work is Zunilda, who, thanks to her sewing shop, has been able to get ahead and help her family. She says that her work is going very well since she always has a lot of orders and work. She considers herself to be a hardworking, tenacious, and enterprising woman. She works hard every day to give her family a better future and a new way of life. 

She asks for a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and zippers which will be a great help to her shop. She thanks the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity they’ve given her.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and zippers.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Comenzó con un pequeño tramo donde vendía variedad de productos de abarrotería, su nombre es Maria De Los Ángeles con el tiempo y su buena inversión de los financiamientos su negocio fue creciendo ahora también tiene un tramo de venta de productos plásticos en variedad. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a su vivienda que es donde está ubicado su negocio. el motivo del crédito es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, fideos, huevos entre otros.
texts.en: Maria De Los Ángeles began with a small space where she sold a variety of grocery products. With time and good loan investments her business has grown. Now she also has a space where she sells a variety of plastic products. The majority of her clients come to her home which is where her business is located. The purpose of the loan is to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, noodles, eggs, and other items.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, noodles, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 27 years old and has 2 children ages 4 and 6. She is married to a businessman. She has been selling pesticides for 2 years. Seraphine would like a loan to buy pesticides for growing onions and tomatoes. She would like to use any profits to buy a motor bike which will help grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more pestcides for sale.

loans.name: Irma Luz

texts.es: La señora Irma tiene 55 años de edad y ha dedicado los últimos 10 años a la confección de prendas de vestir sobre medida y por encargo  directamente a los clientes. El taller de la señora Irma se encuentra en su propia casa donde labora ella sola.  Para seguir con su labor, la señora Irma desea comprar insumos para su negocio como son hilos y telas; con lo anterior ella busca aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus tres hijos y su esposo quienes dependen de ella.
texts.en: Irma is 55 years old, and for the last 10 years she has been making tailor-made custom clothes for her clients. The shop where Irma works is in her home where she works alone. To continue her work, Irma would like to buy merchandise like thread and fabric for her business. With that she aims to increase her profit and to improve the quality of life for her three children and spouse who depend on her.

loans.use: to buy products like fabric and thread.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en: Faustin is 35 years old with 4 children ages 1 to 12. The eldest child is in school. He sells clothes in a store he has run for 13 years. Faustin would like a loan to add different types of clothes to sell in his store and also to buy sorgham to sell. He hopes to use any profits from the business to buy a motor bike. He dreams to one day own a bigger clothing store.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 45 years old with one child aged 14. He is married to a businesswoman. He has been selling foodstuffs for 2 years. He would like a loan to buy beans and maize to sell. Emmanuel would like to use the profits to build his own business space so he does not need to rent space.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize for sale

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.en: Anne Marie is 50 years old and has 7 children aged 17 to 28. All of them have attended school. Her husband works as a farmer. She sells vegetables and foodstuffs in a store she has run for 7 years. Anne Marie would like a loan to buy beans, tomatoes, and sorghum to sell in her store. She would like to use any profits to buy a motor bike to help with her business.

loans.use: To buy more beans, tomatoes and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Gratien

texts.en:
Gratien is 33 years old and married, with two children who are between two and four years old. He owns a sewing business. This is his tenth year in this business and he works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day, except Saturday. Gratien currently employs one person to help him.

Gratien has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more materials for his sewing. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for his sewing.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La socia continua con su actividad principal de artesanía, la socia  desea invertir en la compra de hilos y cuero, la socia fabrica mochilas, porta celulares, bolsos, carteras, monederos, cartucheras, bolsitas; la socia también compra  accesorios como cierres, botones, cuerdas, mostacillas. La socia desea seguir creciendo y repartir los souvenirs a clientes en diferentes tiendas de ventas de artesanías, la socia desea crecer y llegar a mas clientes de este modo podra dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la realizacion de sus diferentes trabajos.
texts.en: The borrower will continue her artesian crafts business, and will invest in thread and leather. She makes backpacks, cell phone cases, purses, wallets, coin purses, containers and small purses. The client also buys accessories such as clasps, buttons, string, and beads. She hopes to keep growing her business and distributing her souvenirs to clients in different artesian goods shops. She wants to grow and have more clients and thus extend a higher quality of life to her children. She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of materials for her various activities.

loans.use: invest in thread, leather, clasps, buttons and string.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras, tiene 31 años es madre de 4 hijos, se dedica a la venta de animales menores como gallinas, carnero y a veces reces en Huascahua, esta en Finca hace 5 años, en todo este tiempo le enseñaron en las capacitaciones a ser mas responsable y poder aumentar su negocio. Con los préstamos recibidos anteriormente pudo educar a sus hijos, y comprarse las cosas necesarias para su casa, esta muy feliz en Finca. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en traer animales para venderlos en las ferias.
texts.en: Lucia is a member of the communal bank Alondras. She is 31 years old and the mother of four children. She sells small farm animals like hens and sheep and sometimes cattle in Huascahua. She’s been involved with the Finca Peru for five years, and during this time they’ve taught her how to take on more responsibilities and expand her business.  With the loans she’s gotten in the past, she was able to educate her children and to buy necessities for her home. She is very happy with Finca Peru. She will invest the loan she’s requested into bringing animals to the market to sell.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell at her business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a farmer in Kitale producing maize, milk, beans, and other vegetables for the local market. He is single and has been in farming for 20 years. He currently employs one farmhand.

Francis has requested for a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for a venture into the transport business. He says the transport business will help him improve his income and, later, expand his farming business.

Francis says farming has become competitive and requires more capital to produce sufficient quantities to be able to make a profit.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Marcelina Teresa

texts.es: Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras, tiene 48 años, es madre D. 5 hijos, venD. salchipollos y es feriante venD. cereales, esta en Finca 3 años, durante el tiempo que esta en Finca logró ampliar su capital D. trabajo, con los primeros préstamos que saco se compró su carrito para vender sus salchipollos, ahora tiene buena cantidad D. ahorros, con esfuerzos y esmero logró juntar dinero y cumplió una D. sus metas que fue abrir su recreo, el préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en la compra D. gaseosas y cerveza.
texts.en: Marcelina is a member of the communal bank Alondras. She is 48 years old and the mother of 5 children. She sells chicken sausages and is a grain merchant. She has been working with Finca Peru for three years. During that time she’s been able to increase her working capital. With her first loans she bought a cart to sell chicken sausages. Now she has plenty of savings. With effort and dedication she’s been able to raise money and achieve one of her goals which was to open a stall. She will invest the loan she’s asking for today into the purchase of sodas and beer.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beer.

loans.name: Maria Petrona

texts.es: Maria Petrona se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y frutas y verduras. Tiene más de 9 años de tener este negocio en el que diariamente tiene que levantarse temprano y atender a sus clientes. Tiene 5 hijos pero ninguno está bajo su cargo, siempre con el esfuerzo que realiza constante por medio de su trabajo fue que pudo brindarles lo necesario. Ella solicita este crédito con el fin de invertir en la compra de verduras, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, huevo, concentrado, maíz entre otros. Sueña con ampliar su local pues esto le beneficiaria al tener la facilidad de ampliar su inventario.
texts.en: Maria Petrona sells basic grains, fruits, and vegetables. She has been doing this work for over 9 years, and every day she has to get up early and tend to clients. She has 5 children but none of them are under her care. With constant effort, through this work she could always provide the necessities. She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables, rice, beans, sugar, oil, eggs, feed, corn, and other products. She dreams of expanding her business, and it will benefit her to be able to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, rice, beans, sugar, oil, eggs, feed, corn, and other products.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: La socia Miriam, continua con el negocio de reparacion de computadoras, venta de accesorios y repuestos para computadoras, tambien compran maquinas de segunda mano para repararlas y luego las venden ellos repotencian maquinas y hay clientes que compran de este tipo. La socia desea invertir el credito en la compra de accesorios, repuestos, y computadoras de seegunda mano para repotenciarlos y venderlos. La socia desea poder comprar en un futuro cercano maquinas, laptop, cpu nuevos y venderlos al por mayor a diversas empresas y seguir progresando.
texts.en: Miriam is continuing her business. She repairs computers; sells computer accessories and replacement parts; and also purchases computers second-hand to repair and sell. There are clients who purchase refurbished computers from her. She wishes to invest her loan in the purchase of accessories, replacement parts and second-computers to refurbish and resell. In the future, she wishes to continue progressing by purchasing computers, laptops, and new CPUs to sell to different businesses.

loans.use: to purchase accessories, replacement parts and second-hand computers to refurbish and sell.

loans.name: Nirelda

texts.es:
Nirelda integrante del Banco comunal “Oportunidad” perteneciente a la comuna de Padre de las Casas, ubicada en la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa, se desempeña como modista desde hace 45 años, de manera independiente. 
Comenta que trabaja desde su casa en un lugar que habilitó como su taller. Ahí cuenta con dos máquinas de coser una es para puntada recta y la otra es multipunto.
Su horario de trabajo es flexible, ya que depende de los pedidos que realicen sus clientes. La temporada de más alta demanda es durante los meses de diciembre, enero y febrero, debido a las licenciaturas y matrimonios. 
Sus insumos los compra en la ciudad de Temuco, en locales donde los precios sean más convenientes económicamente. 
Las metas en su negocio son comprar una máquina de coser overlock. 
Con el crédito comprará materiales de construcción para habilitar una pieza para su taller y así organizar mejor los espacios. 
Nirelda vive junto a sus dos hijos, quienes trabajan de manera dependiente, comenta que uno de sus sueños es seguir trabajando, ya que le permite aumentar sus ingresos y disfrutar de su actividad. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio, lo que le ha generado mayores utilidades.
También comenta que las reuniones han sido un momento de esparcimiento, lo que le ha brindado descansar de sus labores domesticas.
El grupo por su parte es unido, responsable y ha logrado crear lazos de amistad, durante el tiempo. 
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía.  Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
Nirelda is a member of the communal bank “Oportunidad” (Opportunity) in the Padre de las Casas neighborhood, which is located in the city of Temuco. 

She makes clothes, and she has been working as an independent seamstress for 45 years. She works out of her home in a space that she’s made into a workshop. She has two sewing machines; one is for straight stitch and the other for multipoint. Her work hours are varied since she depends on client orders. The periods of greatest demand are during the months of December, January, and February due to graduations and marriages. She buys her raw materials in Temuco from places where the prices are the most economically advantageous. Her business goal is to purchase an overlock sewing machine. With the loan she will buy construction materials to build a room for her workshop and to better organize her space. 

Nirelda lives with her two children who work independently. She says that one of her dreams is to continue working since that allows her to increase her profits and enjoy her work. She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanze has given her since it has allowed her to invest in her business which has generated increased profits. She adds that the meetings have been fun and have provided a break from her work. The group in turn is connected, responsible, and has managed to create bonds offriendship over time.

Padre Las Casas is a neighborhood in the south of Chile in the city of Temuco, which is in the Araucanía region. Its name is in honor of the Spanish saint Bartolomé de Las Casas who defended the indigenous people during the American conquest. There is a large Mapuche population in this community whose economic basis is agriculture and commercial services.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a room in her workshop and to better organize her work space.

loans.name: Cenina

texts.es: Cenina es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras, tiene 64 años, es casada y madre de 6 hijos, tiene una bodega, esta en Finca desde hace 4 años, Finca le ayudó a afrontar los momentos mas difíciles de su vida, con la capitaciones que recibió logró ser una persona responsable, puntual, se siente muy bien en Finca, le encanta el ahorro que dice que es mas seguro que en su propia casa, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra arroz, azúcar y otros productos para implementar su bodega.
texts.en: Cenina is a member of the Alondras communal bank. She is 64, married and the mother of six children and has a small grocery store. For four years she has been associated with Finca, which helped her to confront the most difficult time of her life. With the training she received she has become a responsible, punctual person. She is very pleased with Finca. She loves having a nest egg, which she says is more secure than being in her own home. She will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of rice, sugar and other products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Blanca Rosemal

texts.es: Blanca es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita, tiene 33 años, es casada y madre de 3 hijos, se dedica a la compa y venta de cereales, esta en Finca desde hace 10 años, anteriormente ella compraba sus cereales en pequeñas cantidades y gracias a los primero préstamos que sacó pudo comprar en toneladas los cereales ahora su negocio le va bien, le gusta asistir a las reuniones porque hace amigas y se distrae, aprende mucho de las charlas que recibe en las capacitaciones, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizante, abonos para tener una buena cosecha. Su meta  es comprar su carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the Sarita communal bank. She is 33, married and the mother of three children. She buys and sells cereals.  She has been affiliated with Finca for 10 years. Formerly, she bought her cereals in small quantities however, thanks to the first loans she took out, she was able to buy grain by the ton. Now, her business is doing well. 

She enjoys attending meetings because she makes friends there and has a good time. She learns a lot from the talks and the trainings she receives. She will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of fertilizer and compost in order to have a good harvest. Her goal is to buy a car to transport her products.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost so she will have a good crop.

loans.name: Candida Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Candida se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general tiene 50 años. Ya tiene 2 créditos con Fundación que le han ayudado para aumentar su inventario en su negocio. Con este  nuevo préstamo comprara ciertos artículos del hogar, calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general, prendas de oro y plata y ropa interior. Nos cuenta que negocio le está dando muchas satisfacciones, está viendo el fruto de su trabajo y se siente feliz porque puede ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Sra. Candida sells general merchandise. She is 50 years old.  She has had two loans with the Fundación which have helped her increase her business inventory.  With this new loan she will buy certain household items such as shoes, cosmetics, general clothing, gold and silver items and underwear. She tells us that her business gives her a great deal of satisfaction. She is seeing the fruit of her labor and she is happy to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy household items such as shoes, cosmetics, general clothing, gold and silver items and underwear.

loans.name: Mirella Maria

texts.es:
Mirella de 37 años de edad, empezó con su negocio de venta de madera hace dos años debido a que en el sector hacía falta un negocio. 

Para realizar su trabajo no tiene horario fijo. Hasta ahora no ha tenido ninguna dificultad con si negocio.
Esta felizmente unido y tie u hijo de7 años de edad.

El prestamo lo quiere para comprar cemento, madera, bloques para su negocio. Su meta es poder terminar de construir un departamento que está haciendo para alquilar y así también tener una ayuda para los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Mirella, age 37, began her business selling timber two years ago because there was a lack of a business in this sector. She does not have a fixed schedule for carrying out her work. Up until now, she has had no problems with her business. She is happily married and has a 7 year old boy.

The loan she wants is for the purchase of cement, wood, and concrete blocks for her business. Her goal is to finish the construction of an apartment she is building to rent out in order to help with household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cement, timber, and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité “Maria Auxiliadora” se formó con la unión D. varias vecinas D. la comunidad D. Tacuruty D. la ciudad D. Santaní. Todas las integrantes tienen actividades independientes, pero también hacen actividades en conjunto para poder juntar un capital para usarlo ante posibles problemas. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz D. realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
Un ejemplo D. lucha es la señora Teresa, quien por medio D. la cría D. cerdos ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Comenta que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo ha logrado ir creciendo por medio D. su trabajo, pero que pese a ello le va muy bien, ya que tiene muy buena clientela. Ella quiere seguir con su trabajo, para que D. esa forma pueda seguir ayudando a su familia, es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra D. cerdos pequeños para la cría y posterior venta.
Ella al igual que sus amigas está muy contentas con el apoyo D. la fundación y D. kiva.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora group was formed when a number of residents from the Tacuruty community in the city of Santaní joined together. All of the members have their own independent activities, but they also work together on activities to raise capital for use in case of unexpected difficulties. The members have formed a very close group, able to work together well on activities that strengthen their camaraderie.

An example of hard work is Teresa, who has been able to help her family get ahead by raising pigs. She says that through her work she has been able to continue growing, but that it has taken a lot of sacrifice and effort. In spite of that, however, it is going very well for her, since she has good customers. She would like to continue with her work so that she can keep helping her family. Because of this, she is asking for a loan to purchase young pigs to raise and then sell.

She and her friends are very happy with the support of the foundation and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita, tiene 50 años, es madre D. 4 hijos, se dedica a la siembra y venta D. alfalfa, esta en Finca desD. hace 2 años, el primer préstamo que recibió lo invirtió en la compra D. semillas y repuestos para su carro, con la rentabilidad que le dio su negocio y sus ahorros pudo comprar su carro el mismo que lo hace trabajar, gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe D. Finca aprendió a invertir bien su dinero, a valorarse como mujer y educar bien a sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. otra parcela D. chacra para sembrar mas alfalfa. Su meta es comprarse otro carro.
texts.en: Maura is a member of the Sarita Communal Bank. She is 50 years old, she has 4 children, she is a farmer and she plants alfalfa. She has been a member of Finca Peru for 2 years she invested her first loan in the purchase of seeds and of spare parts for her car. Thanks to her savings and to the profitability of her activity she has been able to buy a car that she uses in her job. Thanks to the trainings received from Finca Peru she has learnt how to properly invest her money, how to realize herself as a woman and how to give a good education to her children. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of another parcel of farmland to plant more alfalfa. Her goal is to buy another vehicle.

loans.use: To buy another parcel of land to plant alfalfa.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.es:
La Sra. Gulnara pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alisson II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 51 años, está casada y tiene 02 hijos que ya son independientes.
Con la finalidad de apoyar con los gastos económicos de su hogar decidió emprender su negocio de venta de frutas, pero al ingresar al banquito comunal vió  la oportunidad de darle un giro a su negocio, compró al  crédito un mototaxi que puso en alquiler y de esa manera recibía diariamente su pago, con el tiempo ahorró y solicitó otro préstamo en su banquito, es así como adquirió otra unidad más. Con el alquiler de sus unidades pudo ahorrar para comprarse un terreno, donde podrá hacer realidad el sueño de la casa propia.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00,  pagará las últimas letras del segundo mototaxi y accesorios para el mantenimiento de las unidades.
Gulnara es una mujer luchadora,  uno de sus sueños es construir su casa en el terreno que compró gracias a las ganancias de su negocio, para poder acondicionar un ambiente donde pueda  implementar una tienda surtida.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por apoyarla y crecer junto a ella.
texts.en:
Gulnara is a member of the Alisson II communal bank, located in the Tarapoto district, within the San Martín department and province.  She is 51 years old, married, and has two adult children on their own.  In order to help with the household expenses, she decided to start her own business selling fruit, but upon joining the communal bank she saw the opportunity to give her new business a go and bought a moto-taxi with a loan.  She leased it out and in this way she received a daily payment.  After some time she saved some money and requested another loan.  This enabled her to buy another unit.  Renting out her units gave her the opportunity to buy some land, where she could make her dream of having her own house become a reality.


She will use the money from this loan of 3,000 PEN ($1,1125) to pay off the second moto-taxi and provide maintenance on both units.


Gulnara is a hard working woman.  One of her dreams is to build a home on the land that she bought, thanks to the earnings from her business.  She also wants to open a small, well-stocked, store [in her new home].  She is very grateful to “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for their support and for growing with her.

loans.use: to pay off her moto-taxi

loans.name: Luz Eneida

texts.es:
La señora Luz Eneida se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir a terceros, esta labor la aprendió de su madre quien la entreno y le enseño todo lo necesario para desempeñarse y poder trabajar. Este negocio de la señora Luz Eneida surgió debido a que a ella le toco renunciar a su anterior trabajo en un hotel puesto que no podía dedicarle tiempo a su hijo. Actualmente en su negocio la señora Luz Eneida tiene cinco trabajadoras y siete máquinas.
Con el fin de agilizar la entrega de los pedidos, la señora Luz Eneida requiere de la compra de una maquina plana, que le permita aumentar sus ingresos y a futuro conseguir nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Luz Eneida works making clothing for third parties.  She learned this work from her mother, who trained her and taught her everything she needed to know to perform this work.  Luz Eneida started this business after she left her old job at a hotel because she could not spend time with her son.  

Currently Luz Eneida's business has five workers and seven sewing machines.  In order to expedite order delivery, Luz Eneida needs to purchase a flat sewing machine.  This would allow her to increase her income and attract new customers in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a flat sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "SUMAC PURIRISUN"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Santiago en Tica Tica, en el Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Marleny, es nueva en el banco ella fue invitada a formar parte de este encantador grupo por su hermana mayor; la socia tiene 32 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 12, 10 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la elaboracion de gelatinas y de manera ambulatoria lleva  a vender a todos los clientes, ella tambien se dedica  a la elaboracion de comidas caseras para la venta tambien en forma independiente en su stand rotatorio; la socia solicita el prestamo para poder tener un capital de trabajo e invertir el prestamo en la compra de ingredientes como son gelatina para sus postres, arroz, azucar, aceite, fideos al por mayor para la realizacion de sus diferentes comidas caseras y la venta de estas. La socia soliciate l prestamo para invertir en la compra de sus ingredientes.

La socia se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de manera responsable y trabjar mucho para prosperar.
texts.en:
Marleny belongs to the communal bank "Sumac Puririsun," located in Tica Tica in the Santiago district of the department of Cusco.

Marleny is new to the bank.  She was invited to join this delightful group by her older sister.  She is 32 years old, lives with a partner, and has 2 children aged 12 and 10.  She has a business making gelatin treats that she takes to sell to all of her customers.  In addition, she produces homemade meals that she also sells on her own from a rolling stand.  She requests a loan so that she can have working capital to invest in the purchase of ingredients, such as gelatin, for her desserts, and rice, sugar, cooking oil, noodles at wholesale so she can make her various homemade meals and sell them.  She requests a loan to buy ingredients for her business.

Marleny pledges to make her payments in a responsible manner, and to work very hard in order to prosper.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make the various desserts and meals that she sells

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married with 4 children, and the first two are already in school. His farm produces maize and milk, which he sells locally. He also operates a motorcycle transport business.

Joseph has requested a loan of 90,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to construct a greenhouse. He says the greenhouse will improve his farming income, which will enable him to provide basic requirements for his family. He adds that his motorcycle transport business also stands to improve due to improved farming income.

He laments the high costs of farming.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Evelyn Rosina

texts.es:
Evelyn es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita, tiene 30 años, es madre de 2 hijos, tiene una Botica, esta en Finca desde hace 1 año y medio, con el primer préstamo que sacó compró medicamentos y otros accesorios para su negocio, gracias a la ayuda de Finca pudo abrir en otro lugar otra Botica, le gusta las capacitaciones porque aprendió a socializar con las demás socias, aprendió a valorarse como mujer e invertir bien su dinero. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de medicamentos para sus dos Boticas. 
Su sueño es ser distribuidora de Medicamentos por mayor a otras Boticas.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a member of the Sarita community bank.  She is 30 years old and has two children.  She has a pharmacy.  

She has been working with Finca for a year and a half.  With her first loan, she purchased medicines and other items for her business.  Thanks to the help of Finca, she was able to open a pharmacy in another location.  She likes the trainings because she learned to socialize with the other members, she learned to value herself as a woman, and to invest her money well.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase medicines for her two pharmacies.  Her dream is to become a wholesale medicine distributor to other pharmacies.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for her two pharmacies.

loans.name: Carmen Margarita

texts.es:
Carmen de 37 años, empezó con la fabricación de puertas y ventas de fierro hace 20 años atrás y realiza sus ventas en los pueblos.

Gracias a Dios no ha tenido ningún problema hasta ahora. Desafortunadamente no está casada pero tiene 4 hijos de 21, 19, 18 y el menor de 3 años los 3 hijos mayores trabajan y ayudan a mantener el hogar el hijo menor estudia en una escuela fiscal. 

Con el préstamo desea compra hierro para terminar de construir su casa y poder vivir mas cómodos y asi ubicar afuera de su casa un taller de adecuamiento de casa con hierro.
texts.en:
Carmen, who is 37 years old, began with the manufacture of iron doors and windows about 20 years ago and now she sells in the villages.

Thanks to God she has not had any problems so far.

Unfortunately she is not married but she has 4 children who are 21, 19, 18 and the youngest is 3 years old. The three older children work and help to maintain the home and the youngest attends a state public school.

With this loan she wants to buy iron finish building her house in order to live more comfortably and to be able to situate her workshop conveniently at home.

loans.use: to buy iron.

loans.name: Nidia Lucia

texts.es:
Nidia mujer emprendedora a logrado mejorar su vivienda, su negocio mediante los prestamos realizado. Cumpliendo así con la necesidad de tener mayor comodidad para su familia. Le agrego al negocio la venta de carne de res, cerdo y pollo además de mantener su venta de variedades.
El préstamo será invertido en la compra de mercaderías como: carnes, productos de cosméticos, perfumes, ropas, zapatos, bisuteras, prendas de oro laminados siendo un nuevo producto a ofrecer a sus clientes. Trabaja también mediante encargos por catálogo. Obtendrá ganancia que será para mayores comodidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Nidia, an entrepreneurial woman, has managed to improve her home and business through the loans she has made, creating greater comfort for her family.
She has added the sale of beef, pork, and chicken to her business, as well as continuing to sell other varieties of items.

The loan will be invested to purchase goods such as meats, cosmetics, perfumes, clothes, shoes, imitation jewelry, and gold plated articles as new products to offer to her customers. She also fills catalog orders. She will obtain increased profits which will be used for better comforts for her family.

loans.use: to purchase meats, cosmetics, perfumes, clothes, shoes, imitation jewelry and gold plated items.

loans.name: Sussy

texts.es:
La Sra. Sussy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 02 hijos de 16 y 6 años en edad escolar.
Siempre le gustó la costura, desde 1992 empezó a tomarlo como una alternativa de negocio para generar ingresos y poder ayudar con los gastos de su casa, su esposo la ayudó con la compra de una máquina de coser que poco a poco fue renovando con la ayuda del banquito y ahora cuenta con dos remalladoras, que le dan el buen acabado a las prendas que confecciona, por la calidad de su trabajo tiene clientes leales que recomiendan a otros, así también cuenta con clientes fijos como empresas que requieren de sus servicios para la confección de uniformes, es así como viene trabajando día a día para lograr sus sueños.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00,  comprará  telas, hilos para la remalladora, elásticos, blondas etc. Y además se proveerá de mercadería (ropa y zapatos) para la campaña navideña ya que tiene varios pedidos.
Sussy es una mujer muy empeñosa y trabajadora,  su sueño es contar con una empresa de confecciones formalizada, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a progresar.
texts.en:
Sussy belongs to the communal bank “Virgen de la Inmaculada” in the Tarapoto district, in the province and department of San Martín. She is 37, lives with a partner, and has 2 children aged 16 and 6 who are in school.

She has always enjoyed sewing, and ever since 1992 she has had a dressmaking business in order to generate income and help out with the household expenses.  Her husband helped her to buy a sewing machine that she eventually updated with the help of her communal bank, and now she has two commercial (overlock) sewing machines.  These machines give her garments a finished look.  Because of the quality of her work, she has loyal customers who recommend her to others.  She also has regular customers such as companies who need her services to make uniforms.  In this way, she has been working each day to achieve her dreams.

With this new loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy fabric, thread for the overlock machines, elastic, lace, etc.  In addition, she will stock up on merchandise (clothing and shoes) for the Christmas season, since she already has a number of orders.

Sussy is a very enterprising and hardworking woman.  Her dream is to have her own clothing company. She is very grateful for the Movimento Manuela Ramos organization for helping her to make progress.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread for the overlock machines, elastic, lace, etc.

loans.name: Lorenzo Saturnino

texts.es:
Lorenzo de 42 años, comenzó alquilando un carro para poder trabajar como taxista, con la ayuda de Dios pudo comprar un carro para poder trabajar para sí mismo. Trabajo todos los días de 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.

El único problema que presenta su trabajo es la delincuencia ya que su trabajo lo lleva a recorrer todos los sectores, anterior mente ya ha sido víctima de la delincuencia.

Esta felizmente casado y tiene 3 hijos de 10, 7, 5 años que estudian en escuela fiscal. Con el prestamo quiere mejorar su vivienda comprando cemento, arena, bloques. 
 
Su meta es poder terminar de pagar su vehículo y poder terminar de construir su vivienda para más comodidad.
texts.en:
42 year old Lorenzo began renting a car so he could work as a taxi driver. With the help of God, he was able to buy a car to do this work. He works everyday from 8 in the morning until 9 at night. 
The only problem with his work is the risk of crime as his work takes him to all neighborhoods and in the past he has been a victim of crime.
He is happily married and has 3 children aged 10, 7, and 5 who are all in school. He wants the loan to improve his house by buying cement, sand, and cinderblocks. 
His goals are to be able to finish paying for his vehicle and to finish building his house so it will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to improve his house by buying cement, sand, and cinderblocks.

loans.name: Sara Liliana

texts.es:
La Sra. Sara Liliana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene 31 años y 1 hija de 11 meses de nacida.
Cuando terminaba de estudiar su mamá le habló sobre los  banquitos comunales que daban oportunidades a mujeres para generar sus propios ingresos, ella muy joven y emocionada decidió ingresar a Manuela Ramos. 
Inició con un capital de S/. 400.00, que lo  invirtió en la compra de mercadería (ropa  para adultos), desde entonces se dedica a este negocio, muy a parte de las labores que realiza como técnica contable esto le ha servido para poder ahorrar, es así como viene asegurando el futuro de sus pequeña hija. 
Actualmente viene exhibiendo su mercadería en la bodega de su mamá y espera pronto tener su propio local.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00,  comprará  ropa para niños y adultos, zapatos para sus clientes fijos que son sus amigos de su oficina, y lo demás para ofrecer a sus parientes y vecinos por campaña Navideña.
Sara Liliana  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un negocio de venta de abarrotes  y otro de ropa, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de crecer y hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sara Liliana belongs to the community bank "Virgen de la Inmaculada" in the district of Tarapoto, in the province and department of San Martín. She is married, 31 years old, and has an 11 month old daughter.
When she was finishing studying, her mother talked to her about the community banks that give opportunities to women to generate their own income. She was very young and excited and decided to join one of the Manuela Ramos community banks. 
She began with S/. 400 of capital which she invested in buying merchandise (adult's clothes). Since then, she has run this business and, thanks to her labors in accounting, has been able to save and this is how she is securing a good future for her little girl.
She currently displays her merchandise in her mother's store and hopes to have her own stall soon.
She will use this new loan of $750 to buy clothes for children and adults and shoes for her established clients. Her clients are her friends from her office and she also sells to her family and neighbors before Christmas. 
Sara Liliana is a hardworking and enterprising woman. Her dream is to have her own business selling groceries as well as a clothes store. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for offering her the opportunity to grow and realize her dreams.

loans.use: to buy clothes for adults.

loans.name: Loida

texts.es: Loida, D. 57 años D. edad, es una mujer independiente y trabajadora. Está casada con Ricardo, vive acompañada D. su esposo, sus cuatro hijos D. 37, 32, 30 y 21 años, y una nieta a la que quiere mucho, instalado cómodamente en una casa D. su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Loida, es la venta D. comidas criolla, comida rápida como chifa. Comenzó vendiendo en una mesa en el mercado D. su ciudad, logrando crecer su negocio a base D. mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, además D. juntar un capital que lo invertiría para montar su restaurante, en la cochera D. su casa hace 2 años. Hoy brinda un servicio D. calidad a sus clientes, atendiendo buffets  y pedidos a domicilio, contando con la ayuda D. su esposo que se dedica a la cocina y sus hijos en la atención a los clientes. Lo  que le gusta D. su actividad es el tener a su familia unida; además D. los ingresos que percibe pudo solventar los estudios D. sus hijos, que ahora son su gran orgullo. Por otro lado está contenta con la buena acogida que tiene su restaurante, por eso tiene planes D. ampliar y mejorar los ambientes D. su negocio para una mayor comodidad para sus clientes. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con su negocio, desea seguir contando con ese apoyo, por eso se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. su cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en el acabo del piso, pareD. y los servicios higiénicos D. su restaurante
texts.en: 57 year old Loida is an independent and hardworking woman. She is married to Ricardo and they live with their 4 children who are 37, 32, 30, and 20 years old and a granddaughter whom they love very much. They all live comfortably in the house that they own. Loida works selling typical Peruvian fast food such as chifa (a fusion Chinese-Peruvian cuisine.) She began selling from a stand in the market in her town and, thanks to much work and dedication, and the addition of some capital, she was able to grow her business and opened a restaurant in the garage of her home two years ago. Today, she offers a quality service to her customers, catering buffets and events in people's homes. Her husband helps with the cooking and her children attend to the customers. What she likes about this work is that it keeps the family together, and the income enabled her to pay for her children's education, and they are her great priD.. On the other hand, she is very happy with the big welcome that her restaurant has received, and for this reason she has plans to extend and improve the premises of her business to offer greater comfort to her customers. This will be her 5th loan from the institution MFP and she is grateful for the financial support that has permitted her to proceed with her business. She hopes to continue to have this support and so she promises to make her repayments on time. She will use the requested funds to invest in finishing the floor, walls and restrooms of her restaurant.

loans.use: to invest in finishing the floor, wall, and hygienic services of her restaurant.

loans.name: Stand Fast Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Stand Fast” group from Lunsar, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000.00 SLL each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Isha is the leader of this group. The twenty-eight-year-old is married to a motor mechanic, and they have two children. Isha has been a businesswoman for five years now; she sells plastic buckets (for storing drinking water) and bathing bowls. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying seven dozen plastic buckets for sale.

loans.use: to buy seven dozen plastic buckets for sale.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta integrante del Banco comunal “Oportunidad” perteneciente a la comuna de Padre de las Casas, ubicada en la ciudad de Temuco. Se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo ropa de niños y adolescentes, desde hace 5 años.
Comenta que compra su mercadería en el barrio Meiggs ciudad de Santiago, en locales y distribuidoras donde los precios sean más convenientes económicamente.
Compra al por mayor, entre ropa, carteras y zapatos de guagua, generalmente productos que se vendan rápidamente. 
Sus productos los ofrece puerta a puerta y en su propia casa.
Con el crédito comprará ropa, para abastecer su negocio durante la temporada de navidad. 
Las metas en su negocio son establecerse en un local, para esto postuló en una galería, en la cual arrendaría un local comercial. 
Marta vive junto a su hermana, quien sufre de una discapacidad, su hijo de 8 años y una sobrina de 11 años de edad. 
Uno de sus sueños es comprar un vehículo, el cual le permitiría trasladar su mercadería. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio y con las utilidades de éste acceder a una mejor calidad de vida. 
Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal es muy unido, responsable y agradable, por lo que se siente muy cómoda participando.
Respecto a las capacitaciones, estas le han servido para organizar la contabilidad de su negocio.  
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía.  Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
Marta is a member of the community bank "Oportunidad" in the community of Padre de las Casas which is located in the city of Temuco. She is a tradeswoman selling clothes for children and adolescents, and she has been doing this for 5 years. 
She comments that she buys her merchandise in the Meiggs neighborhood of the city of Santiago from stalls and distributors who have good prices.
She buys clothes, handbags, and toddler shoes wholesale, and these are generally products that sell quickly.
She sells her goods door to door and also from her home.
She will use this loan to buy clothes to stock her business for the Christmas season.
Her goals for her business are to open a store, and for this she wants to find a mall where she could rent a store. 
Marta lives with her sister, who has a disability, her 8 year old son and an 11 year old niece. 
One of her dreams is to buy a vehicle which would enable her to transport her merchandise.
She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that the micro finance institute has offered her to invest in her business and to gain a better quality of life. 
She comments that the community bank group is very united, responsible, and nice, so she feels very comfortable being a part of it. 
The training she has received has has helped her to do the accounting for her business.
Padre Las Casas is a community in the south of Chile, close to the city of Temuco in the Araucanía region. It was named in honor of the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas, who defended the indigenous people during the conquest of America. It is noted for its large Mapuche population. The local economy is based on agroindustry and commercial services.

loans.use: to buy clothes to stock her business for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Calleb

texts.en:
Calleb is a farmer in the Murang'a area and has been in farming for 3 years. He produces maize, beans, and rabbit for the local market. He is 32 years old and single.

Calleb has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy pesticides for his beans and maize produce and to construct a rabbit unit (a bigger and better housing unit) for his growing number of rabbits. He adds that the income will improve his living standards and create a good foundation for his family.

Calleb states that price fluctuations and climatic changes are the main challenges in farming.

loans.use: to construct a rabbit unit and purchase pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy machinery (a compressor).

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es: La señora Luz Mery tiene como negocio una cafetería, en la cual trabaja hace cuatro años, en esta, ella trabaja sola en la semana y los fines de semana le colaboran dos personas más.   La señora Luz Mery desea comprar surtido para su cafetería como snaks, gaseosas, gomas de mascar, café, galletas dulces y de sal, dulces, entre otros productos. Lo anterior le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida tanto personal como laborar y a futuro adquirir una casa propia donde pueda tener su negocio.
texts.en: Luz Mery has a cafeteria business that she has been running for 4 years. She works alone during the week and at the weekends she has 2 other people who work with her. Luz Mery wants to buy supplies for her cafeteria such as snacks, sodas, chewing gum, coffee, cookies, crackers, candies, and other products. This will enable her to increase her income and so improve her quality of life, both her personal life and work life. In the future she hopes to have her own home and run her business from there.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as snacks, sodas, candies, and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy one bag of flour and one bag of rice for sale.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 47 años de edad, es una mujer, trabajador y muy dedicada. Vive con Emilio y sus tres hijos de 20, 16 y 14 años, instalados en una casa que es de su propiedad, que lograron comprar con mucho esfuerzo. Edith  se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, para eso cuenta con una bodega que abrió en su casa, comenzando con muy poca mercadería que logró comprar gracias a un pequeño capital que tenía ahorrado, luego con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logró hacerse conocida y ampliar su negocio. Lleva dedicada a ese negocio desde hace 20 años, contando con el apoyo de sus hijos para atender a los clientes, que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos. Lo que le gusta de su actividad  es el poder socializarse, logrando hacer nuevas amistades, con los cuales puede intercambiar ideas; además del ingreso económico que le genera y puede apoyar con los gastos del hogar a su pareja que se dedica al servicio de mototaxi. Si embargo, los clientes le insisten en la venta a crédito, por lo que niega debido a la impuntualidad de pago. Así mismo tiene planes de ampliar su bodega, en espacio y diversidad de productos. Este será el préstamo número 24 con la institución MFP, por ello espera seguir contando con su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes  como en créditos anteriores. Además de sentirse cómoda con su grupo de su banco comunal ya que considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de productos en general para surtir su bodega, y así tener más acogida y preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edith, 47, is a hardworking and dedicated woman.  She lives with Emilio and their three children, who are 14, 16, and 20 years old, in a house that they own.  They were able to purchase the house with a lot of effort. 

Edith works selling necessity items in a general store located in her home.  She started her business with very little merchandise that she was able to buy with money she had saved.  Later, with a lot of effort and dedication, she became well known and expanded her store.  She has had this business for 20 years.  Her children help her serve her customers, who are mostly her neighbors.  The thing she likes best about her business is being able to socialize and make new friends with whom she can exchange ideas.  In addition to the income she earns that helps with household expenses, her husband works as a mototaxi driver.  However, some customers insist on payment on credit, but she denies them because they do not pay punctually.  

She has plans to expand her store, both in space and in the diversity of products offered.  This will be her 24th loan with MFP, and she hopes to continue working together so that she can achieve her goals, as with her previous loans.  She feels comfortable with her community bank group since she considers the members to be responsible and supportive people.  

With the loan requested, she will purchase necessities to stock her store so that she can have more options for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase necessities to stock her general store.

loans.name: Rawelgboudou Group

texts.fr:
Mme RASMATA  est la représentante du groupe RAWELGBOUDOU. Elle est mariée  et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. Tous vont à l’école. Elle a 08 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des gâteaux et bonbons  depuis 10ans. Elle est représentée sur la photo par la trésorière du groupe. Elle s’approvisionne à  Sankar yaar en ville .Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  01 sac  de farine de blé, 03kg de sucre, 01 paquet de levure, 01kg de bicarbonate, 01 bidon d’huile pour la fabrication du gâteau et 01 carton de bonbons.

 Avec ses bénéfices, elle assure la scolarité de ses enfants  et augmente son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique et arriver à épargner.
texts.en:
Rasmata is the representative of the group RAWELGBOUDOU. She is married and the mother of four children, ranging in age from 6 to 17 years old. All of her children attend school. She is responsible for 8 people. 

She has been selling cakes and candies for 10 years. She is represented in the photo by the treasurer of the group. She buys her supplies from the Sankar "yaar" [street market] in town. Her customers are both men and women. 

She would like to buy a sack of wheat flour, 3 kg of sugar, a packet of yeast, 1 kg of baking soda and 1 jug of oil to make cake along with a box of candies. 

With her earnings she provides schooling for her children and increases her business activity. She dreams of opening a store and being able to save money.

loans.use: to buy a sac of flour, 3 kg of sugar, a packet of yeast, 1 kg of baking soda, and 1 jug of oil for making cake and 1 box of candies

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La Sra. Josefa  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Inmaculada” del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 66 años, está Casada y tiene 03 hijos que ya formaron sus hogares.  Tiene a su cargo a su mamá, debido a su edad necesita D. atenciones.
Trabaja desD. muy joven, ahora con mucha más razón, para generar ingresos para la educación D. sus hijos, primero empezó con la confección D. vestidos, luego compró un puesto D. ventas en un mercado D. la zona para vender huevos, desD. que ingresó a formar parte del banquito D. Manuela Ramos, en el año 2000, decidió buscar un negocio que pueda realizarlo en casa, es así como se deciD. por la venta D. asados a la parrilla y comida preparada, esta actividad la realiza por las tardes. 
Actualmente cuenta con una amplia clientela que la busca por la amabilidad y el buen trato que les brinda, además D. su rica preparación, ha salido adelante con este negocio y D. esta manera viene generando ingresos para los gastos D. su hogar.
Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00,  comprará  productos para implementar su negocio, como pollos vivos, ingredientes para sazonar, plátanos, 1 saco D. yuca, maíz, arroz y 10 sacos D. carbón para asar sus  parrillas, para así proveerse D. insumos y no le haga falta nada.
Josefa es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un negocio que vaya creciendo agregando nuevos productos, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle hacer realidad algunos D. sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sra. Josefa belongs to the “Virgen D. la Inmaculada” communal bank in Tarapoto district in the province and department of San Martín. She is 66, married and has three children who now have their own households. She cares for her elderly mother.

She has worked since very young and later with the goal of generating an income for her children’s education. First, she began making clothes and then she bought a stall in a market in the area to sell eggs. When she became affiliated with Manuela Ramos in the year 2000, she decided to look for a business she could operate at home. Thus she decided on the sale of barbecued meat and other pre-cooked food, tasks which she does in the afternoons.

Currently she has a broad customer base who seeks her out because of her friendliness and the good service she provides, as well as her delicious food. She has moved ahead in her business and in this way makes an income to take care of household expenses.

With this new loan of 3,000 soles she will buy products to supply her business such as live chickens, seasoning ingredients, plantains, 1 sack of cassava, corn, rice and 10 sacks of  charcoal to grill her barbecues in order to stock all her supplies so she will have everything she needs.

Josefa is a hardworking and enterprising woman. Her dream is to have a business that grows through adding new products. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for enabling her to make some of her dreams a reality.
