loans.use: to buy supplies: plantains, 1 sack of cassava, corn, rice, 10 sacks of coal, etc.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia tiene 62 años, es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. Sofia nació en la ciudad D. Juliaca y ahora radica en la ciudad del Cusco. En la ciudad del Cusco Sofia desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas.   

Sofia se dedica a la venta D. butifarras (La butifarra es un sándwich típico D. la gastronomía del Perú en base a un preparado especial del chancho llamado localmente jamón del país.), ella venD. sus productos en la puerta D. su casa D. su hija mayor. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
  
Sofia pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” D. la Asociación  Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cebolla, pan, jamón, tomates, rocoto y otras cosas más. 

Sofia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sofia is 62, married and has four children. She was born in the city of Juliaca and now lives in Cusco. There she conducts her business and other daily activities.

Sofia sells butifarras (a traditional Peruvian sandwich maD. from specially prepared pork, named locally the country’s ham). She sells her products in the doorway of her oldest daughter’s house. She has been engaged in this business for several years and it has been doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Sofia belongs to the “Ñahupacman Purisun”  communal bank of  Asociación Arariwa in Cusco. At this time she needs a loan to buy onions, bread, ham, tomatoes, hot peppers and other items.

Sofia is grateful for the opportunity provided her and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy onion, bread, ham, tomatoes, hot peppers and other items.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 31 years old and has been in farming for 4 years. He produces milk and maize for the local market. He is married with 3 children, aged between eight and twelve years.

Anthony has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this will boost his farming income and provide his family with milk for consumption and income to meet other family needs.

He laments the high capital costs of farming and animal feeds, especially for dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es: Bibiana se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida y tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de gaseosas y cervezas,ella vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en la feria de Anta desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida y venta de gaseosas y cervezas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,carne,pollo y verduras y tambien para comprar gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor.
texts.en: Bibiana continues with her business selling food and also soft drinks and beer. She sells from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m at the different street markets found in Anta. Bibiana wants to expand and improve her business selling food, soft drinks and beer. She is requesting a loan to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, meat, chicken and vegetables and also to buy soft drinks and beer wholesale.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies such as rice, meat, chicken and vegetables and also soft drinks and beer wholesale.

loans.name: Rister

texts.es:
La Sra. Rister pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Inmaculada”, del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 63 años, está casada y tiene 03 hijos que ya son independientes.
Se inició elaborando bocaditos para buffet (humitas, empanadas, juanecitos), es así como se hizo socia del banquito comunal porque era lo que le gustaba hacer y le sirvió para ayudar a su esposo con los estudios D. sus hijos que ahora ya son profesionales, pero tuvo que dejar D. trabajar por algunos incovenientes que surgieron en su vida, paralelamente vendía productos D. belleza por catálogo como Esika. Actualmente se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza y ropa para adultos ya que tiene clientes fieles que siempre están requiriendo estos productos y D. esta forma demuestra, con lucha y esmero, que se pueD. generar ingresos a cualquier edad.
Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00,  comprará productos D. belleza, ropa para niños, adultos y zapatos, para incrementar el stock D. su negocio, algunos D. ellos son pedidos.
Rister es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora,  gracias a su esfuerzo ha sabido surgir y mantenerce en el negoio.
texts.en:
Rister belongs to Virgen D. la Inmaculada Communal Bank, in the Tarapoto district, province and department of San Martín.  She is 63 years old and married, and has three children who are already on their own.

She became a member of the communal bank when she began making buffet snacks ("humitas" [corn tamales], meat pies, and "juanecitos" [a type of tamal maD. with rice]), because it was what she liked to do and it helped her to help her husband with the education of their children, who are all professionals now.  She had to stop working because of some problems that came up in her life.  On the siD. she was selling Esika beauty products by catalogue.

Currently she works selling beauty products and clothing for adults, since she has loyal customers who always need these products.  In this way she shows, with struggle and care, that you can generate income at any age.

With this new loan of 1,200 PEN she will buy beauty products, clothing for children and adults, and shoes, to increase the stock in her business.  Some of the products are requests.

Rister is a hard-working and enterprising woman.  Thanks to her effort she has been able to rise up and get by in her business.

loans.use: to buy her products (perfume and clothing).

loans.name: Crisosta

texts.es:
Crisosta tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Crisosta nació en la ciudad de Acomayo y  ahora radica en la ciudad del Cusco. En la ciudad del Cusco Crisosta desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas.   

Crisosta se dedica a la venta de comida, ella tiene un restaurante donde sirve desayuno, almuerzo y cena pero el local es alquilado. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
  
Crisosta pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. 

Crisosta se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Crisosta, 45, is married and has three children.  Crisosta was born in the city of Acomayo and now lives in Cusco. It is in Cusco that she carries out her work and daily activities.

Crisosta has a restaurant, where she serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner, but she rents the site.  She has been running the place for a year now, and everything is going well, thanks to the care she devotes to her work.
  
Crisosta is a member of the “Ñahupacman Purisun” community bank, which is part of the Arariwa Association of Cusco.  At the moment, she needs a loan to buy ingredients, such as sacks of rice and sugar.

Crisosta is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as sacks of rice and sugar, for her restaurant.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
L. señora aquilina es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, tiene 50 años D. edad y está casada con el señor José quien es apicultor, tienen 6 hijos, D. los cuales ya todos están casados y cada quien hizo su vida aparte, elL. tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, desD. hace mas D. 9 años.

Dice que decidió invertir en esta actividad, porque quiere ayudar a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa, ya que trabajaba demasiado y no gana lo suficiente para tener una buena solvencia económica, también así contar con una mejor calidad D. vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en L. compra D. mas mercancía como son: aceite, leche, arroz, galletas, agua, sopas, refrescos, huevos, jabón, etc. Y así tener mucho más surtido su negocio.

Una D. las metas que tiene doña aquilina para su negocio, es L. D. hacerL. crecer muchísimo, ya que está pensando en mas a delante ampliar un poco mas su local, ya que quiere poner una tienda D. venta por mayoreo, puesto que así contara con un amplio surtido y mejorara e incrementara mucho mas sus ingresos.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad y a los prestatarios D. kiva, por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que esto le servirá D. mucho, puesto que ahora pueD. continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Aquilina is an enterprising and very hardworking woman.  She is 50 years old and married to José, who is a beekeeper.  They have six children, all of whom are married and have their own lives.  She has had a grocery store for more than nine years.

She says that she decided to invest in this work because she wants to help her husband with the household expenses, since he was working too much and he does not earn enough to have good financial solvency.  They also are able to have a better quality of life.

She will invest the loan she received in buying more merchandise, such as oil, milk, rice, cookies, water, soup, soda, eggs, soap, etc., so her business has more stock.

One of Aquilina's goals for her business is to make it grow a lot, since she is thinking about expanding her store a little in the future.  She wants to open a wholesale store, since in that way she will have a wider assortment and she will improve and increase her income much more.

She thanks Fundación Realidad and the Kiva lenders for all the support and confidence they are giving her.  This helps her a lot, since now she can continue investing in her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise: oil, milk, rice, cookies, water, soup, soda, eggs, soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase boxes of milk, butter, margarine, sugar, canned food etc

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,ella tiene una tienda en la ciudad de Cusco donde vende pantalones,chompas,polos entre otras ropas,la socia tambien sigue trabajando como profesora del nivel secunadrio en el distrito de Anta,la socia por medio de este negocio y este trbajo saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar polos,pantalones,blusas y chompas al por mayor.
  
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hilda continues to sell clothing.  She has a store in the city of Cusco, where she sells pants, sweaters, shirts and other clothing.  She also continues to work as a high school teacher in the district of Anta.  Through these jobs, she is helping her children to get ahead.  She wants to increase and improve her clothing sales.  So she is asking for a loan to buy a greater quantity of polo shirts, pants, tops, and sweaters.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to meet her payments on time.

loans.use: to increase her shop's stock of pants, tops, and sweaters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kounawolow Group

texts.fr:
Mme AWA SOPHIE  est la représentante du groupe KOUNAWOLOW. Elle est veuve  et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 16ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Elle est restauratrice et vend des layettes pour bébé et d’autres objets tels que : des ensembles plateau et verres de table etc. depuis 15ans. Elle s’approvisionne à  la cité AN II et à Larlé en ville .Ses clients sont les voisins, les passagers, les invitations pour les fêtes ; baptêmes et mariages.

Elle veut  s’acheter  01 sac  de riz de 50kg, 01 bidon d’huile de 05l, 02 grosse boites de tomate et charger sa bouteille de gaz pour la préparation.

 Avec ses bénéfices, elle prend soin d’elle même et aussi de son plus jeune enfant. Elle ambitionne construire une petite maison pour son activité et assurer la scolarité de son enfant pour lui assurer un meilleur avenir.
texts.en:
AWA SOPHIE is the representative of the KOUNAWOLOW group. She is a widow and the mother of five children. The eldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 16 years old. One of her children attends school. She has two people to support.

She has a restaurant and, for the past 15 years, has been selling baby clothes and other objects such as sets of trays and glassware, etc. She gets her supplies from the AN II and Larlé sections of town. Her customers include neighbors, travelers, and invitations for parties, baptisms and marriages.

She wants to buy one 50kg bag of rice, one 5L can of oil, two large cans of tomatoes, and to fill her gas cylinder to prepare the food.

With her profits, she takes care of herself as well as her youngest child. She hopes to build a little house for her business and to send her child to school in order to ensure a better future for him.

loans.use: to buy one 50kg bag of rice, one 5L can of oil, two big cans of tomatoes, and fill her gas cylinder for preparation

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy eight gallons of palm-oil for sale.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: la señora  Paulina es una cliente antigua que  ha trabajado en grupo solidario, actualmente la señora es casada tiene cuatro hijos que están todavía estudiando y vive  la ciudad D. La Paz  la cliente  venD.   ropa en las feria D. las mañaneras llamada así porque empiezan a vender a las 5 D. la mañana en la populosa calle Tumusla que es ahí donD. se lleva a cabo esta feria D. todos los días, el crédito lo invertirá  para   la compra D. mercadería ropa al por mayor para su venta  D. fin D. año, ya que esta época tiene gran demandada y  desea proveerse D. mercadería, la cliente se siente feliz por ser beneficiada con el crédito, la señora es responsable y puntual con sus anteriores pagos razón por la  cual se elige   con el producto  D. crédito kiva.
texts.en:
Paulina is a longstanding client who has participated in a communal bank.  Currently, she’s married and has four children still in school; she lives in the city of La Paz and sells clothes at the “Las Mañaneras” market that is called that because they start selling at 5am on crowded Tumusla Street which is where this street market takes place every day.

She will use the loan to buy clothes at wholesale for the end of year season since this is when demand is high and she wants to stock up on merchandise.  She feels happy to receive the benefit of the loan; she was responsible and punctual with her previous loans which is why she’s chosen for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Maria Isaura

texts.es: La señora Maria Isaura es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a sus cinco hijos con quienes ha salido adelante pese a las dificultades económicas y afectivas por las que ha tenido que pasar en los últimos años. A sus 57 años D. edad, la señora Maria Isaura se dedica a la producción agropecuaria D. ganado y pollos. Actualmente ella requiere D. la compra D. 6 terneros y 20 pollos D. engorD., esto le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y D. esta forma brindarle una mejor calidad D. vida a sus cinco hijos y a futuro comprar más animales y aumentar la productividad D. su negocio.
texts.en: María Isaura is a very hardworking person who is dedicated to her five children that she’s raised despite economic and affective difficulties she’s had to go through these past few years.  At the age of 57, María Isaura raises livestock and chickens.  She needs to buy six calves and 20 chicks to fatten up which will allow her to increase her income to proviD. her five children with a better quality of life and in future buy more animals and increase her business’ production still more.

loans.use: to buy six calves and 20 chicks.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 31 years old and has been in farming for 8 years. His farm produces maize and beans, which he supplies to the local market. He is the father of one two-year-old child, and he lives with his family in Kitale, Western Kenya.

Silas has requested a farming loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the milk produce will help him take care of his children. Since farming is his only source of income, he wants to improve his farming business by reinvesting his profits in it.

He laments the unreliability of the rain and animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Judit

texts.es:
Judit se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora en y tambien esta vendiendo pasamaneria como escobillas,espejos,botones,agujas entre otros productos junto a su hija,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de pasamaneria. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar botones,agujas,hilos y espejos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Judit is still working as a teacher and still selling notions like brushes, mirrors, buttons and needles among other items with her daughter.  She supports her children through these businesses and she wants to expand the business so is asking for a loan to buy buttons, needles, thread and mirrors at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy buttons, needles, thread and mirrors at wholesale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 52 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y optimista. Esta separada de su esposo, pero vive en compañía de sus dos hijos de 24 y 17 años en su casa propia. Juana se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida al paso, como tallarin, arroz chaufa, pollos broaster y otros, todo lo prepara durante el día, para luego instalar su puesto de venta en el frontis de su casa durante la noche. Cuenta con la ayuda  de su hermana en la preparación y en la atención a los clientes, dándole un pago diario, de esa manera le apoya con un ingreso económico. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es contar con un ingreso económico  para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, además que le gusta cocinar, labor que aprendió gracias a su madre que le enseñó desde muy joven. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta es el cansancio físico que le ocasiona estas largas jornadas, pero es conciente que es su fuente de ingreso económico y desea continuar, por eso tiene planes de renovar sus utensilios de cocina, como también su puesto de venta. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el crédito concedido. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de madera para el arreglo de su puesto de venta, así como también, la  compra de utensilios para cocina.
texts.en:
Juana, 52, is a hardworking, optimistic woman.  She’s separated from her husband but lives with her two children who are 24 and 17 years old in her own house.  Juana prepares food like pasta, Chinese-style rice, Broaster-style chicken and others to sell to passersby.  She prepares everything during the day and then sets up her sales stand in front of her house at night.  Her sister helps her cook and take care of customers and she pays her daily thus helping her out with an income.  

What she likes about her work is having steady income to cover household expenses besides the fact that she enjoys cooking, something she learned from her mother who taught her how to cook when she was very young.  On the other hand, what she dislikes is the physical fatigue causes by long work days but she’s aware that this is her source of income and wants to continue.  Because of this, she wants to renew her kitchen utensils as well as her food stand.

This will be MFP loan #3.  She is grateful for the loan that’s been granted her.  She will use the requested amount to buy lumber to repair her sales stand and will also buy kitchen utensils.

loans.use: to improve her food stand's infrastructure and to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis, es un joven soltero de 21  años de edad,  él se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte el joven eligio este tipo de trabajo ya que le gusta tratar con la gente y porque le parece muy rentable.

Luis vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.

Luis es un joven trabajador luchador , responsable y muy trabajador con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Luis empezó a brindar este servicio en el año 2007 , gana semanalmente  un promedio de S/.315 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Luis invertirá este crédito para la darle mantenimiento general a su moto,. El  sueño del Joven Luis es tener su propia empresa de colectivos  y hacer crecer su negocio para que en futuro llegue a  ser un gran empresario de Transportes y para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su Madre ya que ella sufre de la enfermedad de diabetes, su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente y que pagara sus cuotas puntualmente .
texts.en:
Luis is 21 years old and single.  He has a transport business and chose this line of work because he enjoys talking to people and believes this business is very profitable.

Luis lives and works in Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.

Luis is a very responsible, hard-working young man who wants to get ahead.  He began his business in 2007 and earns an average 315 PEN per week.  The 1,000 PEN he receives from KIVA will be used for general maintenance of his motortaxi.  Luis would like to have his own long-distance taxi business some day so he can give his mother a better lifestyle.  She suffers from diabetes.  Luis is considered to be an excellent borrower who makes his loan payments on time.

loans.use: To pay for general maintenance for his motortaxi.

loans.name: Knight

texts.en:
Knight has been in farming for 10 years, with her produce going to the local market. She produces mainly maize and beans. She is married with 6 children aged between 12 and 2 years.

Knight has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says farming is her family's sole source of income and the acquisition of an additional cow will boost her milk income and improve her family's financial security.

She is concerned with high costs of production and unreliable rains. Knight is aged 34.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his professional university degree.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es: La señora Mirna tiene 29 años de edad, esta casada y es madre de dos hijos, Mirna se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, sus clientes son sus vecinos y amigos que le visitan a diario, doña Mirna se levanta muy temprano todos los dias para atender a sus clientes, en su pulpería vende desde granos básicos hasta embutidos, el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia para surtir su negocio, desea comprar algunos productos que no tiene en existencia, de esta forma podra vender mas y obtener mas utilidades.
texts.en: Mirna, 29, is married and the mother of two children.  She sells basic daily use staples in a grocery store she has at home.  Her customers are her neighbors and friends who visit her daily.  Mirna rises very early every day to tend to her customers.  In her grocery store she sells everything from basic grains to cured meats.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.  She wants to buy some products that she does not currently have in stock so that she can sell more and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Guapa está iniciándose en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria, siempre dentro de un ambiente de respeto y ayuda mutua. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también hacen actividades en forma conjunta para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo.
La Sra Serafina, es divorciada, tiene un hijo. Ella se dedica a la confección de sabanas y fundas, mediante en cual puede mantener a su hijo y paliar los gastos que surgen el día a día. Comenta que todo el sacrificio que hace es por hijo, pues quiere darle todo lo mejor para que no tenga que pasar por privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás insumos, los cuales le será de mucha ayuda en su taller.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa” women’s committee is starting the first cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s enterprising women program.  They work as a team and in a mutually supportive way always in a spirit of mutual respect and support.  Besides the individual work of each one of them, they also conduct group fund-raising activities in order to have some group capital.

Serafina is divorced and has a son.  She manufactures sheets and pillowcases that allows her to support her son and alleviate costs that arise day to day.  She comments that all the sacrifice she makes is for her son because she wants to give him all the best so that he should not have to go through any privations.  She’s asking for the loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other supplies that will be of much help in her workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic and more.

loans.name: Sougrekonta 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme Rasmata  est la représentante du groupe SOUGREKONTA 2. Elle est mariée  et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 32ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des  pagnes, des bijoux, des prêts à porter pour petit et grand depuis plus de 20ans. Elle s’approvisionne à  Lomé au Togo et à Abidjan en Côte d’Ivoire .Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes et les enfants.

Elle veut  s’acheter  01 balle de pagne, 05 douzaines de bijoux, 05 douzaines de prêt à porter.

 Elle utilise  ses bénéfices pour agrandir  son activité. Elle ambitionne construire une belle maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Rasmata is the representative of the SOUGREKONTA 2 Group.  She is a married mother of four children.  The oldest is 32 years old and the youngest is 20.  One is in school.  She supports three other people

For more than 20 years she has sold pagnes [traditional wraps], jewellery, and ready-to-wear clothing for everyone big to small.  She stocks up in Lomé in Togo and Abidjan in Côte d’Ivoire.  Her customers are men, women, and children alike. 

She would like to purchase one ream of pagnes, five-dozen pieces of jewellery, and five-dozen ready-to-wear items.

She uses her profits to grow her business.  She aspires to build a beautiful house in which to live.

loans.use: To purchase one ream of pagnes, five-dozen pieces of jewellery, and five-dozen pieces of ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
Magda tiene 41 años D. edad, es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene tres hijos. Magda nació en la ciudad D. Quillabamba y  ahora radica en la ciudad del Cusco. En la ciudad del Cusco Magda desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas.   

Magda es profesora y trabaja en un jardín en la ciudad del Cusco y en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta D. gelatina D. forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio D. venta D. gelatina y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
  
Magda pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” D. la Asociación  Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea para la educación, alimentación y vestimenta D. sus hijos.

Magda se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Magda, 41, is married and has three children.  Magda was born in the city of Quillabamba and now lives in the city of Cusco.  Magda carries out her daily and economic activities in Cusco.

Magda is a teacher, she works at a Kindergarten in Cusco and in her free time she’s a street vendor selling gelatin treats; she does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Magda belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Ñahupacman Purisun” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  On this occasion she needs the loan for her personal use, that is, to pay for her children’s education, food and clothing.

Magda is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means and commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to pay for her children's clothing, food and education.

loans.name: Maria Ninfa

texts.es: La señora María Ninfa en su finca ubicada en el municipio de Marinilla al oriente de Antioquia, se dedica junto con su esposo a la producción de leche y cultivos de frijol, cilantro y papas. La señora María Ninfa trabaja incansablemente para salir adelante con su pequeño hijo de cuatro años quien a su corta edad sufre de varias enfermedades que requieren de tratamientos muy costosos. Para poder tener más ingresos la señora María Ninfa desea comprar una vaca y abono para su cultivo de cilantro con el fin de poder generar mayores ingresos que le permitan tener la capacidad económica para sostener a su familia y los tratamientos de su hijo a quien sueña verlo estudiando y con una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Ninfa and her husband are dairy farmers and grow beans, coriander and potatoes on their farm located in the town of Marinilla in east Antioquia.  María Ninfa works tirelessly to get ahead with her little, four-year-old son who at his short age suffers from several illnesses which require very costly treatments.  

In order to earn more income, María Ninfa wants to buy a cow and manure for her coriander crops to generate higher income that will give her the economic capacity to support her family and her son’s treatments.  She dreams with seeing him going to school and having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow and manure for her coriander crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase iron, cement, and zinc sheets

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer and the mother of 3 children, with the last two being of school-going age. She has been in active farming for 20 years. Her farm produces maize, vegetables, passion fruit and tomatoes.

Mary has requested Juhudi Kilimo to advance her a loan of 52,000 KES to enable her to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the cow will help her in feeding and educating her children. She adds Juhudi Kilimo has uplifted farmers' living standards with the farming loans.

Mary is, however, worried about the high costs of animal feeds.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora. Vive con Rodolfo, fruto de esa unión tiene dos hijos de 24 y 13 años, instalados cómodamente en una casa de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Raquel, es la venta de ropa de damas, caballeros y niños, así como zapatos que trae a pedido desde la ciudad de Lima, para  luego venderlos de forma personal a sus vecinos y familiares, muchas veces al contado, así como también a crédito. Tiene 8 años dedicándose a esta actividad. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder socializar con las personas, brindarles un buen servicio en la atención, así como también  el contar con un ingreso económico, ya que con el sueldo de su pareja en una empresa privada, no les alcazaba teniendo muchas necesidades tanto en el vestir como en la alimentación. Tiene planes de continuar y hacer crecer el volumen de stock de sus mercaderías. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para crecer con su negocio, por eso dice, será puntual con los pagos de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores. Por otro lado, se siente contenta con su banco comunal, pues hasta el momento le va muy bien. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa en mayor cantidad y anticipándose a la campaña navideña, desea ampliar su stock de mercaderías.
texts.en:
Raquel, 42, is an enterprising, hardworking woman.  She lives with Rodolfo and they have two children who are 24 and 13 years old.  They all live together comfortably in their own house.

Raquel’s activity is selling women’s, men’s and children’s clothes as well as shoes that she brings on order from the city of Lima to then sell personally to her neighbors and family members often for cash but also on credit.  She’s been in this line of work for 8 years.  What she likes about it is being able to socialize with people and provide them with good service as well as having a steady income since her spouse’s salary from his job in a private firm sometimes was insufficient to cover their food and clothing needs.  She plans to continue and to increase the volume of her stock merchandise.

This will be MFP loan #3 and she feels happy and grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit to grow in her business which is why she says she will be punctual with her payments like she’s been in previous loans.  On the other hand, she feels happy in her communal bank because they have been doing well to date.  She will use the requested amount to buy clothes in larger amounts to be ready for the Christmas season; she wants to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Verónica Patricía

texts.es:
La señora Verónica tiene 34 años de edad, es acompañada con dos hijos uno de 5 años y otro de 3 años.

Ella realiza actividades del hogar, pero desde hace dos años se ha dedicado a vender ropa para adultos y niños. Verónica viaja casi 200 kilómetros, para comprar la mercadería en la capital del país, debe abordar dos buses, sale a las 5:00 a.m. y regresa a las 4:00 p.m.

Verónica vende la ropa de comunidad en comunidad, caminando a pie, cargando la mercadería, trabaja por lo menos 8 horas diarias, recorriendo una comunidad por día. Por la experiencia que tiene, ella quiere comprar suficiente mercadería, para la navidad, ya que es una época en la cual la venta se incrementa. 

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar: 48 pantalones para adulto y 5 pantalones para niño, 5 docenas de blusas para mujer y ropa interior para hombre y mujer. Además quiere comprar sandalias, por que actualmente no tiene ese producto disponible.

Con el préstamo, ella diversificara su negocio, comprara a mejores precios por que lo hará por mayor, ya que ella necesita tener mercadería, para ofrecer y obtener mejores ingresos. Ella desea tener fortalecido su negocio, para contratar a otras personas que le ayuden a vender, ya que en estos momentos lo hace sola.
texts.en:
Verónica is 34 years old, accompanied by two children who are 5 and 3 years old.

She is a homemaker but for the last two years has been dedicated to selling adult and children's clothing. Verónica travels almost 200 kilometers to buy the merchandise in the country's capital. She has to take two buses, and leaves at 5AM and returns at 4PM.

Verónica sells the clothings from community to community walking, carrying the merchandise. She works at least eight hours a day, covering one community a day. From the experience she has, she wants to buy enough merchandise for the holidays since it is a time when sales increase.

The loan will be used to buy 48 adult pants and 5 children's pants, 5 dozen women's blouses and men's and women's underwear. Additionally, she wants to buy sandals because currently she does not have this product available.

With the loan, she will diversify her business. She will buy at better pricess because she will do it at wholesale since she needs to have merchandise in order to offer and obtain better income. She wishes to establish her business so she can hire other people to help her sell since right now she does it alone.

loans.use: to buy 48 adult pants and 5 children's pants, 5 dozen women's blouses, sandals, men's and women's underwear.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
la señora Luz Marina se dedica a la comercializacion de productos de primera necesidad como ser arroz, manteca, frijoles, maiz, harina, azucar, refrescos, pan etc.
Luz vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, en sus ratos libres visitan la iglesia con su familia, Luz desea incrementar su negocio, el credito lo utilizara para comprar productos para la pulperia y asi tener una mejor variedad de productos para sus clientes.
el sueño de Luz es tener un mercadito grande en donde pueda vender de todo.
texts.en:
Luz Marina works selling basic household necessities such as rice, lard, beans, corn, flour, sugar, soft drinks, bread, etc.  Luz lives with her husband and three children.  In her free time she goes to church with the family.

Luz wants to expand her business.  She will use the loan to buy products for the grocery store to have a better variety for her customers.

Luz's dream is to have a large market in which she can sell everything.

loans.use: to buy groceries, household necessities, soft drinks, dairy products, milk, and bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a grain-processing machine

loans.name: Marta Lucia

texts.es: La señora Marta Lucia a sus 30 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de calzado por catálogo para con esta labor conseguir sus propios ingresos y brindarle a su hijo de 7 años la educación y bienestar que él necesita. Actualmente la señora Marta Lucia desea comprar mercancía para la venta como calzado y prendas de vestir para dama  y caballero con el fin de diversificar su negocio y conseguir mayores ingresos para brindarle a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en: Marta Luica is 30 years old and does catalog shoe sales.  This allows her to generate her own income so that she can provide an education and see to the well-being of her seven year old son.  Marta Luica now wants to buy merchandise, such as shoes, and men’s and women’s clothing, in order to diversify her business and increase her income, so that she can offer her son a good quality of life and care for his well-being.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Lily

texts.es: Lily, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora. Vive con William y su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad en una casa que es de su propiedad, que logró comprar como mucho esfuerzo con ayuda de su pareja. El negocio que tiene Lily es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para eso abrió una bodega en su propia casa, con un capital inicial fruto de los ahorros en común que tiene con su pareja. En un inicio compraron pequeños productos llegando a venderlos todos, y luego de dos años llegó a tener acogida su negocio. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico que le sirve para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar, ya que muchas veces con los ingresos económicos de su pareja que se dedica al servicio de mototaxi, no le alcanzaba. Además por la buena acogida que tuvo, se siente a gusto y tiene planes de ampliar y hacer crecer su negocio aumentando el stock de productos. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, esta contenta de contar con un apoyo financiero para seguir avanzando con su negocio, por eso se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, ya que considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles. Los invertirá en compra de abarrotes y golosinas en mayor variedad, ya que considera que a mayor variedad logrará mayor preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lily is 36 years old and is a hard working dynamic woman.  She lives with William, her young 3 year old son, in a home of her own, which she was able to buy with lots of effort and help from her mate.  Her’s is a grocery business which she runs out of her home.  She opened it with her and her husband’s savings.  At first they only bought a few items, which they sold out of, and after two years her business became profitable.

What she likes about her business activity is that she can count on an income that helps her husband with the household expenses, especially because at times his income was not enough.  He drives a moto-taxi.  Besides, her profits make her feel comfortable and she plans to expand and grow her business and increase her stock of products.

This will be her second loan through MFP.  She is happy to be able to count on financial backing in order to continue moving ahead with her business, and she is committed to making her payments as with previous loans.

Aside from feeling comfortable with the communal bank, she considers its members to be reasonable and united.  She will use the 1,500 PEN ($575) from this loan to buy groceries and snacks in quantity.  She believes that an increased selection will better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy groceries and snacks.

loans.name: Nancy Dixiana

texts.es:
la señora Nancy Dixiana tiene 29 años de edad y esta casada, altualmente se dedica a la venta de desayunos, almuerzos, golosinas y refrescos, atiende a sus clientes de lunes a domingo, dixiana es una mujer emprendedora de buenos principios y con deseos de superarse, el credito lo utilizara para mejorar su negocio,  desea ampliarlo y comprar algunos utencilios de cocina, el resto lo utilizara en la compra de productos para elaborar sus comidas.
la meta de Nancy es que los clientes que le visiten y se sientan satisfechos y que siempre regresen.
texts.en: Nancy Dixiana is 29 years old and married.  She currently sells breakfasts, lunches, candy, and soft drinks.  She serves her customers from Monday until Sunday.  Dixiana is an enterprising woman with strong principles who wants to better herself.  She will use the loan to improve her business; she wants to expand it and to buy cooking utensils.  She will use the rest to buy products to make her foods.  Nancy's goal is for her customers to visit her, feel satisfied, and always return.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, pots, frying pans, beef, pork, and chicken, vegetables, condiments, disposable plates and cups, napkins, soft drinks, juice, bread, beans, rice, sugar, lard, oil, potatoes, and yucca.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es: Ivania Del Socorro con sus amigas,  Alejandra catalina quien se dedica a vender productos de la Avon, Dora del Carmen  se dedica a la venta de pan y cuajada, Audelis Del Carmen tiene una mini pulpería  su sueño es ampliar mas el negocio, Aurelia Maria se dedica  a la venta de golosinas su objetivo es comprar más producto y mejorar su clientela, Yesenia Marcelina quiere mejorar la venta de cuajada para salir adelante con su familia, Anielka se dedica a la venta de cerdo ella quisiera comprar más concentrado, Vilma Isabel se dedica a la venta de golosina, y pascual Arnulfo se dedica al destace de cerdo. Todas estas personas tienen un objetivo que cumplir para salir adelante. La señora Audeli de 47 años de edad tiene una mini pulpería ella es una persona con mucha cualidades  responsable, honrada con muchas ganas  de trabajar y salir adelante con su negocio. Audelis le gustaría comprar arroz, aceite, maíz, frijoles huevo, fosforo, canela, gas  y detergente y otros,  al por mayor para satisfacer las necesidades de los cliente.
texts.en: Ivania del Socorro is in this group with her friends, Alejandra Catalina, who sells Avon products, Dora del Carmen, who sells bread and curd, Audelis del Carmen, who has a small grocery store and whose dream is to expand her business, Aurelia Maria, who sells candy and whose goal is to buy more products and improve her clientele, Yesenia Marcelina, who wants to improver her sales of curd in order to get ahead with her family, Anielka, who sells pork and who would like to buy in a more concentrated way, Vilma Isabel, who sells candy, and Pascual Arnulfo, who butchers pork.  All of these people have a goal to reach to get ahead.  Forty-seven-year-old Audelis has a small grocery store.  She is a person with a many qualities, she is responsible, honest, and has a great desire to work and get ahead with her business.  Audelis would like to buy rice, oil, corn, beans, eggs, matches, cinnamon, gas, detergent, and other things wholesale in order to meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: rice, oil, corn, beans, eggs, matches, cinnamon, gas, and detergent

loans.name: Gilma

texts.es:
La Sra. Gilma pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la inmaculada” del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 65 años, está casada y tiene 03 hijos los cuales son independientes.

Hace 15 años, viendo la necesidad D. generar otra fuente D. ingresos para los gastos diarios, decidió emprender un negocio que inició con un préstamo D. S/. 100.00, dinero que le sirvió para comprar algunos casilleros D. huevos, paquetes D. papel higiénico, D. esta manera y con la ayuda del banquito comunal fue surtiendo su pequeña tienda surtiéndola con nuevos productos para vender como carne, huevos, todo tipo D. bebidas, granos y verduras, cuenta con una buena clientela, por encontrarse en una zona estratégica.  Ella cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo.
Este préstamo D. S/. 1700.00 soles le servirá para el adelanto D. una conservadora que piensa comprar que le  ayudará en la conservación D. los productos cárnicos por más tiempo y así brindar productos D. calidad a sus clientes.
Gilma es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, su sueño es implementar un Mini Market donD. pueda brindar otros servicios a sus clientes, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y está muy contenta con lo que hasta ahora ha logrado.
texts.en:
Gilma belongs to the communal bank Virgen D. la Inmaculada, in the district of Tarapoto in San Martin province. She is 65, married and has three grown-up children.

15 years ago, seeing the necessity of generating another source of income to proviD. for the household expenses, Gilma decided to start a business, beginning with a loan of 100 nuevos soles which she used to buy some cartons of eggs and rolls of toilet paper. With this money and with the help of the communal bank, she stocked her little shop with products to sell, including meat, eggs, all kinds of drinks, grains and vegetables. She has a good customer base as her shop enjoys a strategic location.

Gilma has the support of her husband. This loan of 1700 nuevos soles will proviD. an advance on a cooler she is planning to buy to help her keep meat products fresh for longer and offer her customers a better quality of product. Gilma is an enterprising and hardworking woman. Her dream is to start up a mini-market where she can proviD. other services to her customers. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement and is very happy with what she has achieved up to now.

loans.use: to put a downpayment on an electric appliance.

loans.name: Rosario Yen

texts.es:
Rosario Yen tiene 40 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene cinco hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 23, 22, 19, 15 y 9 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC LUCHANDO JUNTOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Zapotal nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Comerciales en su mayoría. 

Rosario se dedica a atender en un comedor de comida, vende desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas de lunes a Sábado, Las compras de las productos los realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, carnes, frutas como la sandía, melon, frutillas, verduras y comprar mesas, sillas, manteles para que los comensales esten cómodos al momento de servirse los alimentos preparados.


Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudará a obtener mayores beneficios. El sueño es poder agrandar el negocio, no se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema  en el negocio.
En los tiempos libres le gusta ayudar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Rosario Yen is 40 years old.  She has a partner and five children who are 23, 22, 19, 15, and 9 and they all live together in Ventana Canton in the Los Ríos Province.

The Luchando Juntos Communal Bank is located in the newer Zapotal area in the Ventanas Canton.  They primarily deals with commercial work.

Rosario runs a canteen for a living.  They do their buying and selling in Ventanas.  She is asking for the loan to improve this business.

The loan will help her make greater profits.  Her dream is to expand her business and she hasn't had any problems at all with her business.

In her free time she likes to help out in agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase meats, chickens, fruits and vegetables, and chairs, tablecloths, and tables

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. His farm produces maize and beans for the local market. He is married with 4 children aged between 11 and 2 years. He does lumbering for additional income.

Meshack has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to purchase a power saw machine to help him gain more income through renting as well as lumbering and his farming. He adds the business has been lucrative and gives a boost to his farming, especially on meeting the high costs of farm inputs and fluctuating market prices.

He notes that animal diseases and a poor road network remain the major challenge for farmers in the area.

loans.use: to purchase a power saw

loans.name: Mariela Rocio

texts.es:
Mariela es socia del Banco Comunal “Kapia Marca”  ubicado en el distrito,  provincia de Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil casada y  tiene dos hijos, la señora estudió educación secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace más de cuatro años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio, ella se dedica a la panadería y venta de vajillas.

Mariela solicitara un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1,500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de ocho cajas de vajillas (platos, cucharones, tazas, ollas).  Trabaja junto con su esposo, la señora cuenta que su esposo se encarga de comprar las vajillas en Tacna y las venden en Puno.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener su casa y carro propio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad  del préstamo.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the Communal Bank "Kapia Marca," located in the Yunguyo province and department of Puno. She is 26 years old, married, and has two children. She studied secondary education.

She's been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for more than four years. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevo soles. This money increased her business' capital. She makes a living baking bread and selling dishes.

Mariela is requesting a new loan for S/. 1,500.00 nuevo soles. She will invest this money in the purchase of eight boxes of dishes (plates, large spoons, mugs, pots). She works together with her husband. She says that her husband is in charge of buying dishes in Tacna and selling them in Puno.

Her dream for the future is to have her own home and car.

What she likes most about her Communal Bank is the ease of obtaining loans.

loans.use: to buy eight boxes of dishes (plates, large spoons, mugs, pots).

loans.name: Leidy Idelisa

texts.es:
LEIDY IDELISA tiene 26 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 8 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

La VRC LUCHANDO JUNTOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Zapotal nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Comerciales en su mayoría. 

Leidy se dedica a  la venta de desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas,  las compraslas realiza en el comisariato.
 
Solicita el Crédito para comprar verduras, frutas, arroz, carnes, condimentos, mesas sillas para que los que se van ha servir la comida esten cómodos.

Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudara a obtener un buen beneficio, El sueño es poderse comprar una casa y un carro.
No tiene ningún tipo de problema, En los tiempos libres le gusta realizar los quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Leidy Idelisa is 26 years old and has a partner and a son.  She lives with her partner and eight-year-old son in the Ventanas Canton in the Los Ríos Province.

The Luchando Juntos Communal Bank is located in the newer Zapotal area in the Ventanas Canton.  It primarily deals with commercial work.

Leidy sells breakfasts, lunches, and snacks at a school canteen.  She does her buying and selling in a cooperative.  She is asking for this loan to purchase vegetables, fruits, rice, meat, condiments, and tables and chairs so that her clients can be comfortable. 

This loan will help her make a good profit.  Her dream is to be able to buy a house and a car.

She has not had any problems.  In her free time she likes to do housework.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, rice, meats, condiments, chairs and tables for her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and sand and to pay for the labor

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha Luz, de 47 años de edad, estado civil conviviente pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sembrando Futuro”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 02 hijos,ambos en edad escolar.
El primer negocio que emprendió fue el de realizar recargas a celulares, pero no tenía mucha ganancia; así que, decidió tomar  en cuenta la sugerencia de un vecino que posee tres lavaderos de carros, motos y camiones para vender almuerzos a sus trabajadores y de esta manera vió la oportunidad de empezar con este negocio que cuenta con clientes fijos  y además vende menú (comida) al público, esta actividad la realiza todos los días; por las tardes realiza sus ventas de productos de belleza por catálogo, con estas actividades comparte los gastos de la educación de sus hijos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1300.00,  comprará  productos al por mayor e ingredientes para la preparación de su comida como arroz  y azúcar por sacos, aceite, menestras de esa manera atender a sus clientes como ellos se merecen.
Martha Luz es una mujer trabajadora y creativa,  su sueño es contar con un Restaurante con un ambiente adecuado que le permita crecer personal y económicamente, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Martha Luz is 47 years old and lives with her partner.  She belongs to the Sembrando Futuro Communal Bank in the Tarapoto District of San Martín Province in the department of San Martín.  She has two children, both of whom are school-age.

The first business she started was reloading prepaid cell phones, but it wasn't very profitable, so she decided to take the advice of a neighbor who has three car, motorcycle, and truck washes that she sell lunches to his workers.  She saw this as an opportunity to start a business with regular customers and she also sells set meals to the public.  She does this every day and in the afternoons she sells beauty products from catalogs.  These businesses allow her to share the expense of her children's education.

With this loan of 1,300 nuevos soles she will buy wholesale products and ingredients to make her meals, such as bags of rice and sugar, oil, and mixed vegetables.  This will allow her to serve her customers they way they deserve to be served.

Martha Luz is a hardworking and creative woman.  Her dream is to have her own restaurant with an atmosphere that allows her to grow personally and economically.  She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for offering opportunities to women like herself and allowing them to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as rice, oil, and mixed vegetables

loans.name: Maria Matilde

texts.es:
La Sra. María Matilde pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor de Café”, del Distrito de Soritor, Provincia de Moyobamba y Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene 55 años y 9 hijos, sólo 1 se encuentra a su cargo.

Desde muy pequeña empezó a trabajar vendiendo yuca y  plátanos en su casa debido a que su familia tenía necesidades económicas y ella deseaba apoyar a sus padres, al poco tiempo se fue a vivir con su pareja como estaba acostumbrada a ser independiente económicamente  decidió seguir trabajando con la venta de verduras y frutas en un puesto del mercado de su localidad y así apoyar en su hogar, se inició con un capital de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles. Actualmente ella continúa vendiendo verduras y ha implementado con diversas variedades de productos, y cuenta con una buena clientela que es el público consumidor gracias a su carisma y el buen trato que les brinda.
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles,  comprará  variedades de verduras y frutas, como sacos de papas, cebolla, tomates, repollo, naranjas  y otros, para implementar su negocio  y así conseguir nuevos clientes.
María Matilde es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  anhela progresar e incrementar  su negocio con nuevos productos, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y se siente orgullosa de generar sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
María Matilde belongs to the “Flor de  Café (Coffee Flower) communal bank in the Soritor district, Moyobamba province, San Martín department.  She is married and has 9 children, with only 1 left in her care.  From the time she was very young, she began to work selling yucca and plantains in her home since her family didn’t have enough money and she wanted to help her parents.  In a short time she went to live with her partner as was the custom.   To be independent  economically she decided to continue selling vegetables and fruit in a market stand in her town and this way to help with the household expenses.  She started with a working capital of 300 new sols.  She continues selling vegetables and she has added various other products and has a good public customer base  thanks to her charisma and the good service she offers.
She will use the 500 new sols loan to buy a variety of fruit and vegetables such as sacks of potatoes, onions, tomatoes, cabbage, oranges and more to supply her business and thus find new customers.
María Matilde is a hard-working woman who with perseverance has succeeded in progressing and increasing her business with new products.  She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement and feels proud to generate her own income.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Narly Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Narly a sus 37 años de edad y madre de dos hijos de 17 y 4 años de edad, es cabeza de familia y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de almuerzos en semana y los fines de semana de comidas rápidas.  Esta labor la aprendió de su padre quien tenía un local que posteriormente cerró debido al cansancio que sentía su padre debido a su avanzada edad. Desde su casa la Señora Narly tiene su negocio con el fin de estar pendiente de sus dos hijos y dedicarles más tiempo.
Actualmente la señora Narly desea comprar un carro de comidas rápidas e insumos tales como panes, verduras, carnes, salsas y platos desechables, esto con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y poder brindarles a sus dos hijos una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Narly, at 37, is the mother of two children aged 17 and 4, and she is the head of the household.  She has a business making and selling lunches during the week, and she sells fast food on the weekends.  She learned this trade from her father, who had a restaurant that he later closed due to the fatigue that he felt because of his advanced age.  Narly runs her business from her house so that she can keep an eye on her 2 children and have more time to spend with them. 

Now Narly wants to buy a fast food cart and supplies such as bread, vegetables, meat, salsas and disposable plates, with the goal of increasing her income and providing for her children's welfare and giving them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart and supplies such as bread, vegetables, meat, salsas and disposable plates

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 59 años de edad, es viuda. Vive en compañía de su hijo mayor de 40 años de edad, quien la acompaña y apoya en todo momento, habitando en una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Yolanda en la costura, que aprendió mirando y apoyando a su hermana en su pequeño taller, logrando adquirir los conocimientos y experiencia necesario. Con un pequeño capital, compró una maquina de coser, siendo su primera herramienta de trabajo, e iniciándose en el remendando de las prendas de los clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el ingreso económico que le genera  para poder pagar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, además que le gusta coser, confeccionar lencería , ropa de todos los géneros. Por otro lado, tiene cansancio físico por las largas horas en una misma postura y eso le perjudica. Pero debe seguir esforzándose, pues desea mas adelante comprarse otra maquina de coser. Ese será el préstamo número 20 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo y desea seguir contando con este apoyo, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su cuotas, como en los préstamos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la costura tales como telas, elásticos, hilos y demás, buscando la mejor calidad a un menor precio.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 59 years old and a widow. She lives with her grown son, age 40, who is with her and supports her at every moment. Yolanda lives in a house that she owns. She works as a seamstress and learned this trade by watching and helping her sister at her small workshop. As a result, she gained the necessary knowledge and experience. With a small amount of capital, Yolanda purchased a sewing machine, the main piece of equipment for her work. She started mending clothes for customers. What she likes about her job is the income that she generates so that she can pay for the household expenses. In addition, she enjoys sewing and making undergarments and clothing for all ages. Yolanda gets fatigued by the long hours in the same position, which causes her to hurt. However, she continues to strive forward because she wants to buy another sewing machine.

This will be her 20th loan with the MFP organization. She is grateful for the financial support she has received and wants to continue receiving this assistance. For this reason, Yolanda promises to complete her payments, just as she did with her previous loans. The amount she requested will be invested in the purchase of sewing materials such as fabrics, elastics, thread, and other items. She seeks to find the best quality of products at a lower price.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, elastics, thread, and other materials.

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.es:
La Sra. María Flor pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor D. Café”, del Distrito D. Soritor, Provincia D. Moyobamba y Departamento D. San Martín. Es separada hace un año, tiene 57 años y tiene 04 hijos que ya son independientes.

D. joven se dedicaba a lavar ropa ajena y vender refrescos. Estando casada se dedicaba a su hogar y tenía su puesto en el mercado modelo D. la zona donD. vendía especies. Hace un año que enfermó y viaja a Lima para realizar su tratamiento. Al regresar D. Lima a Soritor su esposo la abandona, por este hecho deciD. incursionar en el negocio D. venta D. abarrotes gracias al préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos, desD. entonces se siente muy satisfecha y más tranquila por el apoyo que le brindaron, cuenta con muy buena clientela por su buena atención.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00,comprará sacos D. arroz, azúcar, aceite en docenas , leche en cajas , fideos por  kilos, conservas D. pescado y en variedad D. marcas, verduras, frutas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 
La Sra. María Flor es muy trabajadora y luchadora a pesar del difícil momento que está pasando continúa con su vida y espera seguir progresando poco a poco.
texts.en:
Sra. María Flor is a member of the Communal Bank "Flor D. Café" (Coffee Flower) which is in the District of Soritor, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martín. She has been separated from her spouse for one year. She is 57 years old and has four children who are independent.

As a young woman, she earned her living by washing clothes and selling soft drinks. When she got married, María Flor took care of her home and managed a stand at the local market selling spices. She became ill a year ago and traveled to Lima to seek treatment. When she retured to Soritor, her husband abandoned her so she decided to start a grocery business with a loan she received from Manuela Ramos. Since then, she has felt very satisfied and is now at peace with the support she has received. María Flor has a large customer base and provides them with good service.

With this loan of 1200 PEN, she will buy sacks of rice, sugar, oil by the dozen, cases of milk, noodles by the kilo, canned fish of various brands, vegetables, fruits, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue providing good service to her customers. María Flor is a hardworking and determined woman. Despite the difficult moments she has had to endure, she continues on with her life and hopes to continue progressing a little bit at a time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheels, wheel-rims, tires, chains, saddles, handles, seats, pedals, poles and cables.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
La Sra. María Eva pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor de Café”, del Distrito de Soritor, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 43 años y 02 hijos, el  mayor tiene 26 años es independiente y la  menor tiene 11 años de edad y cursa el 5to de primaria.

Por iniciativa de su ex cuñada incursiona en la venta de productos de belleza,  tenía cierto temor y pensaba que no iba a vender nada ya que en ese entonces se dedicaba a la venta de pollos eviscerado, decide dejar de vender pollos por la competencia e iniciar otro negocio, vender prendas de vestir, pero no le fue tan bien. 
Actualmente vende productos de belleza por catálogos. Inició con un capital de S/ 700.00 nuevos soles de sus ahorros. Además vende chupetes (helado de hielo), gelatinas, flan y cocadas, buscando con ello generar sus propios ingresos y así  apoyar en la economía de su hogar.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará más cosméticos e incrementará su stock de productos como: lápices labiales, talcos para el  cuerpo, perfumes, colonias, suampos, cremas faciales, y así satisfacer sus necesidades a sus clientes, amigos (as), familiares y vecinos. 
La Sra. María Eva anhela adquirir más productos de belleza para generar más ganancias, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
Sra. María Eva is a member of the Communal Bank “Flor de Café” (Coffee Flower) which is located in the District of Soritor, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martín. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. Her older child is 26 years old and independent, while her younger child is 11 years old and in the fifth grade.

María Eva began selling beauty products after receiving encouragement from her former sister-in-law. At the time, she feared that she would not be able to sell anything because she also had a business selling butchered chickens. She later decided to stop selling chickens because of the competition and to start another business of selling clothes, but that venture did not do well.

María Eva currently sells beauty products through catalogs. She started with capital of 700 PEN from her savings. In addition, she sells popsicles, gelatins, flan, and coconut candies. She looks for ways to generate her own income in order to help with the household finances.

With this loan of 3000 PEN, she will buy more cosmetics and increase her stock of products such as lip pencils, body powders, perfumes, colognes, shampoos, and facial crèmes so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers, friends, relatives, and neighbors.

Sra. María Eva wants to acquire more beauty products so that she can generate more income. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for trusting her.

loans.use: to buy lip pencils, body powders, perfumes, colognes, shampoos, and facial crèmes.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a farmer in Murang'a, Central Kenya. He is aged 23 and has been in farming for one year, with his horticultural produce being sold locally.

Wilson has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for a venture into a transport business. He says he wants to do transport due to the boom experienced in the sector due to poor roads in the area and a lack of means among farmers to supply their produce to the market. He adds that it will also help secure him income during seasons of poor farm produce.

Wilson reiterates that fluctuation in market prices for farm produce during harvest is discouraging since they are forced to dispose of the produce as a result of a lack of a storage system.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Alma Leticia

texts.es:
Un buen cambio importante será este préstamo para su negocio y su vida. La señora Alma desea tener más mercancía para vender ya que tiene un buen lugar donde exponer su mercancía, pero le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de productos como es ropa de invierno y accesorios para dama. 
 Doña Alma vive con su hija quien le ayuda con el negocio se pueden poner en diferentes partes de la ciudad, ya que es divorciada y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a su hija quien estudia la preparatoria y en días de vacaciones es cuando le ayuda en el negocio. 
Con esta inversión el negocio de la  señora Alma tendrá mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
This loan will bring about a good change that is important for Sra. Alma’s business and her life. She wants to have more merchandise to sell since she already has a good place where she can display her goods. However, she lacks a greater variety of products, such as winter clothing and women’s accessories.

Doña Alma lives with her daughter who helps with the business. They are able to conduct business in different parts of the city. Alma is divorced and has responsibility for her daughter, who studies at a preparatory school. She helps with the business on her vacation days.

With this business investment, Sra. Alma will have more income.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing and women’s personal accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase iron, construction profiles and sand.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica, de 26 años de edad, es una mujer extrovertida y muy sociable, además de trabajadora y emprendedora. Es soltera, vive en compañía de su padre, su madre, sus dos hermanos de 24 y 15 años de edad, y su abuela, instalados cómodamente en casa de sus padres. Mónica se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa de vestir de damas, además de lencerías, para eso cuenta con el apoyo de su tía que vive en la ciudad de Lima y cada fin de mes le envía la mercadería, y luego ella realza la venta a sus amistades y vecinos en forma personal en su casa. Desde hace 4 años que se dedica a éste negocio, tiempo que le valió para ser conocida en su zona. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico para solventar algunos gastos personales y de sus estudios universitarios, así como el tiempo que le deja para poder dedicarse a ellos. Sin embargo la impuntualidad de algunos clientes le perjudican en el pago de la mercadería que compraron. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, está agradecida con el apoyo financiero, por eso se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de vestir femenino, en mayor volumen y a menor precio, para así obtener un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Mónica, age 26, is an outgoing and sociable woman. In addition, she is enterprising and a hard worker. Mónica is single and lives with her father, mother, two brothers (ages 24 and 15), and her grandmother. They all live comfortably at her parents’ house. Mónica sells women’s clothing and lingerie. She has the help of her aunt who lives in the city of Lima and sends her merchandise every month. Mónica sells her products to her friends and neighbors by visiting them in person at their homes. She has been in this business for four years and has become known in her area. What she likes about her work is being able to generate an income so that she can pay for some of her personal expenses and her university studies. The time she has remaining is devoted to her education. However, some of her customers are late in submitting payments for the merchandise they purchased.

This will be her third loan with the MFP organization. Mónica is grateful for the financial support. For this reason, she promises to complete her payments. The amount she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of women’s clothing so that she can acquire a large volume at a lower price. This will help increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing.

loans.name: Maide

texts.es:
La Sra. Maide pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor de Café”,  del Distrito de Soritor, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es madre soltera, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, el mayor tiene 16 años, es estudiante del nivel secundario y la menor tiene 6 años acude al jardín (kinder).
Decidió iniciar su negocio para obtener sus propios ingresos y criar a sus hijos. Ella estudio enfermería técnica; al terminar su carrera se dedicó a trabajar en el PRONOEI (Organización del estado) luego como alfabetizadora, con sus  ahorritos de dichos trabajos tuvo la idea de tener un negocio propio. Actualmente se dedica  a la crianza y venta de pollos, a través de éste negocio puede solventar los gastos de sus hijos y apoya a su mamá. Nadie le ayudó a establecer su negocio, el cual inició con un capital de S/ 2,000.00 nuevos soles.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará pollos pequeños y alimento balanceado para aves..
Maide es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora,  su sueño es tener su granja donde puede ofrecer otros productos y mejorar sus ingresos. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
Sra. Maide is a member of the Communal Bank “Flor de Café” (Coffee Flower) which is located in the District of Soritor, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 37 years old and a single mother with two children. Her older child is 16 years old and a high school student, while the younger child is six years old and attends kindergarten.

Maide decided to start her business so that she could earn her own income and raise her children. She studied for a degree in nursing. After finishing her degree, she decided to work at a PRONOEI (a state-run school) as a reading teacher. With her savings from this job, Maide came up with the idea of starting her own business. She currently raises and sells chickens. Through this business, she is able to cover her children’s expenses and support her mother. There was no one to help her establish her business. She used 2000 PEN of capital to start her business.

With this new loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy young chickens and balanced feed for her birds. Maide is a determined and hardworking woman. Her dream is to have a farm where she can offer other products and improve her income. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for trusting her.

loans.use: to buy young chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Luzfelinda

texts.es:
La Sra. Luzfelinda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor de café”, del  Distrito de Soritor, Provincia de Moyobamba y Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, de 15, 7 y 8 meses respectivamente.

Desde niña se dedicó a la venta de plátanos, verduras y frutas para poder ayudar a su familia. Fue iniciativa propia de entrar en el negocio de venta de abarrotes con un capital de 1000.00 soles instalándose en su propia casa. Actualmente se dedica a vender abarrotes en un mercado de la zona, lo ha abastecido con nuevos productos como: huevos, verduras, frutas, bebidas, cereales, cuenta con una buena clientela, pues brinda una buena atención y se esmera por proporcionar a sus clientes lo que ellos necesitan.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará  insumos como productos enlatados, conservas, cajas de leche, sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz, aceites en litros, golosinas, sacos de verduras, galletas en cajas y frutas.
Luzfelinda es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener un minimarket, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Sra. Luzfelinda is a member of the Communal Bank “Flor de Café” (Coffee Flower) which is in the District of Soritor, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martín. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children (ages 15, 7, and 8 months).

When she was a girl, Luzfelinda sold bananas, vegetables, and fruits in order to help her family. She took the initiative to start a grocery business in her home, using capital in the amount of 1000 PEN. Luzfelinda currently sells groceries at the local market. Her business is stocked with new products such as eggs, vegetables, fruits, beverages, and grains. She has a good customer base and provides them with good service. Luzfelinda strives to provide her customers with what they need.

With this loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy supplies such as canned products, preserves, cases of milk, sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, oil by the liter, candies, sacks of vegetables, boxes of cookies, and fruits. Luzfelinda is a hardworking and enterprising woman. Her dream is to expand her business and open a mini-market. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
el grupo Dios es Amor esta ubicado en la colonia Buena Vista de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta integrado por 3 personas, dos mujeres y un hombre, todos comerciantes, que se dedican a diferentes actividades generadoras de ingresos, la sra.
