En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jahaira, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 9 y 3 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es obrero.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos  Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener un bazar o una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The “Virgen Del Rosario” communal bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, Montecristi Canton (Portoviejo), known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally.  Most of the residents of this place manufacture tagua [nuts known as vegetable ivory] buttons, are craftspeople or in general commerce.

We met Jahaira, 25, here.  She’s married and has three children who are 10, 9 and 3 years of age.  The two oldest are going to school.  Her husband’s a laborer.

She is a housewife who in order to earn her own resources sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works three days a week selling on credit and collecting weekly or biweekly according to her customers’ wishes.  
What she sells most is perfume and cosmetics.  She’s been in business a year and does very well.

This loan is to buy perfume, cosmetics and underwear.  This is the third cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her dream is to have a clothing store or a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics and underwear.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio nació en la ciudad del Cusco  y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Porfirio tiene 42 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo. Porfirio desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad del Cusco.   

Porfirio estudio la carrera de contabilidad y trabaja como asistente contable en su propio estudio contable. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este trabajo y le va muy bien gracias a al empeño que pone sus funciones. 

Porfirio pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Porfiriro requiere el préstamo para implementar su oficina y desea comprar materiales de escritorio como por ejemplo papel, cuadernos, hojas, lapiceros y otras cosas más. 

Porfirio se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Porfirio was born in the city of Cusco and still lives in the city of his birth.  Porfirio is 42 years old and is in a common law relationship; he has a son.  Porfirio carries out his daily and his economic activities in the city of Cusco.

Porfirio studied accounting and works as an accounting assistant in his own accounting office.  He’s been in this business for 15 years already and does very well thanks to the effort he puts into his duties.

Porfirio belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Ñahupacman Purisun” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Porfirio needs a loan to equip his office and he wants to buy office supplies like paper, notebooks, sheets of paper, pencils and other things.

Porfirio is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and commits to make his installment payments according to the corresponding schedule.

loans.use: to buy office supplies.

loans.name: Mriuxi Aracely

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Mariuxi, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 16 y 12 años de edad, el menor estudia en colegio. El marido es chofer.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana puerta a puerta aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su casa, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días.  Lo que más vende son los cosméticos. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y cumplidas. 

Su sueño es tener un carro propio para su esposo.
texts.en:
The “Virgen Del Rosario” communal bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, Montecristi Canton (Portoviejo), known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally.  Most of the residents of this place manufacture tagua [nuts known as vegetable ivory] buttons, are craftspeople or in general commerce.

Mariuxi, 33, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children who are 16 and 12 years old; the youngest is going to secondary school.  Her husband’s a driver.


She is a housewife who in order to obtain her own resources sells L’Bel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories).  She works three days a week going door to door; most of her sales take place at home.  She sells on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  What she most sells is cosmetics.  She’s been in business two years and does very well.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.  This is the third cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because her fellow members are very united and responsible.  Her dream is to have a car of her own for her husband.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es:
Roy, de 36 años, es una hombre bueno, amable y muy trabajador, esta casado desde hace varios años, y fruto de su matrimonio tiene tres hijos de 15, 12 y 3 años de edad, el tiene una casa propia en donde vive a  lado de sus hijos y su esposa con quien trabaja mucho en conjunto para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
El trabajo de Roy consiste en la reparación y ensamblado de computadoras, tiene publicidad en todos lados y siempre esta atento a su teléfono móvil en espera de que algún cliente lo solicite. Es proveedor muy importante de una courrier de la ciudad a quienes les da mantenimiento y soluciona problemas de sus computadoras cada 15 días, trabaja en esta actividad desde hace tres años y lo hace solo. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que le permite tener tiempo para poder hacer algunas otras actividades y brindarles los cuidados necesarios a su familia, además de permitirle trabajar en la parte administrativa de una institución publica. Al principio tuvo problemas con su negocio ya que no lo conocían y difícilmente le daban sus computadoras a arreglar, hasta que con el tiempo se ganó el prestigio que tiene ahora con ellos, espera poder tener un local propio para darle mas comodidad a sus clientes. Este será el préstamo número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en el préstamo anterior en donde demostró ser muy responsable, además le agrada mucho pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos demostraron ser responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará respuestos de computadoras y algunas herramientas, además de programas y antivirus para así poder dar mas seguridad a las computadoras que arregla.
texts.en:
Roy, 36, is a good, kind, very hardworking man.  He’s been married for several years and has three children who are 15, 12 and 3 years old.  He owns a house where he lives with his children and his wife that he works together with to provide a better quality of life for their children.

Roy’s work consists in repairing and assembling computers.  He has publicity everywhere and is always aware of his mobile phone waiting for customers to contact him.  He is an important supplier to one of the city’s messenger services; he services and solves their computer problems every two weeks.  He’s been working in this occupation for three years and he works alone.  What he likes about his work is that it leaves him with free time to do other activities and to give his family the necessary care; it also lets him work in the administrative department of a public institution.

At first he had problems with the business because he wasn’t known and it was difficult for them to give him their computers to repair.  In time, however, he attained the prestige he now has with them.  He hopes to have a locale of his own to provide more comfort for his customers.

This will be MFP loan #2.  He hopes that with this small loan he’ll be able to reach his objectives.  He once again pledges to make his installment payments like he did with the last loan where he showed himself to be very responsible.  It pleases him very much to belong to his communal bank because they are all responsible and supportive.

He will use the requested 1000 soles to buy computer spare parts, some tools and programs and antivirus to provide the computers he repairs with more security.

loans.use: to buy tools, computer spare parts and software.

loans.name: Rosa Del Pilar

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Rosa tiene 34 años  de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 15, 13 y  11 y años de edad que estudian en colegio y escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal tres  ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para generar sus propios ingresos se dedica a la fabricación de botones hechos en tagua, para lo cual  tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que se elaboran los botones pero en forma cruda, productos que entregan en su sector a  comerciantes que llegan hasta este lugar a comprar para luego llevarlas a Manta para que estos sean enviados  al extranjero donde son terminados. Trabaja todos los días, y lleva en este negocio por casi dos años.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar tagua que es la  materia prima para la fabricación de los botones. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades de pago.
 
Su sueño es tener una fábrica grande con mayor tecnología.
texts.en:
The “Virgen Del Rosario” communal bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, Montecristi Canton (Portoviejo), known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally.  Most of the residents of this place manufacture tagua [nuts known as vegetable ivory] buttons, are craftspeople or in general commerce.

We met Rosa, 34, here.  She’s a single mother of three children who are 15, 13 and 11 years old and who go to elementary and secondary schools.  She lives in her parents’ house.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and likes it because of the help they give her with the loans.

She is a very good housewife who in order to earn her own income manufactures buttons made from tagua.  To do so she uses a lathe (machine to cut tagua) that makes the buttons but leaves them in an unfinished state.  They are then delivered to merchants that come here to buy them and take them to Manta to be exported abroad where they are finished.  She works every day and has been in this business for almost two years.

She will use this loan to buy tagua nuts which is the raw material to make the buttons.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and she likes it because of the easy payments.  Her dream is to have a large factory with more technology.

loans.use: to buy tagua nuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food and also baby chickens so she can start raising them for sale

loans.name: Ana Del Rocio

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 33 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene una hija 9 años de edad, la misma que estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de los padres.

Es una joven madre que para obtener sus propios recursos para  que a su pequeña hija no le falte nada, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa ya que sus clientes llegan hasta este lugar a comprar sus productos, Trabaja cinco días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a esto ha podido sacar adelante a su hija.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, ropa de niños, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, etc. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
The Virgin of the Rosary Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally. In this area, the majority of the people manufacture tagua nut buttons, are craftspeople, or are in general commerce. 

In this place we meet Ana, who is 33 years old and separated from her husband. From that relationship she has a 9 year old daughter who is in school. She lives in her parents' house. 

Ana is a young mother who makes a living selling all kinds of clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women) so that she can get her own resources so that her small daughter does not go without anything. She sells door-to-door, and she also sells from her house so her customers can come there to buy their products. She works five days a week, selling on credit and charging every weekend. She has made a living in this business for nine years and thanks to this has been able to give her daughter a good start in life. 

This loan is to buy pants, blouses, children's clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc. This is her third loan with the Communal Bank, and she likes it because of the help they give her so she can get ahead. 

Her dream is to give her small daughter the best in life.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, children's clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Miguel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive don Carlos, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual aun no tiene hijos. Su mujer es ama de casa.
 
El como muchas personas de esta localidad se  dedica a la fabricación de botones hechos en tagua, para lo cual  tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que se elaboran los botones pero en forma cruda, ósea sin darles el acabado que requieren para ser comercializados, este producto en esta forma los  entregan en su sector a  comerciantes mayoristas que llegan hasta este lugar a comprar para luego llevarlas a Manta para que estos sean enviados al extranjero para que sean terminados. Trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su mujer, el lleva en este negocio por más de 15 años, ya que aprendió desde muy joven esta profesión.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar tagua que es la  materia prima para la fabricación de los botones. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener casa propia ya que vive en casa de los padres.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Virgen del Rosario' community bank meet in Colorado, in Montecristi canton (Portoviejo).  This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are well known both at home and abroad.  Most of the people here work making tagua buttons and handicrafts and engage in general commerce.

This is where Carlos lives.  Carlos is 32 years old and lives with his common-law wife.  The couple do not have any children yet.  His wife is a housewife.

In common with many people in this town, Carlos makes buttons from tagua (also known as 'vegetable ivory').  He has a lathe (a machine for cutting tagua) which he uses to make the buttons in a raw form, that is, he does not give them the finishing touches they need in order to be sold.  He sells his products in this form to wholesalers who come to his town to buy and take the products back to Manta so that they can be sent abroad to be finished off.  Carlos works every day with the help of his wife.  He has been in this business for more than 15 years as he learned the trade when he was very young.

Carlos will use this loan to buy tagua which is the raw material he uses to make his buttons.  He has been a member of his community bank for two loan cycles and he likes it because of the help he receives from the loans.

Carlos' dream is to own his own home as he currently lives in his parents' house.

loans.use: to buy tagua

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria nació en la  ciudad de Sicuani al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, ella radica en la antigua ciudad del Imperio de los Incas (Cusco). Gloria tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene un  hijo. Gloria desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad del Cusco.   

Gloria trabaja en una agencia de viajes en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este trabajo y le va muy bien gracias a al empeño que pone sus funciones laborales.  Su esposo de Gloria tiene un estudio contable en la misma ciudad y de esa forma su esposo ayuda con el gasto familiar. 

Gloria pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Gloria requiere el préstamo para implementar la oficina de su esposo ósea desea comprar materiales de escritorio como por ejemplo papel, cuadernos, hojas, lapiceros y otras cosas más. 

Gloria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Gloria was born in the city of Sicuani to the south of the city of Cusco. She currently resides in the ancient imperial home of the Incas (Cusco). Gloria is 32 years old, married and has a child. She has worked at a travel agency in Cusco for the past four years, and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into her job. Her husband has an accounting office in the same city, and in this way they support each other with household expenses. Gloria belongs to the “Ñahupacman Purisun” Community Bank of Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa in Cusco. She is requesting the loan to set up her husband's office by purchasing writing materials such as paper, notebooks, page sheets, pens and other items. Gloria is grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more writing materials, such as paper, notebooks, page sheets, pens and other items.

loans.name: Ana Viviana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 28 años  de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 12, 8 y 5 años de edad, los mayores estudian en escuela y el menor en jardín de infantes. Ella vive en casa de sus padres.
 
Es una muy buena madre que para que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y también ha empezado hace poco a vender ropa de todo tipo, ella trabaja todos los días ya que además también se dedica a la venta de harina de pescado, en cuanto a sus ventas las realiza puerta a puerta, en cuanto a la harina de pescado ella se la entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta la zona para luego llevarlos al extranjero. Ella lleva más de 8 años con su negocio. 

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería y ropa de todo tipo y aprovechar las fiestas que se avecinan. Está  en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios,  es la fiscal de pagos del banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan.
 
Ella está repitiendo el crédito con Kiva y lo solicita para empezar con su negocio de venta de ropa, el crédito anterior le ayudo mucho ya que logro comprar a bajo precio sus productos y así ganar más, en lo familiar ella pudo cumplir con todo lo que necesitaba para sus hijos con lo que mejoro su estabilidad emocional. 

Sus sueños son darles a sus hijos lo mejor.
texts.en: The Virgen Del Rosario Community Bank meets every 15 days in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-Columbian culture and for its handicrafts that are recognized nationally and worldwide. In this town, the majority of the residents make buttons out of tagua nuts and handicrafts, as well as participate in general commerce. Here we meet Ana. She is 28 years old, and a single mother of three children, ages 12, 8 and 5. The oldest two are in school and the youngest is in kindergarten. She lives in her parents' home. She is a very good mother because her children always have everything they need. Ana makes a living selling Yanbal-brand products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories) and also recently started to sell all kinds of clothing. She works every day and also sells fish flour. She sells her products door to door, except for the fish flour, which she delivers to merchants who come to the area and then take the product abroad. She has more than eight years of experience in the business. She plans to use this loan to purchase perfumes, lotions, jewelry and all kinds of clothing to take advantage of the approaching holiday season. She has been with the community bank since its inception and is in charge of making the payments, and she likes the help the bank provides. This is a concurrent Kiva loan, and she is requesting it to start her clothing business. The previous loan helped a lot since she was able to buy her products at lower prices and thus increase her profits. And with her family, she was able to do everything she needed to for her children, which gave her more emotional stability. Her dream is to provide her kids with nothing but the best.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotions, jewelry and clothing.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Don Juan, de 60 años de edad, casado, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos están en la secundaria los otros son independientes, el es originario de la ciudad de León, el es comerciante tiene un taller de vulcanización lleva 20 años con este negocio el cual esta localizado en las afueras de la ciudad. Cuando inicio su negocio fue cuando trabajaba en un taller de mecánica y el soñaba con tener su propio taller y trabajo muy duro para poder tenerlo. Hoy en día tiene 2 ayudantes, su esposa trabaja desde su casa vendiendo cosméticos y leña. El requiere el préstamo para comprar llantas y material para reparaciones  de vehículos y motos. Su próxima meta es comprar 2 herramientas que necesita tales como un compresor y un motor.
texts.en: Don Juan, 60, is married and has five children, two of which are in high school and the others independent.  He is from the city of León and is a merchant by trade.  He has a vulcanization workshop and has been in business for 20 years on the outskirts of the city.  Before he started his business he worked in a mechanic's workshop and dreamed of having his own workshop.  He worked hard enough to get it and now he has two assistants.  His wife sells cosmetics and firewood out of the home.  He is requesting a loan to buy tires and materials for auto and motorcycle repair.  His next goal is to buy two tools that he needs such as a compressor and an engine.

loans.use: To buy tires and materials for auto and motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Maritza Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 18, 17 10 y 9 años de edad,  los menores  estudian en escuela. El marido es artesano. 

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y colaboradora con el hogar, realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo con su negocio ya que él tiene un taller de cerrajería en la localidad, allí elabora puertas, ventanas, y otras estructuras con el hierro, el trabaja todos los días y  siempre está ocupado ya que no le falta trabajo, mientras que ella se desempeña como ama de casa y además también trabaja en una fábrica de botones  por lo cual recibe un sueldo. Su esposo tiene este taller más de 10 años y le va muy bien gracias a Dios.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar hierro, pinturas, sueldas y otros  materiales necesarios para su trabajo. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio taller de botones.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Virgen del Rosario" meets every two weeks in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), famous nationally and internationally for its rich colonial culture and artisan crafts.  In this location most of the population is involved in making tagua (ivory palm) buttons, crafts or in some other trade.

Mrs. Maritza, 38, lives here with her common-law husband and four children, ages 18, 17, 10 and 9.  The younget ones are in school.  Her husband is an artisan. 

She is a very hard worker and collaborates at home.  She is requesting a loan to help her husband with his locksmith business.  He makes doors, windows and other iron structures.  He works every day and is always busy because of the high demand.  She is a homemaker and also works in a button factory where she receives a salary.  Her husband has had the workshop for ten years and business is going well, for which they feel blessed.

This loan will be used to buy iron, paints, soldering irons and other materials necessary for work.  She has been in the communal bank for two cycles and likes the group because it is very united.

Her dream is to have her own button workshop.

loans.use: To buy iron, paints, soldering irons and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy jungle region fruits.

loans.name: Mercedes Moserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, ambos mayores de edad, estudian en Universidad y  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que se dedica al comercio, tres veces por semana con la colaboración de su esposo que tiene un pequeño camión se desplazan hasta la ciudad de Salinas, lugar en el cual compran sal en grano, producto que luego lo traen y llevan a entregar a muchos lugares de nuestra provincia, ellos entregan en Bahía De Caraquez, Manta y por supuesto en Montecristi, lleva en este negocio 4 años y que además en sus días que no viaja le ayuda a una hermana en una fábrica de botones por lo cual recibe una paga con lo cual gana algo de dinero extra.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar sal en grano. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Su sueño es comprar un camión más grande para transportar más productos por viaje.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Virgen del Rosario" meets every two weeks in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), famous nationally and internationally for its rich colonial culture and artisan crafts. In this location most of the population is involved in making tagua (ivory palm) buttons, crafts or in some other trade.

Here we met Mrs. Mercedes, 45, who is married and has two children, both adults, who study at the university and live at home.  Her husband is a driver.

She is a very enterprising woman who is involved in commerce.  Three times a week, she and her husband, who has a truck, go to the city of Salinas to buy fine flake salt.  They deliver to many locations throughout the province, such as Bahía de Caraquez, Manta and of course Montecristi.  They have been in business for four years.  On the days she doesn't travel she helps her sister in the button factory and receives a wage which provides her with extra income.

She plans to use this loan to buy fine flake salt.  She has been in the communal bank for five cycles and likes the fact that the loans have such low interest rtes.

Her dream is to have a larger truck so they can transport more products.

loans.use: To buy fine flake salt.

loans.name: Myriam Rocio

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo (Portoviejo) se reúne el Banco Comunal San José De Sucre, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes naturales y hermosos, por su gastronomía típica del lugar y por su gente trabajadora y honesta dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Miriam. Tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación  tiene una hija de 11 años de edad que está en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella para ganar algo de dinero por su cuenta y con esto ayudar en el hogar se dedica al comercio, tiene un bazar en su casa en el cual vende de todo un poco (ropa, perfumes, artículos de belleza, bisutería, entre otras cosas de bazar). Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, trabaja sola ya que su negocio no es muy grande y como lo tiene en su casa no se le hace difícil cumplir con sus labores de ama de casa, compra sus productos en Portoviejo y  las prendas de vestir en su tierra natal Otavalo, lugar al que viaja una vez al mes o su hermana le envía hasta Portoviejo. Ella tiene su negocio por más de 10 años y siempre le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa y zapatos ya que se viene la Navidad y los clientes es lo que más compran en esta época del año. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy cumplido. 

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San José de Sucre" meets In the "24 de Mayo" Canton (Portoviejo), which is known for its natural, beautiful landscape, typical local gastronomy, and its hard working, honest people who work mainly in agriculture and livestock farming.

Here we met Mrs. Miriam, 41, who is married and has an 11-year-old daughter in school.  Her husband is a farmer.

To earn a little money on her own and help out with household expenses, she set up a bazaar in her home where she sells a little bit of everything (clothing, perfumes, beauty products, costume jewelry and other bazaar items).  She works alone every day from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. since her business is not very big.  This allows her to also take care of her household chores.  She buys products in Portoviejo and clothing in her home town of Otavalo where she travels once a month or her sister sends items to Portoviejo.  Miriam has had her business for over ten years and it has always gone well.

This loan will be used to buy clothing and shoes since Christmas is approaching and customers do most of their shopping at this time of year.  She is a founding member of the communal bank which she likes because everyone is very committed.

Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Julio Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo nació en la  ciudad de Lima y desde hace 8 años que radica en la antigua ciudad del Imperio de los Incas (Cusco). Rodolfo tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Rodolfo desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad del Cusco.   

Rodolfo se dedica a la venta de repuestos y tiene un pequeño local pero es alquilado. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este trabajo y le va muy bien gracias a al empeño que pone sus funciones laborales.

Rodolfo pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Rodolfo requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo muelles, pistones y otras cosas más. 

Rodolfo se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rudolfo was born in the city of Lima and for 8 years he has lived in the old city of the Imperio de los Incas (Cusco). Rodolfo is 52 years old and is married and from this relationship he has three children. Rodolfo Roldolfo has built up his daily economical work in the city of Cusco.

Rodolfo works selling spare parts and he has a little neighborhood shop but he rents it. It has been three years that he has worked in this trade and it is going very well thanks to his commitment and the work he puts into it.

Rodolfo belongs to the the communal bank Nahupacman Purisun of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. Rodolfo is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise such as springs, pistons, and other items.

Rodolfo is grateful for the opportunity given to him through this loan and at the same time he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as springs, pistons and other things

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Martina  solicita  un préstamo para impermeabilizar y pintar su casa; porque en las temporadas de lluvias el agua se trasmina por consecuencia el techo se está deteriorando. Martina quiere prevenir que el problema se agrave  y tenga que gastar más de lo previsto. Para poder cubrir los gastos ella trabaja en maquiladora de Lunes a Viernes y algunas ocasiones se queda mas tiempo para percibir un ingreso extra. Martina es madre soltera  de tres pequeños, de los que quiere formar unos buenos ciudadanos y un mejor patrimonio, ella les dará la mejor educación siendo madre y padre a la vez. 

Para que ella pueda realizar su proyecto necesita comprar el material de impermeabilización y pintura para que su casa quede protegida.
texts.en:
Martina is requesting a loan to have her house waterproofed and painted, as during the rainy season water filters through consequently damaging the roof. Martina wants to prevent this problem from getting to serious and therefore costing more money than estimated. In order to pay for the expenses she works as a make-up artist Mondays to Fridays, and in some occasions she does overtime to make extra money. Martina is a single mother of three children, and she wants them to become good citizens and to reach a better economic status. She will give them the best education she can, acting as both mother and father.

In order to carry out her project she needs to buy construction materials and paint to protect her house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials and paint to have her house waterproofed and painted against heavy rains.

loans.name: Kathy Gioconda

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo (Portoviejo) se reúne el Banco Comunal San José De Sucre, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes naturales y hermosos, por su gastronomía típica del lugar y por su gente trabajadora y honesta dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Katty, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 16, 14 y 6 años, la mayor estudia en universidad y los menores en  colegio y  escuela. El marido es maestro en un colegio de la localidad. 

Ella  además de ser una gran ama de casa se dedica al comercio, tiene  un negocio de venta de carteras y productos Sayson (productos de belleza, perfumería y bisutería). Trabaja todos los días y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, también su hija le ayuda en las ventas en el lugar donde estudia, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lleva en este negocio por más de un año y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y carteras. Está en el Banco Comunal cuatro ciclos y  le gusta  por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos.
 
Ella está repitiendo el crédito y es para comprar más productos y aprovechar la temporada de navidad que se vende bastante, los créditos a ella le sirven de mucho ya que muchas veces no ha tenido capital para seguir y los créditos siempre que llegan le sirven para continuar en su negocio, esto ayuda también en su situación familiar ya que con lo que ha ganado a podido poco a poco ir arreglando su hogar y  a darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The 24th of May village is where the San José community bank meets. This area is known for its natural and beautiful scenery, for its traditional gastronomy, and for its hard-working and honest residents that primarily dedicate themselves to farming and raising animals.
 
This is where Katty lives.  She is 38 years old and is in a common law marriage from which she has 4 children ages 17, 16, 14 and 6.  The eldest studies at the university and the younger children are in school.  Her husband is a teacher at the local school. 

In addition to being a great homemaker she also works in commerce.  She has a business selling wallets and Sayson products (beauty products, perfumes, and costume jewelry).  She works everyday doing door to door sales. Also, her daughter helps with sales where she goes to school. She delivers her products on credit and charges every 15 days.  She has done this business for more than a year and it is going quite well. 

This loan is going to help her to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams and wallets. She has been in the community bank through four cycles and she likes the help that the loans have given her.
 
She is requesting another loan to buy more products and take advantage of the holiday season when she sells quite well. The loans have helped her very much since often she has not had the capital and the loans have helped her to continue in her business. 

The loan helps her also in her family situation because with her earnings she has been gradually fixing up her home, and she can provide a better education for her children. 

Her goal is to continue advancing her business.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, cosmetics, creams, costume jewelry and wallets.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia nació en la  ciudad de Acomayo y desde hace varios años que radica en la antigua ciudad del Imperio de los Incas (Cusco). Aurelia tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Aurelia desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad del Cusco.   

Aurelia se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de forma ambulatoria. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Aurelia pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Aurelia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo medias, calzoncillos, calzones y otras cosas más. 

Aurelia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Aurelia was born in the city of Acomayo and for several years lies in the ancient city of the Empire of the Incas (Cusco). Aurelia is 44 years old, married and from this marriage has 3 children.  Aurelia carries out her daily and economic activities in the city of Cusco.   

Aurelia has mobile stand where she sells undergarments.  She has been doing this for four years, thanks to the hard work she puts into her business. 

Aurelia belongs to the community bank “Ñahupacman Purisun” of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco. Aurelia requires the loan to buy merchandise such as stockings, underwear, long-underwear among other things.

Aurelia is grateful for the opportunity afforded by these means and likewise agrees to comply with the payment according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as stockings, underwear, long-underwear among other things.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja nació en la  ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Maruja tiene 35 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Maruja desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad del Cusco.   

Maruja se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulatoria. Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Maruja pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Maruja requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo polos y pantalones. 

Maruja se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maruja was born in the city of Cusco and currently resides there. Maruja is 35 years old and is in a common law marriage from which she has two children. Maruja carries out her daily economic activities in the city of Cusco. 

Maruja sells clothing door-to-door. She has been doing this for five years, thanks to the hard work she puts into her job. 

Maruja belongs to the community bank “Ñahupacman Purisun” of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco. Maruja requires the loan to buy merchandise such as shirts and pants.

Maruja is grateful for the opportunity afforded by these means and likewise agrees to comply with the payment for the schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shirts and pants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a wall.

loans.name: Norla

texts.es: Norla, de 43 años de edad, habita en Telica, municipio de León, es madre de  5 hijos, ella es comerciante, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y vender tortillas, lleva 4 años con este negocio. Empezó con la comprar de un cerdo después fue comprando otros dos para aumentar la producción, también se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas es con estas actividades que ella y sus hijos sobreviven día a día. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar cerdos, con el objetivo de criar y reproducir cerdos de calidad y buen peso. Ya que ella quiere criar cerdos de raza para reproducir y vender cerdos de raza.
texts.en: Norla, 43 years old, lives in Telica, in Leon county, and is the mother of five children. She is a businesswoman; she raises pigs and sells tortillas, and she has been in this business for four years. She began with the purchase of one pig, and then she purchased two more to increase production. Her business also includes making and selling tortillas. It is through these activities that she and her children survive from day to day. She needs this loan to purchase pigs, with the goal of raising and breeding quality pigs that reach a good weight, since she wants to raise, breed, and sell purebred pigs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El  señor   Jesús   es  una  persona  que  se  dedica   al  comercio, actualmente   tiene    su negocio  de   artesanías    en  el mercado de la localidad, el requiere  de  nuestra  ayuda  ya  que  desea  realizar  la compra  de mercancía   ya que  nos comenta  que   en  esta  temporada  la  demanda  de  sus  clientes incrementa  satisfactoriamente,  ve  en  el  crédito  la  oportunidad  de hacer  crecer  su     negocio , permitiéndole  brindar  a  sus  clientes  el excelente  servicio que   lo  a  caracterizado, además  que  esto le permitirá   obtener  mayores  ingresos.
texts.en: Jesús is a businessman. Currently he has a crafts shop in the neighborhood market, and he is asking for help because he wants to buy merchandise because he tells us that in this season the requests of his clients increases suitably. The money from this loan is an opportunity to expand his business, permitting him to give to his customers the excellent service that he is known for and this will increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: La señora Tomasa de 41 años solicita  un préstamo para impermeabilizar el techo de su casa; porque en las temporadas de lluvias el agua se trasmina por consecuencia el techo se está deteriorando. Tomasa quiere prevenir que el problema se agrave  y tenga que gastar más de lo previsto. Para poder cubrir los gastos ella y su esposo trabajan en maquiladora de Lunes a Viernes. Tomasa  es madre de tres niños, de los que quiere formar unos buenos ciudadanos y un mejor patrimonio. Para que ella pueda realizar su proyecto necesita comprar impermeabilizante para que su casa este mejor protegida en los cambios climáticos.
texts.en:
41-year-old Tomasa is applying for this loan to make the roof of her house waterproof as during the rainy season the water seeps through, causing the ceiling to deteriorate as a result. Tomasa wants to prevent the problem from getting worse and from having to spend more than expected. To make ends meet, both she and her husband work in an assembly plant from Monday to Friday. 

Tomasa is the mother of three children, whom she wants to bring up to be good citizens and to have a better inheritance. For her project to succeed, Tomasa needs to buy waterproofing materials to ensure her home is better protected during changes in the weather.

loans.use: to purchase waterproofing materials to place on her roof

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Karina Elizabeth y su esposo son una pareja muy trabajadora y emprendedora que le gusta salir adelante a pesar de la situación económica que se vive en la actualidad, desde hace 9 años cuenta con su negocio de venta de blocks, que el elabora con sus manos y maquinas especiales que lo ayudan. Para fabricar este producto se necesita arena, cascajo, cemento y agua que el mismo bate para colocarlo en la maquina moldeadora y lo deja secar al sol para que este resistente. Karina compra los mejores materiales para que su producto este fuerte y en buenas condiciones.  En este momento necesita comprar material para seguir generando mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karina Elizabeth and her husband are a hardworking and enterprising couple who want to keep moving forward, despite the current economic situation. For 9 years she has had her business selling construction blocks, which she developed with own hands and some specialized machinery to help her. 

To make this product Karina needs sand, gravel, cement and water, which are packed together and placed in the molding machine, and then left to dry in the sun to harden. Karina purchases the best materials to ensure that her products are strong and of good quality. She now needs to buy more materials so that she can continue to generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, to construct her products

loans.name: Donata

texts.es: La señora Donata es una mujer muy responsable que en años anteriores laboraba para una empresa maquiladora donde se la pasaba 10 horas diarias trabajando para recibir un salario fijo pero era poco para poder cubrir su gastos, por lo que inicio con su negocio de Venta de joyería de plata desde hace 4 años ofreciéndolo a sus compañeras de trabajo y no se daba abasto por lo que renuncio y se ahora se dedica completamente al negocio. En este momento quiere comprar joyería de diferentes accesorios por que se aproxima el mes de Diciembre y necesita tener más mercancía para cubrir los gustos de cada cliente.
texts.en: Donata is a very responsible woman who in past years worked for a manufacturing plant where she spent 10 hours a day working to receive a fixed salary.  It was not enough to be able to cover all her costs, so she started up her business selling silver jewelery, offering her wares to her workmates over the last 4 years.  She was getting stretched too thin, so she quit her job and now is working full time in the jewelery business.  Currently she is wanting to buy different jewelery accessories because the month of December is drawing near and she needs to have more merchandise in order to satisfy the desires of every customer.

loans.use: To purchase accessories to sell in her business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan es padre de familia de dos pequeñas entre 10 y 6 años que se encuentran estudiando en la primaria. Lo que más desea es ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida y una vivienda digna donde puedan vivir. El suegro de Juan le regalo un terreno para construyeran su casa por lo que se dio a la tarea de levantar los muros poco a poco hasta construir un cuarto y después otro, en este momento le queda pendiente enjarrar las paredes de la parte de afuera para que se vea mejor vista. Para poder realizar su proyecto necesita comprar cemento, arena y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en: Juan is the father of two young children between the ages of 6 and 10, who are in primary school. What he wants most is to offer them a better quality of life and a proper home to live in. Juan's father-in-law gave him a piece of land to build a house, and so he set himself to the task of raising the walls bit by bit, building one room and then another. At this time, the next task is to plaster the walls on the outside so that the house will look better. To carry out this project, he needs to buy cement and sand and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to plaster the walls of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Los Quinuales - Concepcion Group

texts.es:
La Señora LIBERATA, tiene 53 años D. edad, casada con  3 hijos que estudian en colegio del estado, es socia D. la Alcancía comunal “Los Quinuales” se dedica a la fabricación y ventas D. prendas D. vestir como polos, etc. Tiene  su pequeño taller D. fabricación D. polos para varones, damas y niños, se siente muy alegre por sus logros y éxitos.     
Su préstamo los invertirá para la compra D. telas e hilos. Sus objetivos al futuro es comprar su propia tienda comercial y abrir otros locales D. ventas. En la fotografía está ubicada  primera lado derecha con chompa roja. 
las clientas faltaron por motivos D. salud y viajes locales.
texts.en:
LIBERATA is 53 years old, married, and has three children who are attending a state school.  She is a member of the 'Los Quinuales' community bank.  Her business is making and selling clothing such as polo shirts, etc.  She has a small workshop where she makes polo shirts for men, women and children.  She feels very happy about her achievements and successes.

Liberata will invest her loan in buying fabric and threads.  Her future goals are to buy her own store and to open other sales locations.  In the photo, Liberata is on the right-hand siD., in the front row, wearing a red sweater.

Some clients are not in the picture due to health problems, or local travel.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads.

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es: María, tiene 60 años de edad, viuda, vive en la cuidad de León, madre de 6 hijos, de oficio comerciante, dueña de una pulpería. Ella puso su negocio con capital propio antes trabajaba como asistente en una empresa avícola pero cerro y quedo sin empleo al no encontrar con los ahorros que tenia comenzó su pulpería. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, ropa, calzado, cosméticos ya que se acerca la temporada navideña donde las ventas son muy buenas y se obtiene buenos ingresos. Entre sus metas esta comprar 1 freezer, vitrinas y acondicionar mejor su local para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is 60 years old and a widow.  She lives in the city of León and has six children.  She is a shopkeeper by trade and owns a grocery store.  María set up her business with her own capital as she used to work as an assistant in a poultry company but it closed down and she was left without a job.  As she couldn't find a new job she used her savings to start her grocery store business.

María needs this loan to buy basic grains, clothes, footwear and cosmetics as the Christmas season is approaching and this is when her sales are very good and she makes good income.  Some of her goals are to buy a freezer and display cases and to better fit out her premises so that she can provide her customers with a better service.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, clothes, footwear and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and supplies.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Don  Martin, 63 años de edad, el es originario de San Isidro municipio de Matagalpa, pero desde hace varios años el vive en León, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad son independientes. El inicio con su negocio de raspados a los 31 años de edad, , con capital propio fue ahorrando de poco en poco hasta logra comprar un triciclo para vender raspados donde cada día sales a las calles de León sonando sus campanas anunciando los sabores de sus raspados ,los preferidos por sus clientes son los de coco, piña, sandia, nancite y dulce de leche regresando a las 6 y7 de la noche de vender y preparándose para la jornada del siguientes día con este humilde pero honrado negocio el ha alimentado a sus hijos antes el se dedicaba a la agricultura. El requiere el préstamo para comprar un triciclo para repartir raspados y comprar miel, leche, azúcar, vainilla, cucharas, vasos desechables que son parte de los materiales que utiliza para hacer y vender su producto. El tiene como meta lograr comprar 2 triciclos mas para vender raspados.
texts.en: Martin is 63 years old. He is originally from San Isidro, in Matagalpa, but he has lived in León for several years. He has three children who are all adults and live independently. Martin started his snow-cone business when he was 31. He used his own capital and saved up gradually so that he could buy a three-wheeled bicycle cart which he uses to sell his snow-cones. Every day, he goes out into the streets of León, ringing his bells, announcing the flavors of his snow-cones. His customers' favorite flavors are coconut, pineapple, watermelon, nancite (a fruit) and dulce de leche (caramel). He returns home at 6.00pm or 7.00pm at night and gets ready for his next day's work. With this humble but honest business, he has managed to feed his children. Before this, he used to work as a farmer. Martin needs this loan to buy a three-wheeled bicycle cart from which to sell his snow-cones. He will also buy honey, milk, sugar, vanilla, spoons and disposable cups, which are some of the materials he uses in making and selling his products. His goal is to manage to buy two further three-wheeled carts for selling snow-cones from.

loans.use: to buy a three-wheeled bicycle cart for selling snow-cones from, and to buy honey, milk, sugar, vanilla, spoons and disposable cups

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothes, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Sari Wangi Ternak Group

texts.en:
This group was formed by the stakeholder in the village. They are interested in the pig breeder loan from MUK. The Sari Wangi Ternak group has 10 women members. The members of the group are farmers. They work on their land or on other people's land and get a fee from that. To improve their income, beside that from their husbands, they want to run this business at home.

Ni Luh, head of the Sari Wangi Ternak, has two children. The first child is still in elementary school and the second is still a toddler. Her husband works as a chili and corn farmer. Ni Luh allready has pigs, but to improve her business, she needs a loan to buy more pigs. She will use the loan to purchase three pigs and use the rest for food. She maintains the pigs for fattening. Ni Luh hope the business can run smoothly, avoid diseases and earn a profit.

loans.use: To purchase three pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Sibang Sari Group

texts.en:
The Sibang Sari group is a women's group and has 10 members. The group is located at the Penyambangan village, Gerokgak district, North Bali. This is the first group in this area. The group consist of 10 women who have the same business: pig breeder. Although they already have a main job, they run this business to support their family income. Most of them work at the beach breeding fish.

Gusti Putu, as the head of the group, coordinated the group to receive the loan and training from MUK. They need the loan to start the business and the training to improve their knowledge of pig breeding. Gusti Putu will use the loan to purchase four local pigs for pig roll.

She has a plan to save the profit to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase four local pigs

loans.name: Triwana Sari Group

texts.en: With her current loan, Ni K. successfully maintained two pigs and successfully sold them to earn a net profit of Rp. 500,000. To get more benefits from the business, Ni K. needs another new loan to improve her income. This time she is using the loan to purchase three superior piglets. She hopes the result will be better than before.

loans.use: To buy three superior piglets

loans.name: Ronelio

texts.en:
Ronelio is 38 years old and is a married man with 3 children. The oldest child is 11 years old. Ronelio has been a fisherman for 15 years. He earns 8000 PHP per month with this business. Ronelio works hard to provide for his family and improve their living situation.

Ronelio has requested a loan to purchase a fishing boat and paint. Ronelio hopes to have an improving business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat and paint

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
29-year-old Ruel has been a fisherman for 6 years. He is married and has 4 children, aged between 2 and 8. Ruel earns 9000 PHP each month from fishing. Ruel works hard to improve his business and provide for his family.

Ruel has requested a loan to repair his fishing boat and purchase fishing nets. Ruel hopes to have a stable income to be able to save for his children's education.

loans.use: to repair his fishing boat and purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 48 years old and is a married woman with 5 children. The oldest child is 24 years old. Felicitas' husband is a farmer.

Felicitas has been in the business of raising pigs for 20 years. She plans to use her loan to purchase pig feed and vitamins. Felicitas also helps her husband grow rice on their land.  Felicitas hopes to send all her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 36 years of age, married, and has four children. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.

Naseem's husband sells vegetables in the vegetable market and also sells milk. He has a dairy cow at home. He takes its milk every day in the morning and sells to his community clients at low prices. The quality of milk he provides to his customers is very good, and that is why he has a good number of customers.

Naseem is a seamstress, as well as an embroidery expert. She loves her profession and learned the art of embroidery and sewing from her mother before she was married. She now earns a good income by using these skills, which helps her pay for her children's school fees. She also provides full support to her husband in his milk selling business and takes care of the business in his absence.

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her family business of selling cow milk. With the loan, she will buy another dairy cow, which will allow her to get a larger quantity of milk for selling and to increase her profits. Naseem has been operating this milk selling business along with her husband for many years and is very confident about its continued success after the loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en: Flaviana is an entrepreneur from Trinidad, Bohol. She is engaged in farming and primarily grows rice crops to sell. Flaviana works hard to improve her business. She requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Flaviana hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her decorative embroidery business. She has great technical skills and can craft beautiful embroidered clothes for her clients. Due to her good quality services, her embroidered clothes are in high demand among her clients. With this loan, Farzana will buy embroidery material, such as beads and thread, in bulk quantity to be able to prepare even better looking clothes and increase her sales and profits.

Farzana's husband also operates a decorative embroidery business. Both she and her husband together earn reasonably good profits, which helps them fulfill the basic needs of their family. Farzana has given birth to five children, three of whom are studying, while the other two remain at home. She is a great wife and very caring mother and is raising her children very well.

Farzana is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for many years. She is confident about her business's continued success as a result of this loan.

loans.use: to buy beads and thread for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Star B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Star B Group in Western Kenya! Emily is the facilitator of the Star B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Emily takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access quality farm inputs and have additional maize profits to educate her children. In the recent 2011 season, Emily had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Emily was only able to harvest 3 1/2 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Emily and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Emily will build a house and ensure food security.

Emily is pictured with her group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida, age 54, is a decorative embroidery expert, making beautiful looking embroidered clothes that sell for good prices in the market. She is very active and skillful and loves to do embroidery. Her clients trust in the quality of her goods and services and provide her with regular orders every month. Her husband is a shopkeeper and operates his shop in the nearby market. Khalida has given birth to three children. All of them have left their education and are currently looking for work.

She has applied for a loan from KIva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her embroidery business. She will utilize the loan amount by purchasing thread, beads, and cloth in bulk quantities that will allow her to attract more clients by providing them with even better quality services.

She is very experienced in her work and has been operating her business for many years. She is confident that a loan investment will help her bring in more profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy beads, thread, and cloth in bulk quantities for her decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Nakhobani S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nakhobani Group in Western Kenya! Margaret is the facilitator of the Nakhobani SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Margaret is currently taking care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and rent more land for farming. In the recent 2011 season, Margaret had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Margaret was only able to harvest two bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Margaret and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Margaret will buy a cow, ensure food security and invest in business to ensure education for her children.

In 2012, the members of Nakhobani SHG group are each preparing to plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Upendo Group in Western Kenya!  Betty is the facilitator of Upendo group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Betty takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Betty had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Betty was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Betty and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Betty will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Upendo group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Sinoko B Shg Group

texts.en:
Rogers is the facilitator of the Sinoko B SHG group. Rogers and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rogers takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices. In the recent 2011 season, Rogers had an excellent maize yield harvesting 13 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rogers was only able to harvest five bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rogers and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Rogers will buy a piece of land and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sinoko B SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Rogers is pictured with his group members. The field officer is at the far left and one member is absent.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her livestock business. With the loan investment, she will buy a buffalo to raise and sell for profit. She has been operating her business for many years and is confident that a loan investment will help her earn a higher profit from from her business. She also sews clothes in her spare time for her neighborhood clients and earns a reasonable income between the two businesses.

Asma lives with her two sons and her daughter. Both of her sons are studying and also help to support her outside their studies.

Asma is widow and has faced many hardships after the death of her husband. She has never given up hope and has raised her children with great effort. Her daughter is 22 years of age and Asma hopes that an improved business will enable her to provide a dowry for the marriage of her daughter in the near future.
 
She is a new loan applicant and is confident that it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo to raise and sell

loans.name: Wanjoya B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wanjoya B Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Mustafa is the facilitator of the Wanjoya B Group. He takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Mustafa had an excellent maize yield harvesting fifteen bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mustafa was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mustafa and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Mustafa will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Wanjoya B Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
Mustafa is pictured with his group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Njete A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Njete A Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Joseph is the facilitator of the Njete A SHG Group. He takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had an excellent maize yield harvesting thirteen bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joseph was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his  group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Joseph will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Njete A SHG Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Namuninga Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Namuninga SHG Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. As with the majority of people in this part of Kenya, the members of Namuninga SHG Group rely on maize for yearly food security and income.
Levi is the facilitator of the Namuninga SHG Group. He takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Levi had a very good maize yield harvesting eighteen bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Levi was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Levi and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Levi will pay for major annual expenses such as school fees and livestock investments. In 2012, the members of Namuninga SHG Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
In the picture, the field officer is standing on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kikai Complex Group

texts.en:
Pamela is the facilitator of the Kikai Complex group. Her group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Pamela takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices. In the recent 2011 season, Pamela had an excellent maize yield harvesting seven and a half bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest three and a half bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Pamela will invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Kikai Complex group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.
In the photograph above, Pamela is pictured with her group members. The field officer appears on the far left of the picture.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Chambikwe Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Chambikwe Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Francis is the facilitator of the Chambikwe Group. He takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Francis had an excellent maize yield harvesting sixteen bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Francis was only able to harvest four bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Francis and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Francis will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Chambikwe Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
The photograph shows Francis and his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Hafeez's Group

texts.en:
Hafeez operates her business from home and has some buffaloes for that purpose. She sells them for profit after raising them. She also sells their milk to her community clients and earns good profits.

Hafeez is also a sewing expert and works for her clients in the neighborhood. She is very fond of sewing and makes beautiful clothes that earn her reasonably good profits. She started this sewing business because she wanted to save some money for her children's future. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transport services to his passengers. Hafeez has given birth to five children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.

Hafeez has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her agriculture business. With the loan, she will purchase another buffalo. This will allow her to earn greater profits from her business.  Hafeez is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for many years. She is confident that a loan will help her improve the living standards of her family by increasing her profits.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her animal sales business.
