In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting eleven bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest three bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Alice will invest in livestock rearing and buy a piece of land for future use. In 2012, the members of Nabeki SHG group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.
In the photograph above, Alice is pictured with her group members and a cow raised by a group member. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further improvement of her husband’s animal sales business. With the loan, he will buy goats and sheep in larger quantities. He will raise them and will sell them at a profit to local butchers. He also has a buffalo and earns additional income for the family by selling its milk.
 
Nasreen is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients for profit. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. In her spare time, she provides support to her husband in his livestock business. She provides the animals with food and cleans their living space.

She has given birth to seven children. One of them is enrolled in school and two are working to contribute to the family financially.

Nasreen has a lot of confidence in her husband and his business, and she is certain that after this loan investment, her husband’s business will grow and enable her family to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep

texts.en: Florencia is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Florencia runs a sari-sari store business. She sells items like bread, canned goods and soft drinks. Florencia is able to help her husband provide for their daily needs through her income from the store. She has requested this loan to buy more items to sell, such as bread, soft drinks and detergent soap. Florencia hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as bread, soft drinks and detergent soap

loans.name: Maliki Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Maliki SHG Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. As with the majority of families in this part of Kenya, members of this group farm maize, and rely on maize for both annual food security and income.
Agnes is the facilitator of the Maliki SHG Group. She is a mother of four children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed her family and to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Like all One Acre Fund farmers, Agnes has seen a huge increase in harvests since accessing high-quality farming inputs through One Acre Fund. In the recent 2011 season, Agnes had an excellent maize yield harvesting twenty bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Agnes was only able to harvest two bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Agnes and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Agnes will pay for major annual expenses such as school fees and livestock investments. In 2012, the members of Maliki SHG Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
Agnes is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Mariakani area of Coastal Province, Kenya.  She is married and has three children. Two of them are in high school and one is in grade seven. Mary is a dairy farmer, and she has been in this business for the last six months. She got the idea from her husband, who is a farmer also.

Mary has been a Milango client for two years. She is applying for a loan of 70,000 KES to buy another dairy cow, since she has received a tender for the supply of milk to nearby schools.

Mary has been facing some challenges, such as animal diseases--like brucellosis and others--and raising capital to buy more dairy cows. 

Since her husband is not working, Mary has provided for the needs of her family from the profit she makes selling milk. She intends now to raise more income in order to be able to pay school fees for her children, who are already in high school. Mary comments that, in the next five years, she will be buying and selling dairy cows by herself.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Cheikh  Anta Gawane

texts.fr:
L'emprunteur est un homme marié.Il a trois enfants dont les deux vont à l'école.Il tient une boutique de vente de produits cosmétiques au marché central de sa localité.Son activité lui assure des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille sur le plan alimentaire, sanitaire , de l'éducation des enfants...

Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter 5 caisses de lait de beauté, 2 caisses de parfum et 1 caisse de vaseline. Il ambitionne de se lancer dans le commerce en gros.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married man. He has three children, of whom two attend school. 

He runs a shop selling cosmetics at the central market where he lives. His business activity generates income allowing him to support his family in areas of food, health, and his children's education...

To increase his stock of supplies, he is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to buy five cartons of body lotion, two cartons of perfume and one carton of Vaseline.

His ambition is to engage in wholesale trading.

loans.use: buy 5 boxes of body lotion, 2 boxes of perfume and a box of Vaseline

loans.name: Macodou Dieng

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire qui exerce dans le commerce  de produits cosmétiques et l'élevage de moutons.Il s'approvisionne en gros  dans les grands magasins de la capitale et revend ses produits cosmétiques en détails.Son commerce génère ainsi des revenus assez consistants dont il réinvestit une partie dans l'embouche ovine.Il achète des moutons qu'il engraisse et revend au bout de six mois.Cette activité d'élevage est très rentable et lui permet de participer grandement à la prise en  charge des dépenses d'entretien de ses parents et de ses frères et sœurs.Pour augmenter ses bénéfices dans l'embouche ovine,  il sollicite un prêt de 500 000f  afin d'acheter 10 moutons. Son ambition est de développer d'avantage cette activité.
texts.en:
The borrower is a young bachelor whose business activities are trading in cosmetics and raising sheep.

He buys cosmetic products wholesale from big stores in the capital and resells them retail. His trading generates enough revenue for him to reinvest some of it to fatten sheep.

He buys sheep to be fattened and resold within six months. This activity is very profitable and enables him to contribute significantly in managing household expenses for his parents, brothers and sisters.

To increase profits in his sheep-fattening business, he is requesting a 500,000 francs loan to purchase 10 sheep. His ambition is to further develop this business activity..

loans.use: buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
AMADOU HABITE DANS UN DEPARTEMENT DE LA REGION DU SUD AGE DE 41 ANS.IL EST MARIE D'UNE FEMME ET A 4 ENFANTS ,3 SONT A L'ECOLE  PRIMAIRE.
AMADOU FAIT LE COMMERCE DEPUIS 1988.AVEC CE CREDIT,IL AUGMENTE LA MARCHANDIS DANS SA BOUTIQUE,IL DEMARE SA JOURNEE DE TRAVAIL DE 8H A 20H.AVEC SON BENEFICE IL A ACHETER 2 MOTOS TAXI JAKARTA,ASSURE LES DEPENSES DE SA FAMILLE ET LES FRAIS SCOLAIRE.
AMADOU DANS L'AVENIR COMPTE OUVRIR 2 BOUTIQUES POUR SES 2 PETITS FRERES
texts.en:
Amadou lives in in a department of the Southern region. He is 41 years old, married and has four children, three of whom attend primary school.

Amadou has been a retail merchant since 1988. His workday extends from 8:00 am until 8:00 pm.

With this loan he will replenish his shop's supplies. His profits will enable him to buy two Jakarta taxi motorcycles, manage family expenses and tuition fees.

In the future he plans to open two shops for his two younger brothers.

loans.use: replenish store supplies

loans.name: Ndiaga

texts.fr:
NDIAGA AGE DE 45 ANS HABITE DANS UN DEPARTEMENT DE LA REGION SUD SENEGAL.MARIE D'UNE FEMME, IL A 9 ENFANTS,3 SONT A L' ECOLE LE PLUS AGE FAIT LA 1ere,LE 2em FAIT LA SECONDE ET LE 3em FAIT L'ECOLE PRIMAIRE.
NDIAGA TRAVAIL DPUIS 1991 DANS LA BOUCHERIE:LE COMMERCE DE VIANDE AVEC LEQUEL,IL ASSURE SES DEPENSES.DANS L'AVENIR, IL VEUT DIVERSIFIER LES PRODUIT ET SERVICES,FAIRE LE COMMERCE DE BOIS DE VENE POUR VENDRE A DAKAR.
texts.en:
Ndiaga is 45 years old and lives in a department in the South of Senegal. He is married with nine children, of whom three attend school. The oldest child is in 'Première', the second is in 'Seconde', and the third child attends primary school.
(Note: the last three years of the second cycle of secondary education in Senegal are named Seconde, Première, and Terminale)

Since 1991 Ndiaga has been active as a butcher and meat merchant, which allows him to manage his expenses.

In the future, he would like to diversify his products and services, and trade in Senegal rosewood to be sold in Dakar.

loans.use: strengthen his working capital

loans.name: Jorge  Rudi

texts.es: El  señor  Jorge  se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, nacido en la localidad de el Torno, hace 18 años  que vive en la zona  de  Santa  Rita, es casado con la señora Petrona  tienen tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  el trabaja con su vagoneta entre semana entre alimentar a los cerdos  y los fines de semana vende los cerdos que el cría  en la feria de El Torno, el Señor Jorge es cliente antiguo  que ya se encuentran pasando la tercera secuencia,  el crédito lo utilizara  para poder comprar alimento balanceado para la alimentación y engorde de cerdos y vender en estas fiesta de fin de año, su esposa trabaja como encargada de ama de llaves y haciendo limpieza recibiendo un sueldo, el se encuentra muy agradecido con la institución por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Jorge's business is raising and selling pigs.  He was born in the town of El Torno and has lived in Santa Rita for 18 years.  He is married to Petrona and they have three school-age children.  Jorge works with his truck during the week and also feeds his pigs.  On the weekends, he sells the pigs that he raises in the market in El Torno.

Jorge is a long-standing client who is on his third loan cycle.  He will use his loan to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for feeding and fattening his pigs which he will sell during the end-of-year holiday season.  Jorge's wife works as a housekeeping manager and doing cleaning work, for which she receives a salary.  Jorge is very grateful to the institution for the opportunity they have given him.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for raising pigs

loans.name: Mar

texts.fr: Monsieur Mar habite au Sénégal. Il est marié et père de famille. Il est âgé de 44ans et s’active dynamiquement dans le commerce de  produits diversifiés (fruits de mer,  habits, produits locaux, poulets de chair, moutons, etc.). Il pratique en meme temps l’aviculture. Il a une expérience de plus de 15 ans dans son activité qu’il a choisie  par nécessité dans le but de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. C’est un ancien membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il habite. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000frs prévu pour l’achat de moutons qu’il va revendre. Monsieur Mar compte sur ses revenus pour gérer son environnement social et c’est ainsi qu’il est parvenu a s’équiper en mobilier de maison et a subvenir correctement aux besoins de sa famille et a ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Mr. Mar is married and a father, and lives in Senegal. He is 44 years old and is dynamically active in trading diverse products (seafood, clothing, local products, broiler chickens, sheep, etc.). At the same time he is a poultry farmer.

He has accumulated experience over the past 15 years in business activities he has chosen out of the necessity of providing for his family.

He is a former member of one of the U-IMCEC branches in the locality where he resides. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs he will use to buy sheep for resale.

Mr. March relies on his income to manage his social environment. This was how he was able to equip his home with furnishings and provide adequately for his family's and his own personal needs.

loans.use: buy sheep for resale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana nacida  en la Ciudad de Cochabamba no esta casada pero convive  con el Sr. Rene, tienen 3 Hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, la Sra. Juana se dedica a la agricultura, siembran Maíz, yuca,  tiene su parcela en la Comunidad de la Planchada donde Viven y trabajan Agricultura. Ellos también se Dedican a la Ganadería tienen algunas vacas y cerdos, El Crédito que a sacado es para  la compra de semillas para la siembra de Maíz y después Plantar pasto para su ganado y es primera vez que trabaja con Emprender porque es la única Institución que le a dado la oportunidad para el mejora de su siembra y ganadería, es un apersona trabajadora y se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le brindo. Ojo  en la foto la Sra. Juana se encuentra en compañía de su hijita menor.
texts.en:
Juana was born in the city of Cochabamba.  She is not married but lives with Rene.  The couple have three school-age children.  Juana works as a farmer, growing corn and cassava.  She has a plot of land in the community of La Planchada where she lives and works.  She also raise livestock and has some cows and pigs.

The loan that Juana is taking out will be used to buy seeds for growing corn and then planting pasture for her cattle.  This is the first time that she has worked with Emprender because it is the only institution that has given her the opportunity to improve her farming and livestock raising businesses.  Juana is a hard-working person and she feels grateful for the opportunity that she has been given.  In the photo, Juana is shown together with her youngest daughter.

loans.use: to buy seeds for growing corn

loans.name: Diara

texts.fr:
DIARA AGE DE 46 ANS HABITE DANS UN DEPARTEMENT DE LA REGION DU SUD. MARIEE AVEC 9 ENFANTS.5 ENFANTS SONT A L'ECOLE AINE FAIT LE BAC 2em FAIT LE SECONDE LE 3em FAIT BFEM ,LES 2AUTRES FONT L'ECOLE PRIMAIRE.
DIARA FAIT SES ACHAT A KAFFOUTINE ZONE POISSONNEUSE DE LA LOCALITE POUR REVENDRE DANS LE MARCHE LOCAL.DEPUIS 8 ANS ELLE TRAVAIL DANS CE DOMAINE POUR ASSURER SES DEPENSES ET LES FRAIS SCOLAIRE DES ENFANTS CAR SON MARI NE TRAVAIL PAS.DIARA A UN TERRAIN DONT ELLE VEUT CONSTRUIRE DANS LE FUTURE AVEC SON BENEFICE CAR CE COMMERCE MARCHE TRES BIEN AVEC ELLE.
texts.en:
Diara is 46 years old and lives in a department from the Southern region. She is married with nine children, of whom five attend school:
[list]
[li]The eldest is preparing for the 'bac' (or baccalauréat, the final certification process giving access to schools of higher learning);[/li]
[li]the second child is in the 'Seconde' (first of the three high school years, the following years being the 'Première' and the 'Terminale');[/li]
[li]the third child is preparing for the BFEM (completion of middle school);[/li]
[li]and the other two are still in grade school.[/li][/list]

Diara resupplies in Kaffoutine (a nearby locality where fish are abundant), and resells in her local market. She has been working at this occupation for the past eight years to manage her expenses and the children's tuition fees, as her husband is out of work.

Diara owns a plot of land where she plans to use her profits in future construction work, because her business activity suits her and is doing well.

loans.use: Buy fish

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr:
MAMA EGE DE 49 ANS HABITE DANS UN DEPARTEMENT DE LA REGION DU SUD SENEGAL. MARIE D'UNE FEMME,IL A 9 ENFANTS,5 ENFANTS SONT A L'ECOLE.MAMA A FAIT 6 ANS DANS LE COMMERCE ALIMENTAIRE.IL VENT PLUSIEURES TYPE D'ALIMENTS:LES LEGUMES,LE MIEL,LE SORGHO,LE MAIS,LA PATTE D'ARACHIDE ETC.
MAMA FAIT SES ACHAT A DIAOBE DANS UN MARCHE HEBDOMADAIRE. AVEC SON COMMERCE,IL SUPPORTE TOUTES LES CHARGE DE SA FAMILLE.MAMA A UN TERRAIN QU'IL VEUT CONSTRUIRE ET METTRE EN LOCATION POUR L'AVENIR DE SES ENFANTS.
texts.en:
Mama is 49 years old and lives in an area within the Region of South Senegal. He is married and has 9 children. 5 of his children attend school. Mama has been selling food for 6 years. He sells several different kinds of food:  legumes, honey, sorghum, corn, peanut butter, etc.
Mama buys his products in the town of Diaobé at the weekly market. Mama uses his business to provide support for all his family members. He also owns some land that he wants to build on so that he can rent out the land for his children's future.

loans.use: to strengthen his capital

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 39, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Cornelio, a tailor, and she is a mother to her three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Imelda operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home furnishings. Seasonal clothing, like uniforms, is available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Aside from this, Imelda operates a small variety store for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Imelda hopes her business grows, and she dreams that she will be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work at her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members. With her fellowship group she can share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
This is Concepcion, 49, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Danilo, a construction worker, and she is a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Concepcion operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively separated in the Philippines, and, while waiting for their local dump trucks, people search the garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a small profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, like factories and other like businesses. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Concepcion hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams that she will be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work at her business. Every week, she faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Hector Edgardo

texts.es:
El señor Héctor, tiene 44 años de edad, es divorciado y vive con su madre en Choloma cortes, tiene 3 hijos de 11, 18 y 22 años de edad, dos de ellos estudian.

Don Héctor es una persona comerciante, tiene 21 años de dedicarse a la venta de zapatos para damas, tiene un local fijo en el mercado de San Pedro Sula, siempre deseó tener su propio negocio, esta contento de tenerlo al cual  le dedica 10 horas diarias.
Solicitó este préstamo para surtir el negocio en comprar más zapatos para dama y aumentar sus ventas.  Todas las ventas son de contado y de las ganancias cubre los gastos del hogar y compromisos que tiene.
texts.en:
Héctor, 44, is divorced and lives with his mother in Choloma, Cortes.  He has three children who are 11, 18 and 22 years old; two of them are in school.  Héctor is a merchant.  He’s been selling women’s shoes for 21 years; he has a stationery stand in the San Pedro Sula market.  He always wanted to have his own business and is happy to have it; he dedicates 10 hours a day to it.

He requested this loan to stock his business buying more women’s shoes to increase sales.  All of his sales are cash and with profits he covers household expenses and other commitments he has.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes to stock the business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda, 42, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, a driver, and she is a mother to her four children. Together they work hard for a safe and secure future for their family.

Rosalinda operates a piggery. She earns money by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Aside from this, she also sells RTW (ready to wear) clothes for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 26,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosalinda hopes that her business will continue to be successful. Every week, she faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feeds and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Aita

texts.fr: Madame Aita est une femme  mariée de  34 ans qui vit sur le territoire sénégalais depuis  plusieurs années. Elle s’active dans l’activité de vente d’habits  pour enfants  ou elle capitalise une expérience de 5 ans. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par opportunité mais aussi  sous  l’influence de sa mère. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2009. Elle sollicite un crédit de 350 000 frs prévu pour achever une construction déjà entamée pour y habiter et se décharger de frais de location. Ce crédit va contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie sociale de Aita.
texts.en: Madame Aita is a 34-year old married woman who has been living in Senegal for several years. She has a business selling childrens' clothes and has gained 5 years experience in this activity. She decided to pursue this activity when an opportunity arose thanks to her mother's encouragement. She has been a member of one of U-IMCEC's branches since May 2009. She is requesting a loan of 350,000 francs so that she can complete the ongoing construction of a building that will become her home so that she no longer has to pay rent. This loan will contribute to the improvement of Aita's social living conditions.

loans.use: to complete the construction of a dwelling

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr: Madame Oumy est une femme de 66 ans qui vit  dans l’une des communautés sénégalaises  et s’active dans la commercialisation de produits cosmétiques et  sanitaires, de thioups et divers autres articles.  Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans son activité. C’est une retraitée  qui a choisi cette activité en vue de compléter ses revenus à couvrir ses charges familiales. Elle est  sociétaire dans un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2004. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour redémarrer  son activité de commerce qu’elle avait interrompu pendant une certaine période.  Les bénéfices  que lui a générés son activité lui ont permis dans le passé de régler beaucoup de ses problèmes sociaux sans l’aide de personne.
texts.en: Madame Oumy is a 66-year old woman who lives in a Senegalese community and sells cosmetics, health products, hand-dyed fabrics (thioup) and various other items. She has more than 10 years experience in this business. She is a pensioner who has chosen to continue working so that she can supplement her income in order to cover family expenses. She has been a member of a branch of U-IMCEC since October 2004. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs so that she can restart her business following a period of inactivity. The profits generated by her business have enabled her in the past to resolve many of her social problems without anyone else's help.

loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Hadja Ndickou Gueye

texts.fr: Madame Hadja est une jeune mariée de 28 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Elle s’active depuis 3 ans dans le commerce et la vente  de tissus, thioups, mèches  greffages et lait pour le corps. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle vit depuis mai 2008. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de babouches et de greffages en vue de renforcer son stock et répondre a la demande de la clientèle. Son crédit précédent  lui a permis de d’investir dans son commerce et de diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialisait. Elle a réussi a mettre sur pied un mini cosmétique dans le l’atelier de coiffure de sa sœur.
texts.en: Madame Hadja is a 28-year old young married woman who lives in Senegal. For the last 3 years, she has been actively selling fabrics, hand-dyed fabrics (thioups), hair extensions, weaves and body lotions. She has been a member of her local branch of U-IMCEC since May 2008. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs so that she can buy slippers and hair weaves in order to stock up on her merchandise and meet the demands of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to invest in her business and diversify the range of products on sale. She has managed to set up a small cosmetics counter in her sister's hairdressing salon.

loans.use: to buy slippers and hair weaves for resale.

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbaye est âgé  de 28 ans . Il vit au Sénégal. Il est en meme temps maçon et éleveur aviculteur. Il a une expérience  de 6 ans dans ses activités. Il est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il vit depuis juin 2005. Il a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de moutons  à revendre.  Son objectif et de maximiser es revenus  dan s la mesure ou son premier prêt lui a permis de réaliser des bénéfices   qu’il a utilisé pour éponger  les dettes qu’il avait contracté et constituer un fond de roulement.
texts.en: Monsieur Mbaye is 28 years old. He lives in Senegal. He works both as a builder and a poultry farmer. He has 6 years work experience in these activities. He has been a member of his local branch of U-IMCEC since June 2005. He has already repaid a previous loan. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs so that he can buy sheep for resale. His aim is to maximize his revenues since his first loan enabled him to generate profits that he used to pay off the debts he had accumulated and to set up a fund of working capital.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale

loans.name: Dora Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Dora tiene 45 años de edad, esta acompañada con tres hijos.

Ella tiene 10 años de haber instalado un molino, para moler maíz. Fue su esposo quien le enseño como usarlo. Ella viaja a una ciudad de la zona oriental del país, para adquirir los materiales que necesita para darle mantenimiento al molino.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para reparar el molino, ya que necesita nuevos discos, reparar el motor y para comprar maíz para vender. Con esto ella tendrá en buen estado el molino y no dejar de trabajar por que se la ha dañado. Así no dejara de haber ingresos económicos y con la venta del grano de maíz ella lo comprara en mayor cantidad y a mejor precio.

Dora espera ahorrar ya que le gustaría comprar un molino más, y de las ganancias ahorrar para construir una casa propia, por que actualmente ella alquila una casa.
texts.en:
Dora is 45 years old and has three children.  She has been offering a corn milling service for 10 years.  It was her husband who taught her how to use the mill.  Dora travels to a city in the eastern part of the country to acquire the materials she needs to service her mill.

Dora will use the loan that she is requesting to repair her mill as she needs to buy new disks and fix the engine.  She will also buy corn to sell.  This will enable her to have her mill in a good state of repair and she will not have to stop working, which means that she won't stop making income.  She will also sell corn which she will buy in larger quantities and at a better price.

Dora hopes to save up as she would like to buy a further mill and, with the profits she makes, she would like to save up and build a house of her own as she currently rents a house.

loans.use: to repair her mill as she needs to buy new disks and fix the engine.  She will also buy corn to sell

loans.name: María Dora

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta D. cerdos desD. hace 18 años. Actualmente ella no esta desempeñando esta actividad, por que se ha encontrado mal D. salud. Antes D. dedicarse a la crianza D. cerdos ella trabajaba como empleada domestica en diferentes casas, pero cuando se caso y compro su casa ella se ha dedicado a la crianza D. cerdos para la venta.

María compra los cerdos en una comunidad los días miércoles, ella aborda un bus durante 45 minutos hasta llegar al tiangue (lugar donD. compra los cerdos). Una vez los ha comprado, ella los lleva en un carro que le cobra $15 dólares por cerdo que lleve hasta su casa, cuando viene en el carro con los cerdos, pasa comprando el concentrado para alimentarlos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 6 cerdos y para pago D. mano D. obra para sacar la cosecha que tiene sembrada su esposo. Con el préstamo ella lograra comprar más cerdos y venderlos más rápido, ya que tiene mucha clientela, lo que le generaría mejores ingresos para su hogar y estará trabajando en lo que mas le gusta que es la criaza D. cerdos. También su esposo sacara la cosecha ya que el lugar donD. la tiene sembrada es difícil su entrada y dispondrá D. más personas que le ayuden.

En el terreno donD. tiene la casa, hay bastante espacio, por lo que esta pensando instalar una granja D. pollos y tener siempre su crianza D. cerdos.
texts.en:
Señora María is 56 years old and married. She has bred and sold pigs for 18 years. Currently she is not engaged in this activity because she has been in poor health. Prior to breeding pigs, she worked as a domestic cleaner at different houses but when she got married and bought her own house she turned to breeding pigs for sale.

María buys the pigs on Wednesdays at an animal market. She takes the bus and travels for 45 minutes to arrive at the animal market (where she buys the pigs). Once bought, she hires a car at $15 per pig to take them home. On the way home with the pigs, she buy the concentrate used to feed them. 

The loan she is asking for is to buy 6 pigs and to pay for the manual labour required to harvest her husband's crop. With the loan she will be able to buy more pigs and sell them more quickly as she has a lot of customers which will generate a better income for her household. In addition she will be working at what she most likes to do which is raise pigs. Her husband will also harvest his crop as his field is difficult to access and having more peoiple to help him will make the job easier.

As there is plenty of space on the land where their house is built, she is thinking of setting up a chicken farm as well as continuing to breed pigs.

loans.use: to buy 6 pigs and pay for the labour needed to harvest her husband's crop.

loans.name: Juan Paul

texts.es: Juan, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, de 33 años de edad, el es comerciante se dedica a vender dulces y deliciosos raspados   el tiene de dedicarse  a esta actividad 15 años, su nivel de escolaridad es muy básico solo curso hasta primer  grado de primaria debido a su pobreza tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar desde muy joven. Cuando el empezó con este negocio fue trabajador haciendo el turno por unos días a una personas que tenia un carrito de raspados y vio que se sacaba ganancia diario entonces fue ahorrando e invirtiendo en este negocio hasta que  logro comprar su propio carrito de raspados de los cuales le endulzan la vida a quienes le comprar el vende raspados de coco, piña, nancite, de leche, de frutas sale todos los días a recorrer las calles de Granada ofreciendo su productos mientras su esposa lo espera en el hogar para preparar los raspados que el sale a vender. El requiere el préstamo para comprar azúcar, vasos, leña, frutas que son parte de los ingredientes que necesita para preparar sus apetecidos raspados. Esta inversión le ayudara a comprar mas materia prima y poder producir y vender un poco mas. Una de sus metas es poner una kiosko en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad donde pueda ofrecer sus riquísimos raspados. Su meta próxima es comprar un carrito moto que le ayude hacer mas fácil los recorridos en oda Granada.
texts.en:
33-year-old Juan lives in the city of Granada.  His business is selling candies and delicious snow-cones.  He has been in this business for 15 years.  His level of education is very basic as he only finished first grade.  Owing to his poverty, he had to start working at a very young age.  When he started out in this business, Juan was a worker and worked a few days for a person who had a snow-cone cart.  He saw that it made a daily income and so he saved up and invested in the business.  He managed to buy his own snow-cone cart with which he sweetens the life of those who buy his coconut, pineapple, nancite, milk and fruit snow-cones.  He goes out into the streets of Granada every day to sell his products while his wife waits for him at home and prepares the snow-cones that he goes out and sells.

Juan needs this loan to buy sugar, cups, firewood and fruit, which are some of the supplies that he needs to make his tasty snow-cones.  This investment will help him to buy more raw materials and to produce and sell a little more.  One of his goals is to set up a stall in a central location in the city where he can offer his delicious snow-cones.  His next goal is to buy a motorcycle cart which will help him to travel round Granada more easily.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cups, firewood and fruit

loans.name: Jose Carmen

texts.es:
El señor Jose tiene 39 años de edad y vive en La Puerta, una aldea del municipio de Belen. Tiene 12 años de casado con su esposa Maria, la cual es ama de casa. La pareja tiene dos hijos de 12 y 9 años, los cuales están estudiando. 

Jose era agricultor y cultivaba granos básicos como frijol. Hace dos años, con esfuerzos propios, Jose empezó un negocio para la elaboración de teja y ladrillo de barro y arcilla. Decidió cambiar oficio porque veía que este tipo de negocio era muy rentable. Hoy en día Jose tiene dos empleados en el negocio que le ayuden en la extracción de material y en la elaboración del producto. Los empleados tienen un año de estar trabajando con él. 

Solicitó este crédito (su cuarto con ODEF) para pagar los salarios de sus dos empleados. Así, podrá retener su equipo y juntos, elaborar más producto para la venta y así aumentar los ingresos del negocio.
texts.en:
José, 39, lives in La Puerta, a village in the town of Belén.  He’s been married to María who is a housewife for 12 years.  The couple has two children who are 12 and 9 years old and going to school.

José used to be a farmer;  he grew basic grains like beans.  Two years ago with his own efforts he started a business manufacturing roofing tiles and mud and clay bricks.  He decided to change occupations because he saw that this type of business was very profitable.  Today, José has two employees in the business that help him extract the material and manufacture the product.  The employees have been working for him for a year.

He requested this loan (his fourth with ODEF) to pay his two employees’ salaries so that he can keep his team together, manufacture more product to sell and increase the business’  income.

loans.use: to pay two employees' salaries.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: El  señor  Guadalupe  es  muy trabajador  y   día con día  se  esfuerza   por  salir  adelante,  gracias  a   su empeño y  dedicación  a  podido  adquirir   su  vivienda   pero nos  comenta  que   requiere  acondicionarla  para   brindarle a  su  familia  una mejor  estabilidad,  en este  momento  el requiere  realizar  la construcción de  una  barda   por  que  de esta  manera  brindara  a su  familia una  mayor   seguridad  y así cuando  el tenga   que    ir a  su trabajo  el lo   hará  de una  manera  mas  tranquila,  agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en:
Guadalupe  is a very hard-working man who strives to make progress every day.  Thanks to his determination and commitment, he has been able to acquire a house.  However, he tells us that he needs to do work on it in order to provide his family with better stability.  

Right now, Guadalupe needs to build a perimeter wall so that he can provide his family with more security.  This will mean that when he has to go out to work he will be able to do so more peacefully.  He is grateful for the support that he has received to carry out his project.

loans.use: to build a perimeter wall

loans.name: José Lizandro

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 60 años de edad, es divorciado con dos hijos.

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde los 9 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora. Tiene sembrados 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, la cosecha esta sembrada en un terreno alquilado que esta a 2.5 kilómetros de su casa. A él le ayudan otras personas a realizar sus cultivos. Cuando el camina del terreno hacia su casa va recogiendo leña para llevarle a sus hijas para que tengan para cocinar, él también tiene ganado.

Él llega a la ciudad a comprar los insumos agrícolas y el concentrado de los animales. Una vez tiene comprado lo que necesita, él paga para que se lo lleven cerca de su casa, luego los baja y la carga hasta su casa durante 10 minutos, ya que no entra ningún vehiculo hasta su casa.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de concentrado, para el ganado y para el pago de mano de obra para sacar la cosecha de maíz. De esta manera él lograra satisfacer dos necesidades que le urge realizar. También tendrá dinero para comprar más ganado.

Con el préstamo José no se vera en la necesidad de vender su ganado barato, para obtener el dinero que necesita, sino que por el contrario alimentara mejor a su ganado, para que le produzcan leche y tener su cosecha de maíz, para venderla.

Él desea que sus dos hijas continúen estudiando y construirle una casa a cada una de ellas, ya que es un padre soltero que necesita que sus hijas estén con él, pero con su propia casa.
texts.en:
José is 60 years old, divorced, and has two children.

José has been farming since he was 9 years old.  He is a hard-working person.  He grows 14,000 square meters of corn on a rented plot of land which is located two and a half kilometers from his home.  Other people help him to grow his crops.  When he walks from his plot of land toward home, José collects firewood along the way to give to his daughters so that they have some to cook with.  He also keeps cattle.

José travels to the city to buy his agricultural supplies and concentrate for his animals.  Once he has bought what he needs, he pays for somebody to deliver it near his home.  He then unloads it and carries it for 10 minutes to his house because his house is not accessible to vehicles.

José will invest this loan in buying concentrate for his animals and also in paying laborers to harvest his corn.  In this way he will manage to satisfy two needs that he must deal with.  He will also have money to buy more animals.

With this loan, José will not need to sell his livestock cheaply in order to make the money that he needs.  On the contrary, he will be able to better feed his cattle so that they produce milk and he will also have his corn crop to sell.

José would like his two daughters to continue studying and would like to build a house for each of them as he is a single father who needs his daughters to be with him, but in their own homes.

loans.use: to buy concentrate for his animals and to pay laborers to harvest his corn

loans.name: Douglas Antonio

texts.es:
Douglas hombre trabajador, carpintero, con planes de ir mejorando tanto la infraestructura de su negocio como su nivel de vida. Con el ciclo anterior del préstamo sustituyó en el momento las herramientas ya gastadas. Siendo de beneficio por qué mejoro su trabajo.
Solicita el préstamo para invertirse en la compra de materia prima como: maderas. Laminas de pleyboo, cerraduras, pega blanca, espejos para ropero, sellador de madera, zener, bisagras, aladera, clavos, entre otros productos que se ocupan en la elaboración de roperos, gaveteros, mesas de noche. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo del desarrollo de su negocio a lo del tiempo que tiene de tener su negocio.
texts.en: Douglas is a hardworking man and a carpenter with plans to keep improving not only the infrastructure of his business but also his standard of living. With the previous loan cycle he immediately replaced his worn-out tools for new ones which was of great benefit as his work improved. He is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as wood, 'pleyboo' prints, locks, white glue, wardrobe mirrors, wood sealer, zener, hinges, veneers, nails and other products used in the manufacture of wardrobes, dressers, nightstands. He is grateful to the financing institution for the support in growing his business in the time he has had his business.

loans.use: to buy materials to make wooden furniture.

loans.name: Daycis Del Socorro

texts.es: Deycis, originaria de Estelí , esta muy agradecida por la ayuda recibida atravez del préstamo  Kiva  pues lo invirtió en su venta de pollo , negocio  que le h ido muy bien , las ventas mejoraron al invertir mas , hizo mejoras en su casa ,  llegaron nuevos clientes , esta actividad ha sido muy positiva según nos expresa ella. Tiene una meta que le gustaría alcanzar la cual es poner otro puesto de venta de pollo y ampliar su negocio es por ello que esta solicitando un segundo préstamo en Kiva para comprar pollo y vender al por mayor y al detalle. Ya que su principal fuente de inspiración y esfuerzo son sus hijos para que ellos tengan un mejor futuros y sean profesionales.
texts.en: Deycis is from Estelí. She is very grateful for the help she received through the other Kiva loan. She invested it in her chicken selling, a business that has gone very well for her. Her sales improved when she invested more. She made improvements on her house, and gained more customers. This activity has been very positive, according to her. She has a goal that she would like to reach, and that is opening another stall to sell chicken and expand her business. That is why she is asking for a second Kiva loan to buy chicken to sell wholesale and retail. Her main source of inspiration and strength are her children, so that they can have a better future and learn a profession.

loans.use: to buy 750 pounds of chicken

loans.name: Basilia Yamilet

texts.es: Basilia trabajadora, emprendedora con su negocio de costura y venta de productos variados de uso personal ha logrado establecerse en el ámbito del comercio con trayectoria de excelente atención y productos de calidad. Con el préstamo anterior  aumento su inventario y logro cumplir con sus pedidos. Proyecto realizar mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda.  Con este nuevo ciclo de crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como: telas, hilos, botones, zíperes, elásticos, cosméticos (base, sombra, lápiz de cejas, pinturas de labios), perfumes entre otro productos que son buscados por sus clientes en estos tiempos de festividades. Agradece por el apoyo constante brindado por la financiera para el desarrollo de su negocio y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Basilia is a hard-working, entrepreneurial woman.  Through her sewing business and her business selling a variety of personal products, she has managed to establish herself in the field of commerce, providing excellent customer service and good-quality products.  With her previous loan, Basilia increased her inventory and managed to fill her orders.  She also plans to make some improvements to the infrastructure of her home.

With this new loan, Basilia will invest in buying raw materials such as fabrics, threads, buttons, zippers, elastic, cosmetics (face powder, eye shadow, eyebrow pencils and lipsticks), perfumes and other products that her customers are looking for during this holiday season.  She is grateful for the constant support that she receives from the financial institution which allows her to develop her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making clothes

loans.name: Fredy Suyapa

texts.es:
Fredy  Suyapa, tiene 33 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos de 2, 6, 12 y 14 años de edad, tres de ellos estudian, su esposo trabaja en una gasolinera de la ciudad, viven en un sector suburbano de San Pedro Sula.

La señora es muy trabajadora, tiene un local fijo en el mercado donde vende mercadería como ropa interior para damas, ropa de niño como pañales, camisas y blusas.  Trabaja las 8 horas del día, todos los días. 

Este negocio lo estableció hace un año, con el fin de generar más ingresos al hogar y cubrir todos los gastos. Es su primer préstamo y es para invertir en ropa interior para damas y niños. De esta manera va incrementar su inventario para vender más. Su plan es ampliar mas el negocio.
texts.en:
Fredy Suyapa, 33, is married and has four children who are 2, 6, 12 and 14 years old; three of them are in school.  Her husband works at a gas station in the city.  They live in a suburban zone in San Pedro Sula.

She is very hardworking.  She has a stationary stand in the market where she sells merchandise like women’s underwear, children’s clothes like diapers, shirts and blouses.  She works 8 hours per day, every day.

She opened the business a year ago aiming at generating more income for her household and to cover all expenses.  This is her first loan and it will be used to buy women’s and children’s underwear so that she can increase her inventory and sell more.  Her plan is to expand the business more.

loans.use: to buy women's underwear and children's clothes.

loans.name: Jeffry

texts.es: Jeffry, tiene la edad  de 25 años, está casado y vive con su esposa actualmente y que es su mayor prioridad. En con el crédito pretende comprar los cerditos pequeños para engordarlos  y así luego venderlos. El actualmente cuenta con un pequeño local donde los tendrá para engordar durante el tiempo requerido. El tiene varios años de trabajar con estos animales y tiene la experiencia necesaria para poder sacar del proyecto el máximo de ganancias. El tiene como meta prioritaria engordarlos a tiempo para venderlos al mercado de la localidad, pues actualmente se acerca una muy buena temporada para la venta de cerdos. El piensa en el futuro de él y su esposa por lo cual con los ingreso pretende mejorar su nivel de vida y capacidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jeffry is 25 years old, married, and lives with his wife who is his main priority.  He plans to use his loan to buy small piglets to fatten and then sell.  He currently has a small space where he will keep them and fatten them for the necessary amount of time.  He has been working with these animals for several years and has the experience he needs to make maximum profits from his project.  His main goal is to fatten his pigs on time so that he can sell them in the town market as a very good season for selling pigs is approaching.  He is thinking of his own future and that of his wife.  He plans to use his income to improve their standard of living and their financial means.

This is the first loan that Jeffry has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR gave him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es:
El señor Cornelio le ha traído grandes beneficios los créditos que ha tenido con KIVA. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar una maquina para cortar carme y además, se dedica a los abarrotes y elaboración  de comida, le permitirá invertir mas mercancías y tener mas utilidad en el negocio. 
Don Cornelio vivía solo pero a raíza de inseguridad y por su salud su hijo decidió irse a vivir con el y así poderle ayudar con el negocio. 
Es pera contar con su cooperación en este crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene y con el cual a pagado los tres créditos que ha tenido con KIVA quien le ayudado a mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Cornelio has reaped many benefits from the loans he has had with KIVA. He is asking for a loan to buy a meat cutting machine. He also sells groceries and prepares meals, and the loan will allow him to invest in more merchandise and have more profit in his business.    
 
Cornelio used to live alone but for safety and health, his son decided to live with him and help him with the business. 
 
He hopes to have your cooperation with the is loan, since this is his source of income and he has paid off the other three loans he has had with KIVA, which has helped him improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a meat cutting machine.

loans.name: Elsa Evangelina

texts.es:
La señora Elsa y su esposo tienen tres hijos los cuales ya están creciendo y necesitan su espacio. Tiene una niña que desean que ella tenga su privacidad en la casa, además de que una parte de la casa es de madera y quieren reforzarla porque en la temporada de lluvia se les ocasionan ciertos problemas. Desean proteger a su familia de enfermedades y que tengan su patrimonio mejor y seguro para ello. 
Dona Elsa esta estudiando un curso de belleza para después iniciar un negocio y su esposo es empleado de una tienda.
texts.en: Señora Elsa and her husband have 3 children who are growing up and need their own space. They want their daughter to have some privacy in the house. In addition, part of the house is made of wood and they want to reinforce it as during the rainy season it causes them problems. They want to protect their family from disease as well as improve and make secure their children's inheritance for them. Don Elsa is studying a beauty course in order to start a business and her husband works in a store.

loans.use: to extend the ground floor and start on the construction of a bedroom.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El joven Ramón solicita el préstamo para comprar un carro para trabajar como taxista, ya cuenta con uno pero desea, dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y ayudar a otra persona dándole trabajo. Se dedica al negocio de chofer de un taxi desde hace tres años. 
Ramón vive con su mama que lo apoya con su negocio y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa. Desea pronto tener una varios vehículos y tener una compañía de taxis.
texts.en:
The young Ramón is asking for a loan to buy a car sa as to work as a taxi driver. He already has a car buy he wants to provide a better service for bhis clients and help another person by providing them with a job. He has been a taxi driver for 3 years.

Ramón lives with his mother who supports him with bhis business and helps with the household expenses. He wants to soon have various vehicles and a taxi company.

loans.use: to make the downpayment on a car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Madame Hélène  est femme mariée de 47 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce plus particulièrement dans le domaine de  la vente de friperie  depuis plus de 10 ans . Elle est sociétaire d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2003. Son objectif  est de diversifier son activité de commerce selon les besoins de la population. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de moutons à revendre. Elle souhaite renforcer les bénéfices que lui génère  son activité d’autant plus que   ses bénéfices antérieurs lui ont permis de réfectionner son domicile.
texts.en: Mrs. Hélène is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in Senegal. She is a merchant who has been selling second-hand clothing for over 10 years. She became a member of the U-IMCEC branch in May 2003. Her goal is to diversify her trade activity to match the needs of the population. She is seeking a loan of 300,000 francs to purchase sheep for resale. She wants to strengthen the revenue earned from her activity, especially since past revenue allowed her to renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou  habite dans une  des localités sénégalaises. Elle  est âgée  de 51 ans . Elle est mariée et s’active depuis  plus de 10 ans dans la couture et le tricotage de pagnes et robes. Ses études  dans le domaine du tricotage lui ont assurée sa compétence actuelle. Elle est membre du guichet  de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle vit depuis janvier 2006. Elle a déjà remboursé 7 prêts antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour le financement des études de son fils. Son crédit antérieur lui a permis d’honorer une commande pressante.
texts.en: Mrs. Aissatou lives in a district of Senegal. She is a 51-year-old married woman who has been a seamstress and a knitter of pagnes and dresses for over 10 years. The knitting classes that she took have helped her to become the skilled knitter she is today. She became a member of her local U-IMCEC branch in January 2006. She has already obtained and repaid seven prior loans with the organization. She is now seeking a loan of 200,000 francs to fund her son’s studies. The previous loan helped her to fill a rush order.

loans.use: to fund her son's studies

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna emprendedora, trabajadora comerciante desde hace tiempo vende tortilla, nacatamales, frito de cerdo entre otros productos de consumo, sus planes mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda poco a poco para mayor comodidad y seguridad a su familia. Como madre soltera el por venir de sus hijos es primordial se le ha presentado dificultades en lo que es económicamente ya que en ocasiones las ventas han bajado. Con este nuevo ciclo de préstamo comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedrines, bloques, estribu, tablones de madera, entre otros materiales para construir el muro del fondo de la casa, esto le evitara que los antisociales no intente entrar a robar a su casa.con esta obra el cliente esta satisfecha por lograr el objetivo expresándolo exteriormente, pudiéndose notar en la foto tomada.Agradece el apoyo al desarrollo de su nivel  de vida.
texts.en:
Reyna is an enterprising hardworking merchant who has been working for some time selling tortillas, nacatamales (steamed corncakes with various fillings), and fried pork among other types of food.

Her plans are to improve the infrastructure of her house, little by little, to give her family more comfort and better security. As a single mother, her children are her primary concern and she has had financial problems during periods of low sales. 

With this new loan cycle she will buy construction materials such as cement, sand, gravel, blocks, supporting straps, wooden boards, among other material needed to construct the wall behind the house that would keep away the delinquents as they would not attempt to enter to rob her home. 

She is thankful for the support in the improvement of her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Adama Oury

texts.fr: Madame Adama est âgée  de 45 ans . Elle vit au Sénégal et s’active dans le commerce et la vente de fruits, légumes huile de palme et pâte d’arachide depuis 20 ans . C’est une activité qu’elle avait choisi sous l’influence de sa maman. Elle est membre du guichet de la localité depuis mai 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé 7 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de condiments car elle souhaite augmenter la productivité de son activité de commerce. Ses crédits antérieurs lui ont permis de réaliser des bénéfices et de subvenir correctement  aux besoins  de ses enfants sans l’assistance de personne.
texts.en: Mrs. Adama is 45 years old and she lives in Senegal. She has been selling fruits, vegetables, palm oil and groundnut paste for 20 years. She chose this activity based on her mother’s input. She became a member of the local branch in May 2003 and she has already repaid seven previous loans. She is seeking a loan of 200,000 francs to buy condiments intended to help boost the productivity of her business activity. Past credits have allowed her to earn profits and provide adequately for her children’s needs without help from anyone.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale

loans.name: Andres De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Andres, de 49 años de edad, originario de Granada, casado, tiene 4 hijos, el es comerciante de frutas y verduras, tiene 11 años con este negocio. El inicio como vendedor en otro tramo de ventas de verduras donde adquirió experiencia noto que era un negocio rentable y empezó ahorrar para poner su propio tramo y lo consiguió  se estableció en el mercado de Granada que  es donde tiene su humilde puesto de venta de frutas y vegetales, luego adquirió una camioneta usada que en la actualidad la utiliza para transportar sus productos también la usa de acarreo.
El requiere el préstamo para comprar piña, papaya, plátano, naranjas, melones, mandarinas que son  el tipo de frutas y vegetales que mas vende. Una de sus metas es hacerle mejoras a su local para hacerlo un puesto  mas seguro.
texts.en:
Don Andres is a 49 year old native of Granada. He is married and has 4 children. He sells fruit and vegetables and has had this business for 11 years. He started off selling vegetables at another stall where he gained experience and realized that it was a profitable business. He started to save so as to set up his own stall and he managed to establish one in the Granada market which is where he currently has his humble fruit and vegetable stall. Subsequently, he acquired a second-hand truck which he currently uses to transport his products as well as for haulage. 

He needs the loan to buy pineapples, papaya, bananas, oranges, melons and mandarin oranges which are the types of fruit and vegetables he sells the most. One of his goals is to make improvements to his premises to make it a safer stall.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, papaya, bananas, oranges, melons and mandarin oranges.

loans.name: Francisco Reymundo

texts.es: Francisco casada, sus hijos estudiantes, trabaja para una empresa privada desde hace tiempo como guardia de seguridad un trabajo honesto,su esposa vende tiene venta de tortilla, nacatamales y otros productos siendo un ingreso mas al hogar, su planes es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda ya que esta en mal estado deteriorándose por completo, su objetivo preparar a sus hijos como profesionales así tendrá mejores oportunidades de trabajo en un futuro. El préstamo que solicita será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, láminas de zinc corrugado, perlines, golosos, bloques, entre otros para entechar la casa. Esta en mal estado y se le pasa toda el agua en tiempo de lluvia. Agradece a la financiera por la oportunidad de este crédito el cual obtendrá grandes beneficio para su familia.
texts.en: Francisco is married and his children are in school. He’s been working for some time for a private company as a guard. It’s honest work. His wife sells tortillas, Nicaraguan tamales, and other products for income to be more at home. His plans are to improve the infrastructure of their home since it’s already in a poor state, deteriorating completely. His goal is to prepare his children to work as professions so that they may have better work opportunities in the future. The loan he’s asking for will be invested in the purchase of construction materials: cement, corrugated zinc sheets, purlins, bolts, blocks, etc. for roofing the house. It’s in poor condition and leaks water during the rainy season. He thanks the lenders for the opportunity of this loan which will be a great benefit to his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Demba

texts.fr: Monsieur Demba est un homme marié de 50 ans qui vit  au Sénégal. Il exerce la profession d’agent de sécurité municipal. Il est en meme temps maçon et commerçant. Il a une expérience de plus de 15 ans dans son activité de commerce. Il est issu d’une famille d’éleveur et a toujours pratiqué l’élevage. Sa finalité a toujours été de gagner des revenus légalement. Il est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2003. Il a déjà remboursé 4 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 prévu pour l’achat de moutons à revendre. Son dernier crédit lui a permis de payer le permis de conduire de son fils.
texts.en: Mr. Demba is a 50-year old married man living in Senegal. He works as a municipal security officer. At the same time, he is also a stonemason and an entrepreneur. He has over 15 years of experience in his enterprise. He comes from a family of animal farmers and has always raised animals. His goal has always been to obtain a legal way of earning revenues. He has a member of a branch of U-IMCEC since June 2003. He has already repaid four prior loans. He is seeking a loan of 200,000 [West African franks] to buy sheep for resale. His latest loan has allowed him to pay for his son’s driver’s license.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale

loans.name: Víctor Fidel

texts.es:
El señor Víctor Fidel se ha dedicado a las ventas desde hace 15 años, quien le ayuda es su esposa pero a tenido problemas con la salud, la cual fue causando que su negocio tuviera perdidas. 
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en compra de cobijas y cobertores ya que sus clientes le están solicitando antes de que llegue la temporada de invierno. Y así podría recuperarse. 
Don Víctor Fidel tiene un proyecto de acondicionar una parte de su casa para el negocio y tener hay mismo su local y poder atender el negocio sin descuidar a su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor Fidel has worked in his sales business for 15 years. The person who helps him is his wife, but she has had problems with her health, causing his business to experience losses. 
 
He is requesting a loan to invest in buying bedclothes and bedspreads, since his customers are requesting them before the winter season arrives. In this way, he can revitalize his business. 
 
Víctor Fidel plans to set up an area for his business in part of his home, so that he will be able to run the business without neglecting his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as bedspreads for the winter season.

loans.name: Ndira Diagne

texts.fr: Madame Ndira est secrétaire  communal. En meme temps elle exerce une activité de commerce de  vente de thioups, parfums et déodorants. ELLE A UNE EXPÉRIENCE DE 3 ANS DANS SON activité  DE COMMERCE. Elle a choisi cette activité dan le but d’arrondir les fins de mois. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé  3 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de parfums  et  déodorants qui seront destinés a la vente. Son dernier prêt lui a permis de réaliser des bénéfices et de s’équiper  en ustensiles de cuisine lors de son déménagement.
texts.en: Mrs Ndira is a secretary, as well as working in the business of re-selling perfumes and deodorants during the past three years. She chose to become involved in this business in order to increase her income. She is a member of the UIMCEC bank since May 2003, and has received and successfully reimbursed three loans previously. She is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs in order to purchase greater quantities of products to be sold. Her last loan allowed her to make a bit of profit which she spent on household and kitchen items.

loans.use: purchase perfumes and deodorant to re-sell

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Maria Rosario es viuda  con la perdida de su esposo quedo sola, es por eso que decidió empezar un negocio de venta de ropa usada ya que será el ingreso que tenga para su familia. 
Doña Maria Rosario además de la venta de ropa también vende tacos mañaneros. Desea mejorar la mercancía de su negocio ya que mucha gente que le compra le esta solicitando ropa de invierno y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio pagara el crédito ya que recibe un pensión mínima pagara los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Rosario is a widow.  When she lost her husband she was left alone.  For that reason, she decided to start a business selling used clothing as it would make income for her family.

In addition to selling clothing, Maria Rosario also sells breakfast tacos.  She would like to improve her business merchandise as there are lots of people who buy from her.  She is requesting a loan because she would like to buy winter clothing but does not want to withdraw capital from her business.

With the profits that she makes from her business, Maria Rosario will repay her loan as she receives a minimum pension which she will use to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for her business

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, de oficio comerciante, dueña de una pulpería en su casa de habitación lleva 10 años con este negocio, es casada, madre de 2 hijos de 24 y 19 años de edad. Ella inicio con su negocio vendiendo golosinas y galletas, 2 bolsas de pan dulce, fue poco a poco comprando y vendiendo , puso este negocio con el objetivo de tener una actividad que le permitiera estar cerca de sus hijos y que al mismo tiempo generara ingresos para aportar en su hogar y pagar la educación de sus hijos. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas, jugos, enlatados, sopas. Pues el crédito le permitirá adquirir productos de los cuales carece y sus clientes le solicitan a diario. Una de sus metas es convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora de alimentos.
texts.en:
María lives in the city of Granada.  She is a shopkeeper and has a grocery store which is located in her home.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  María is married and has two children who are 24 and 19 years old.  She started out in her business selling candies, cookies and 2 bags of sweet bread.  She gradually bought and sold more.  María set up this business with the aim of having a business that would allow her to be near her children and, at the same time, make income so that she could contribute towards her household and pay for her children's education.

María needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, soda, juice, canned food and soups.  Her loan will allow her to acquire products that she lacks and which her customers are requesting every day.  One of her goals is to turn her grocery store into a food wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soda, juice, canned food and soups

loans.name: Miguel Hernan

texts.es: Miguel, de 29 años de edad, casado, padre de tres hijos, de 8,7 y 3 años de edad. El es un humilde y sencillo comerciante vende frutas y verduras con un plástico de techo para cubrirse del sol, dos cajillas de plástico y sacos de tomates rojos y frescos conforman su puesto de venta en un esquina del mercado de la ciudad de Granada. Sus inicios fueron las ventas ambulantes en el mercado ganando su propio dinero su padre lo empezó a motivara que pusiera su puesto de ventas de verduras tuvo la oportunidad de conseguir un lugar fijo donde vender sus vegetales  medida que su negocio fue generando ingresos el compro un camioneta de segunda mano la cual utiliza para acarreo. El requiere el préstamo para comprar cebolla, tomates, chiltomas, pepinos, apio, repollo, remolacha, naranjas, yuca, papaya, sandia, melones. Pues el quiere tener variedad de todo tipo de frutas y vegetales para ofrecer y proveer a su clientes de buenos productos. Uno de sus planes es construir una pequeña bodega y hacer mas seguro su puesto.
texts.en: Miguel, is 29 years old. He is married and the father of three children, aged 8,7 and 3. He is a humble and simple merchant who sells fruits and vegetables with a plastic sheet for a roof to protect him from the sun. Two plastic crates and sacks of fresh red tomatoes make up his sales stand, at the corner of a market in the city of Granada. He started as a mobile vendor in the market, earning his own money. His father encouraged him to set up his own vegetable sales stand, and he had the opportunity to obtain a fixed place where he could sell his vegetables. As his business generated more income, he bought a small secondhand truck, which he uses to transport his products. He needs the loan to buy onions, tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, celery, cabbage, beets, oranges, yuca, papayas, watermelon and cantaloupes. This is because he wants to have a variety of fruits and vegetables to offer his customers and to provide them with good products. One of his plans is to construct a small shop building to make his sales stand more secure.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, celery, cabbage, beets, oranges, yuca, papayas, watermelons and cantaloupes.

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es: Sara, de 47 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Granada, tiene 2 hijos, casada, es comerciante ella vende zapatos y ropa de cama usada mercancia que coloca una sencilla y vieja cajilla de madera , pues no tiene un puesto propio. Inicio con la ayuda de una amiga que le dio un lugardonde vender en el mercado ya que antes vendía ambulante y no le generaba los ingresos suficientes pero ahora la mayoría de sus clientes la llegan a buscar además de los ella ya conocía anteriormente pues también vendía en los pueblos cercanos de Granada ella también vende leña en su casa para ayudarse a generar ingresos y pagar la educación de sus hijos. Con la temporada navideña que esta por comenzar quiere aprovechar para vender  es por ello que solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos, sabanas, ropa para ofrecer y vender. A ella le gustaría tener un tramo propio bien acondicionado y ofrecer de todo tipo de mercadería para solventar, donde sus clientes encuentren de todo articulo para el hogar.
texts.en: Sara is 47 years old and a native of the city of Granada. She is married and has 2 children. She sells shoes and used bed linen which she displays in an old and simple wooden box as she doesn't have a stall of her own. She started her business with the help of a friend who gave her a place to sell at the market as before she worked as a street vendor which didn't generate enough of an income. However, the majority of her customers now come looking for her, in addition to the ones she knew previously as she used to also sell at the towns close to Granada. She also sells firewood at home to help generate income and pay for her children's education. With the holiday season about to start, she wants to make good use of it to sell which is why she is asking for a loan to buy shoes, sheets, clothes to offer and sell. She would like to have her own well-equiped stall and offer all kinds of merchandise for sale, where her customers can find everything for the home.

loans.use: to  buy shoes, sheets, clothes.

loans.name: Gladys Del Socorro

texts.es: Gladys, 60 años de edad, es una sencilla pero trabajadora ama de casa con apenas la primaria aprobada, ella se dedica a vender frescos y comida, vive en la ciudad de Granada, casada, tiene 9 hijos los cuales son independientes. Ella inicio con este negocio cuando dejo de trabajar como limpieza en una oficina de Abogados con su liquidación ella puso su negocio decidió vender vigoron que un plato típico de la ciudad de Granada hecho de yuca, chicharrón y ensalada de repollo muy apetecido por sus clientes y turistas que visitan la ciudad inicio cuando tenia 55 años de edad también se dedica al alquiler de sillas y mesas. Ella requiere el préstamo para  comprar sillas y mesas para alquilar pues el inventario con el cuenta en la actualidad es muy poco y necesita poseer mas inventario para tener de capacidad de alquilar mas. Una de sus expectativas es tener un kiosko donde pueda atender  sus clientes y ofrecerles su famoso y rico vigoron granadino.
texts.en: Gladys is 60 years old and is an unpretentious and hardworking housewife who only completed elementary school. She lives in the city of Granada and sells refreshments and food. She is married and has 9 children, all of them independent. She started this business when she stopped working as an office cleaner for a firm of lawyers. With her severance pay she decided to set up her business and sell 'vigoron', a typical Granadino dish made of cassava, pork rind and coleslaw which is in great demand by her customers and tourists that visit the city. She started the business when she was 55 years old. She also rents out tables and chairs. She needs the loan to buy tables and chairs to rent out as her current inventory is very small and she needs more inventory so as to be able to rent out more. One of her expectations is to have a kiosk where she can serve her customers and offer them her delicious and famous 'vigoron' Granadino.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Xotchil Cristina

texts.es: Originaria de Granada, con 34 años de edad, Xotchil se gana la vida, vendiendo ropa, tiene tres hijos, es casada, ella estudio una carrera técnica de administración de empresas. Inicio vendiendo ambulante ropa  al crédito, recorría toda la ciudad de Granada buscando como vender su mercadería, al morir su papa heredo un terreno el cual vendió y con esa capital comenzó a invertir en compra de ropa de todo estilo y tamaño para vender, después se traslado al mercado de la cuidad alquilo un pequeño tramo donde vende sus piezas de ropa. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa, vestidos de damas, jeans para varón mujer y niños y blusas.  La inversión la ayudara a mejorar su inventario de ropa ofreciendo variedad de estilos para todo tipo de clientes que visite su tienda. Uno de sus sueños es tener su propio local pero por lo pronto su meta próxima es que sus hijos se preparen y tengan una buena educación.
texts.en: 34 years old and a native of Granada, Xotchil makes a living selling clothes. She has 3 children and is married. For a career she studied business administration. She started out selling clothes as a street vendor, on credit, and would travel all over the city of Granada looking for a way to sell her merchandise. When her father died she inherited a plot of land which she sold and used the capital to buy clothes of all styles and sizes to sell. Later. she moved to the city market and rented a small stand where she sells her garments. She needs the loan to buy clothes, ladies' dresses. jeans for men, women and children and blouses. The investment will help improve her clothing inventory, offering a variety of styles for all kinds of customers that might visit her shop. One of her dreams is to have her own premises but for the moment her next goal is that her children be well prepared and have a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothes, dresses, jeans and blouses.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Angela una sencilla comerciante de 55 años de edad, habitante de la cuidad de Granada, que a duras pena finalizo segundo grado de primaria, pues la mayor parte de su niñez  se dedico  a trabajar pues su familia no tenia recursos para ponerla a estudiar. Ella tiene 2 hijos, es casada, vende semillas de marañón(una fruta silvestre). Inicio con este negocio cuando dejo de trabajar de domestica para independizarse tener un negocio propio además que cuando alcanzo una edad avanzada y no le querían dar trabajo por tal motivo tenia que busca como salir  adelante por su propia cuenta. Ella viaja de Granad a Managua para vender sus semillas de marañón en una esquina de una universidad donde la mayoría de sus clientes son estudiantes y profesores cuando las ventas están bajas ella sale con sus bolsas de marañón a vender a los semáforos y cuando están en rojo ella aprovecha para vender de carro en carro es así como se gana la vida a diario. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas de marañón al por mayor. Pues el capital que tiene no le ajusta para comprar mas cantidad y la cual esta necesitando para vender mas y mejorar sus ventas ya que esta trabajando duro para lograr cumplir uno de sus planes que es tener un kiosko propio donde venda sus semillas de marañón.
texts.en:
Angela is a simple merchant, aged 55. She lives in the city of Granada. She was barely able to finish the second grade of primary school, because she dedicated most of her childhood to working, since her family did not have the resources to send her to school. She is married and has 2 children. Her work is selling cashews (a forest product).
