She started this business when she stopped working as a domestic helper in order to become independent and have a business of her own. Also, as she became older, people did not want to hire her, and and for this reason she needed to find a way to get ahead on her own. She travels from Granada to Managua to sell her cashews on a street corner by a university, where most of her customers are students and professors. When sales are low, she goes out to the intersections with her bags of cashews, and when the light is red, she sells them from car to car. This is how she earns a living each day. 
 
She needs the loan to buy cashews on a wholesale basis, because the capital she has is not enough to buy a larger quantity, which she needs to sell more and improve her sales. She is working hard to fulfill one of her plans, which is to have a kiosk of her own where she can sell her cashews.

loans.use: to buy cashews on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Esperanza En Ti Group

texts.en:
Saturnina is the coordinator of her group "Esperanza en ti" (Hope in You). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and only one child. She says that her most difficult challenges have been to finish building her house, to buy a computer for her children, and to finish studying. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying reading and visiting friends. She started very young, and she likes it a lot.

Saturnina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for nine years. She started selling underwear with some money she saved from her first business selling wallets and handbags. She began to focus on selling underwear because it was a more popular item. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying underclothes for women, kids, and men. She will use the profits to buy building materials for her house. 

Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy underclothes.

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarrollo 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Fiordaliza is one of the members in the group called Fuente para el desarrollo 2 & 3 (source for the development). She lives in the beautiful town of Samana with her long term partner and their two children. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

Fiordaliza is receiving her 7th loan with Esperanza Internacional. She started having Esperanza loans and became a member of this group around 4 years ago when she was started doing some business to help her family's income. She is selling cosmetics from a popular brand and who sells their products through their catalog. Fiordaliza will use this loan to buy parfum, make up, body and hands lotion and wash, and also some other products you can find in the catalog that are in high demand so she can increase her inventory. 

She intends to use her business profits to reinvest in her business and to buy different things they (herself and her family) need like clothing, shoes, and to improve her home. Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products from a catalog.

loans.name: Asociacion Para Cristo Group

texts.en:
This group is located in the rural area surrounding San Pedro D. Macoris. They all live in a big rural community, surrounded by sugarcane fields. Maria is the coordinator of the group, Asociacion D. Cristo (Association of Christ). She is mother of two children and they live together in a modest home with her long term partner who is also her kids' father. 

Maria has had her business for around 3 years, starting with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, and she will buy different products like cosmetics, accessories, hair and beauty products. Before she started doing this business she was working in a beauty salon, where she learned to become a beautician. She is also working door-to-door. With her business profits she is planning to again have her own beauty salon which she had in the past.

Maria is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and she has grown her business. In the short term future, she will be saving to reopen her beauty salon. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en:
Ibrahem is a 44-year-old man. He is married and he is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He also works part time as a taxi driver in order to improve his income. Ibrahem wants to make some necessary repairs to his taxi such as changing the engine, changing the tires, painting, etc., but the amount of money he has isn't enough to cover these expenses so he needs to take a loan in the of amount $1,500 from FATEN. 

When Ibrahem gets the loan, he will be able to pay for repairing the taxi. This will increase its efficiency and enable Ibrahem to work extra hours and increase his income and live in better conditions with his family. Ibrahem is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: to repair the taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new home appliances.

loans.name: Sana'

texts.en: Sana' is a 33 year old young woman who is married with three sons and five daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Sana' wants to pay the university fees for her son who is studying engineering, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of amount $2,000 from FATEN. When Sana' gets the loan, she will pay the university fees for her son and this will enable her son to complete his study and change his life positively. Sana' is a conservative woman, so her husband Hani is photographed instead.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for her son.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is 45 years old and a mother of eight sons and daughters, the oldest of whom is 22 years old.
After her husband retired, they prepared a small chicken house in their backyard and started a small business buying and selling chickens. That was almost four years ago and the business is still going on. Aziza has applied for a loan in order to buy more chickens to add to those she already has in order to make a bigger chicken farm.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is a 29 year old young man. He has a mobile phone store, one of his brothers has a barber shop and another is a worker with decent salary. Yousef wants to expand his store and improve it by purchasing mobile phones and their accessories in bulk to resell. He hasn't enough money to pay, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Yousef gets the loan, he will purchase more mobile phones and their accessories. This enable him to have abetter selection and the chance to compete with others  as well. He hopes to increase his profits In this way so that he will live in better living conditions. Yousef is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones and their accessories to resell.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 20-year-old single lady who works at an accessories store. She lives with her four sisters, brother and mother.
Alaa wanted to help to support her family more, so she decided to help her mother start a small home-based business selling home and kitchen products. It has now been one year since they started the business. Now Alaa has applied for a loan to purchase more products such as blankets because there is a good demand for them now.
Because Alaa is a conservative person, she has asked her mother Salima to appear in the photograph instead.

loans.use: to purchase more products for resale, such as blankets.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 43-year-old housewife who has six sons and daughters. Her husband works in a private company in Jordan.
To help support the family, Aisha opened a small food market almost ten years ago. The store is in an extended room from her house. She sells snacks, juices, and other food products such as rice, sugar, pasta, etc. 
During these ten years, Aisha did not expand her business a lot because she was concentrating on raising her children. But now she has applied for a loan in order to buy more new products and add greater variety to what she sells in order to expand her food market.

loans.use: to add more food products to her store.

loans.name: Maiada

texts.en:
Maiada is a 21-year-old single lady who lives in Irbid with her family. Three years ago, with the help of her family, she started a small home business selling clothes and blankets to neighbors, friends, and relatives. Now, through word of mouth, knowledge of her business has reached more and more customers. Maiada has applied for this loan to buy more products and new winter fashions to attract more customers during this season. 
Because Maiada is a conservative person, she asked her brother Mohammad to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy more products and new winter fashions.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 46-year-old hardworking lady. She is married to Emad, an engineer, and has three sons and daughters. Lina is also a teacher in an elementary school. Because Lina is a conservative person, she has asked her husband Emad to appear in the photo.

Almost 3 months ago, Lina opened a mini-market with her husband's help to add another source of income for the family. The mini-market's hours start after one of them gets back from their first full-time job. Although the mini-market is not open all day, it has already gained a lot of customers because of the products they sell and the good location. They are now thinking of the best way to manage the mini market hours, so it can be open all day to serve as many customers as possible. Until they find a solution, Lina has applied for this loan to buy more products so they won’t run out of items in the store.

loans.use: to buy more products for their mini market

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Nawal is a 56-year-old widow who is living with her daughter in the same house. For the last three years, Nawal has been selling women’s clothes, specifically abaya and traditional dresses. She also sells other types of women’s clothes. At present, her target customers are in her neighborhood and others in the same city. She is looking to expand and reach more women outside the city. To do so, she has applied for a loan to buy more products and clothes. The profit will allow her to open a small clothes store where people can reach her easily outside her house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes items for sale

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 43-year-old mother who has five sons and one daughter. Her husband works as a taxi driver.

Her third son is Mohammad, a freshman student who registered to study accounting. His mother Hanan has applied for this loan to be able to pay his semester tuition fees so he can continue his studies and work is the accounting field as soon as he finishes. This is what he is planning. 

Because Hanan is a conservative person, her son Mohammad, who is the student this loan was taken for, has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: To pay her son's semester tuition for college

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 46-year-old housewife who has eight sons and daughters. Three of her children have their own jobs already.
 
To be able to help her husband in supporting their big family, Hanan opened a small food market in an extended room of their house almost two years ago. Their sons and daughters also help in the store. 

Now Hanan has applied for this loan to buy more food products for her small food store. In the future, she wants to have a separate food market of her own.

Because Hanan is a conservative person, her son Ibrahim has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy more food products for her small food store

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal, a 38-year-old woman, is a mother of five sons and daughters.

Besides her husband's retirement salary, Manal chose to have another source of income by knitting, using different types and sizes of beads to decorate table covers or even tissue keepers. She also sometimes makes wooden crafts too.

It has been five years now since she started. Now Manal has applied for this loan to buy more material and beads in order to increase her productivity and make new items.

loans.use: to buy more material and beads

loans.name: Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
18 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo se han unido con la esperanza de obtener mayores ingresos y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias, ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy emprendedoras. Realizan actividades independientes, pero también actividades en conjunto, las que hacen fomentar su compañerismo.
Una de esas laboriosas mujeres es la señora Maria, quien es la presidenta del grupo, ella tiene una pequeña peluquería bien equipada, nos comenta que gracias a este negocio, ella puede sacar adelante a su familia, ya que diariamente trabaja mucho, lo cual le trae buenos ingresos. Dice que ya tiene una clientela fiel que siempre acude hasta su peluquería.
Ella desea abastecer su negocio por lo que solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de kiva, para la compra de tintes, esmaltes para uñas, spray, gel, y demás insumos, que son sus principales elementos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Eighteen women from the city of San Lorenzo have come together with the hope of obtaining better earnings, so that they can help their families. They are hard-working, determined and very entrepreneurial women. They carry out independent activities, but they also have joint projects which help them strengthen their sense of teamwork. 

One of these hard-working women is Maria, the group's president. She has a small but well-equipped beauty salon. She comments that thanks to this business, she has been able to help her family get ahead, since she works very hard each day and thus earns a good income. She says that she has a loyal customer base of people who always come back to her salon. 

She wants to stock her business, and for this reason she is asking for help from Kiva and the Paraguaya Foundation to buy hair dyes, nail polish, spray, gel and other supplies, which are the main items she needs for her work.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, nail polish, spray, gel and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy movies and music CDs

loans.name: Gloria Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Gloria es socia del banco comunal Las Aurelianas,  vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde 1999   patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, la  mezcla de su arquitectura entre lo colonial y lo moderno hacen de esta ciudad de una belleza singular, su gente es amble, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Gloria tiene 38 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 15, 7 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos  estudian en  una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Gloria se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y también presta sus servicios ya que es Licenciada en estimulación temprana y se dedica a dictar talleres cuando le solicitan su apoyo. 

Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de  libros, pelotas, colchonetas, revistas, videos, rompecabezas y otro material didáctico para sus talleres.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Las Aurelianas communal bank.  She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, which was recognized as a World Heritage Site in 1999. The mixture of colonial and modern architecture makes the city have a singular beauty.  The people of Cuenca are extremely friendly and cordial.  They maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

Gloria, age 38, is married and has three children; ages 15, 7, and 6.  Her first daughter goes to high school, and the other two attend an elementary school in the city.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They do not have their own house; they rent where they live.

Gloria devotes herself to the household chores.  As she has a degree in early childhood education, she also lends her services by conducting workshops when her support is requested.

This is her second loan with her communal bank.  She will use the loan to buy books, balls, mats, magazines, videos, puzzles, and other teaching materials for her workshops.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy books, balls, mats, magazines, videos, puzzles, and other teaching materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy replacement parts for her husband’s vehicle.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for 19 years. Ignacia earns 6000 PHP each month doing this farming. She does her best to support her family and send her children to school.

Ignacia requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Ignacia hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Junafe

texts.en:
Twentysix-year-old Junafe earns a living through farming. She is married and has 4 children. The oldest child is only 6 years old.

Junafe ventured into farming 2 years ago. She grows rice crops to sell. Junafe and her husband work together to provide for their children and send them to school.

Junafe has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. Junafe hopes for this loan to help increase their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lustrica

texts.en:
Lustrica is a 57-year-old married woman with 8 children. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Lustrica grows and sells rice. Her husband is also a farmer. They work together to improve their living conditions.

Lustrica has applied for a loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. Lustrica hopes for their farm to grow.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is fifty years old and married with four children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol in the Philippines with her family.

Mariana and her husband are both farmers; she has been farming for fourteen years. They grow rice and vegetables to sell. The couple has been able to provide for their family through the work on their farm.

Mariana has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm necessities. She hopes her farming business grows.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm necessities.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a 57-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol in the Philippines. She raises pigs for a living, fattening them to sell at the market. Martina is able to support her family in this way.

Martina plans to use her loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase piglets and feed. This loan will help Martina achieve her goals: to send her children to college and expand her piggery.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 53, is the mother of four children. Since 2005 she has sold used clothes in a local market in the Ornlong Veng district in Siem Reap province. She is skillful in her communications with her customers. Generally, she is able to earn a profit of $5.00 a day.

This loan of $1,000 will be Touch’s first loan from HKL and Kiva. She will use it to buy more used clothes for her business. In the future Touch plans to expand her shop and sell more types of clothes.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Gnek

texts.en:
Mrs. Gnek, a 47-year-old married woman, is a diligent farmer who has been living in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province. She is a loving mother of two single children, one of whom is a driver, while the other one is attending school.

Gnek grows rice crops in both the rainy season and the dry season in order to produce a high production rate, earning an income in the neighborhood of $4.00 each day. She has been in this business with experience since 2006.

At the present time, she would like to request some funds from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to pay for local laborers to harvest her rice crops. She hopes to expand her farmland and upgrade her standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: To pay for local laborers to harvest her rice crops.

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
From Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province, Mr. Chay, 61, is a retired soldier who usually assists his wife to do housework and looks after the family. He has four children, two of whom are already married, and are soldiers who live away with their wives. 

Mr. Chay’s wife helps him in earning an income by selling used clothes in a local market of the province, earning approximately $5.00 per day. But recently she has run out of her stock of clothes, and it is certain that she needs additional funds to purchase more stock again. Therefore, Mr. Chay decided to borrow some funds from Kiva to support his wife’s selling business. With the increased in income, Chay wants to fix and decorate his house.

loans.use: To purchase stock of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anazita

texts.en:
Anazita is 50-years-old, married, and has two full-grown children. Anazita is from Aguada, Ozamis City. To make a living, Anazita operates a transportation services business. Anazita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Anazita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anazita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 26,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Anazita is requesting a new loan of 33,050 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle so that she can offer better service. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Anazita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Tieng

texts.en:
Mrs. Tieng is now 53-years-old. She is a resident of the Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province. She is married with 8 children. It’s quite a big family and she has to work hard to support her family. 

She has spent most of her life cultivating crops such as rice, watermelons, beans and various other crops that depend on the season and the market’s demand. She can generate an average of $3.00 per day through farming activities, and she also gets another income from her husband who is a retired soldier. During this season, Tieng plans to grow melon and bean crops. Anyway, she needs some funds to support this project. So she decided to look for some funds from HKL and Kiva in order to purchase crop seeds for growing. She is very happy and thankful for the support in her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her farmland and grow as many kinds of crops as possible.

loans.use: to purchase crop seeds for growing.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 58 years old and married with 3 children.

Conchita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her grocery store.

Conchita has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the grocery store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending and dealing in household and beauty products.

Conchita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her grocery store
